words.example_en: The two companies decided to cooperate on the project.
words.example_zh: 两家公司决定在这个项目上合作。
words.en_def: To work or act together, especially for a common purpose or benefit.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示有……性质
words.mnemonic_zh: 一起工作的，有合作性质
words.example_en: They showed a very cooperative attitude.
words.example_zh: 他们表现出了非常合作的态度。
words.en_def: A type of company that is owned partially or wholly by its employees, customers or tenants.

sentences.en: The patient was rarely cooperative, and tended to refuse treatment.
sentences.zh: 患者很少合作，并倾向于拒绝治疗。

sentences.en: a cooperative business enterprise
sentences.zh: 合作企业

words.mnemonic_zh: 使一起有序排列就是协调
words.example_en: You need to coordinate your efforts with others.
words.example_zh: 你需要与他人协调努力。
words.en_def: A number representing the position of a point along a line, arc, or similar one-dimensional figure.

sentences.en: Give me your coordinates and we'll come and rescue you.
sentences.zh: 告诉我你的坐标，我们会来救你。

sentences.en: I was playing tennis for the first time, and it was difficult to coordinate.
sentences.zh: 我第一次打网球，协调起来很困难。

sentences.en: The outfit you're wearing doesn't coordinate.
sentences.zh: 你穿的衣服不协调。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程
words.mnemonic_zh: 协调的行为或过程
words.example_en: Good coordination is essential for a team.
words.example_zh: 良好的协调对一个团队至关重要。
words.en_def: The act of coordinating, making different people or things work together for a goal or effect.

sentences.en: I'm terrible at sports; I have no coordination.
sentences.zh: 我不擅长运动； 我没有协调能力。

words.mnemonic_zh: 负责一起有序安排的人
words.example_en: The coordinator ensured everything ran smoothly.
words.example_zh: 协调员确保一切顺利进行。
words.en_def: One who coordinates.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“铐扑”，警察常铐人、扑坏人
words.example_en: The cop caught the thief red - handed in the store.
words.example_zh: 警察在商店里当场抓住了小偷。
words.en_def: A spider.

sentences.en: When caught, he would often cop a vicious blow from his father
sentences.zh: 一旦被抓住，他常常会受到父亲的狠狠打击。

sentences.en: Harold copped to being known as "Dirty Harry".
sentences.zh: 哈罗德被称为“肮脏的哈利”。

sentences.en: The stature is bowed down in age, the cop is depressed.
sentences.zh: 年纪大了，身材低垂，警察心情郁闷。

words.mnemonic_zh: cop（警察）加 er 表示人，也指铜这种物质
words.example_en: The copper fixed the broken pipe with a copper wire.
words.example_zh: 警察用铜线修好了破裂的管道。
words.en_def: A reddish-brown, malleable, ductile metallic element with high electrical and thermal conductivity, symbol Cu, and atomic number 29.

words.mnemonic_zh: 复制的权利就是版权
words.example_en: The author protects his copyright by legal means.
words.example_zh: 作者通过法律手段保护自己的版权。
words.en_def: The right by law to be the entity which determines who may publish, copy and distribute a piece of writing, music, picture or other work of authorship.

sentences.en: Copyright is a separate legal area from trademarks.
sentences.zh: 版权是一个独立于商标的法律领域。

sentences.en: The artist lost the copyrights to her songs when she signed the contract.
sentences.zh: 当她签署合同时，艺术家就失去了她歌曲的版权。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: corpor（团体）加 ate 表示团体相关的公司性质
words.example_en: The corporate culture plays an important role in a company.
words.example_zh: 企业文化在公司中起着重要作用。
words.en_def: A bond issued by a corporation.

sentences.en: McDonald's corporate issued a new policy today.
sentences.zh: 麦当劳公司今天发布了一项新政策。

sentences.en: The one on Seventh Street is a corporate franchise.
sentences.zh: 第七街的那家是一家企业特许经营店。

words.mnemonic_zh: 强调使变正，就是改正
words.example_en: The teacher made some corrections to the students' essays.
words.example_zh: 老师对学生的作文做了一些修改。
words.en_def: The act of correcting.

sentences.en: I have four T-80 tanks at grid Three-niner-niner-four-eight-eight, Correction: Grid Three niner-niner-four-eight-five. How copy? Over.
sentences.zh: 我有四辆 T-80 坦克，排位为三九九四四八八，更正：排位三九九四八五。 怎么复制？ 超过。

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互联系起来
words.example_en: Scientists try to correlate smoking with lung cancer.
words.example_zh: 科学家试图将吸烟和肺癌联系起来。
words.en_def: Either of a pair of things related by a correlation; a correlative.

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互关联的结果
words.example_en: There is a strong correlation between exercise and health.
words.example_zh: 运动和健康之间有很强的关联。
words.en_def: A reciprocal, parallel or complementary relationship between two or more comparable objects.

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互回应，可指符合或通信
words.example_en: His actions do not correspond to his words.
words.example_zh: 他的言行不一致。
words.en_def: (constructed with to) To be equivalent or similar in character, quantity, quality, origin, structure, function etc.

sentences.en: I've been corresponding with my German pen pal for three years.
sentences.zh: 我和我的德国笔友已经通信三年了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互回应的行为或状态
words.example_en: They have kept up a correspondence for many years.
words.example_zh: 他们保持通信多年了。
words.en_def: Friendly discussion.

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互回应信息的人，即记者
words.example_en: The correspondent reported the news from the front - line.
words.example_zh: 记者从前线报道了新闻。
words.en_def: Someone who or something which corresponds.

words.suffix_cn: 动词现在分词后缀，也可作形容词后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: 一起回应，就是相应的
words.example_en: The corresponding figures for last year were much lower.
words.example_zh: 去年的相应数字要低得多。
words.en_def: (constructed with to) To be equivalent or similar in character, quantity, quality, origin, structure, function etc.

sentences.en: I've been corresponding with my German pen pal for three years.
sentences.zh: 我和我的德国笔友已经通信三年了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 完全破坏原则，就会腐败
words.example_en: Power can corrupt those who are not strong - willed.
words.example_zh: 权力会腐蚀意志不坚定的人。
words.en_def: To make corrupt; to change from good to bad; to draw away from the right path; to deprave; to pervert.

sentences.en: to corrupt a book
sentences.zh: 损坏一本书

sentences.en: The government here is corrupt, so we'll emigrate to escape them.
sentences.zh: 这里的政府很腐败，所以我们要移民以躲避他们。

sentences.en: It turned out that the program was corrupt - that's why it wouldn't open.
sentences.zh: 事实证明该程序已损坏 - 这就是它无法打开的原因。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 腐败的行为状态
words.example_en: The government is taking measures to fight corruption.
words.example_zh: 政府正在采取措施打击腐败。
words.en_def: The act of corrupting or of impairing integrity, virtue, or moral principle; the state of being corrupted or debased; loss of purity or integrity

sentences.en: a corruption of style
sentences.zh: 风格的腐败

words.mnemonic_zh: 来自世界各城市的，是世界性的
words.example_en: New York is a cosmopolitan city full of different cultures.
words.example_zh: 纽约是一座充满多元文化的世界性城市。
words.en_def: A cosmopolitan person; a cosmopolite.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 有花费性质的，就是昂贵的
words.example_en: Buying a luxury car can be a costly decision.
words.example_zh: 买一辆豪车可能是个代价高昂的决定。
words.en_def: Of high cost; expensive.

sentences.en: a costly activity
sentences.zh: 一项昂贵的活动

words.mnemonic_zh: 委员会里的人，就是议员
words.example_en: The councillor proposed a new policy for the city.
words.example_zh: 这位议员为该市提出了一项新政策。
words.en_def: A member of a council.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、活动
words.mnemonic_zh: 咨询的行为活动
words.example_en: Many students benefit from school counselling.
words.example_zh: 许多学生从学校的咨询服务中受益。
words.en_def: To give advice, especially professional advice, to (somebody).

sentences.en: Psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers and other mental health professionals counsel clients.
sentences.zh: 精神科医生、心理学家、社会工作者和其他心理健康专业人员为客户提供咨询。

sentences.en: I would counsel prudence in this matter.
sentences.zh: 我建议在这件事上要谨慎。

words.mnemonic_zh: 提供咨询的人，就是咨询师
words.example_en: The counsellor helped the patient deal with stress.
words.example_zh: 这位咨询师帮助患者应对压力。
words.en_def: A professional who counsels people, especially on personal problems.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“抗它”，在柜台前抵抗诱惑
words.example_en: He placed the books on the counter.
words.example_zh: 他把书放在了柜台上。
words.en_def: One who counts

sentences.en: He's only 16 months, but is already a good counter – he can count to 100.
sentences.zh: 他只有 16 个月大，但已经是一个很好的算数者了——他可以数到 100。

sentences.en: He rolled a six on the dice, so moved his counter forward six spaces.
sentences.zh: 他掷出的骰子是 6，因此他的计数器向前移动了六格。

sentences.en: He put his money on the counter, and the shopkeeper put it in the till.
sentences.zh: 他把钱放在柜台上，店主把钱放进收银台。

words.mnemonic_zh: 相对应的部分，就是对应物
words.example_en: The British Prime Minister met his French counterpart.
words.example_zh: 英国首相会见了法国首相。
words.en_def: Either of two parts that fit together, or complement one another.

sentences.en: Those brass knobs and their hollow counterparts interlock perfectly
sentences.zh: 那些黄铜旋钮和它们的空心对应物完美地咬合在一起

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示无、没有
words.mnemonic_zh: count（计数）+ less（无），没法计数就是无数的
words.example_en: There are countless stars in the vast night sky.
words.example_zh: 浩瀚夜空中有无数的星星。
words.en_def: Too many to count; innumerable or incalculable

sentences.en: There is a countless number of stars.
sentences.zh: 有无数的星星。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音类似“酷”，一场成功政变很酷
words.example_en: The military launched a coup and overthrew the government.
words.example_zh: 军方发动政变推翻了政府。
words.en_def: A quick, brilliant, and highly successful act.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…的性质
words.mnemonic_zh: courage（勇气）+ ous（有…性质），有勇气的就是勇敢的
words.example_en: The courageous firefighter rushed into the burning building.
words.example_zh: 勇敢的消防员冲进了燃烧的大楼。
words.en_def: Of a person, displaying or possessing courage.

sentences.en: the most courageous person I have ever met
sentences.zh: 我见过的最勇敢的人

sentences.en: a courageous deed
sentences.zh: 勇敢的行为

words.mnemonic_zh: 和 court（宫廷）联想，宫廷里讲究礼貌
words.example_en: He showed courtesy to the elderly lady by offering his seat.
words.example_zh: 他给那位老妇人让座，以示礼貌。
words.en_def: Polite behavior.

sentences.en: He was always known for his grace, kindness, and courtesy to people of every rank.
sentences.zh: 他总是以他对各个阶层的人的优雅、善良和礼貌而闻名。

sentences.en: I offered them a ride simply as a courtesy.
sentences.zh: 我只是出于礼貌而邀请他们搭车。

sentences.en: They call this pond a lake by courtesy only.
sentences.zh: 他们只是出于礼貌才称这个池塘为湖。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“可卧”，能用来躺上面，似有覆盖之意
words.example_en: Snow covered the whole city overnight.
words.example_zh: 一夜之间，雪覆盖了整个城市。
words.en_def: A lid.

sentences.en: The soldiers took cover behind a ruined building.
sentences.zh: 士兵们躲在一栋废墟后面。

sentences.en: There's a $15 cover tonight.
sentences.zh: 今晚有 15 美元的封面。

sentences.en: We need to set another cover for the Smith party.
sentences.zh: 我们需要为史密斯派对设置另一个掩护。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态等
words.mnemonic_zh: cover（覆盖、报道）+ age（表状态），即覆盖范围或报道情况
words.example_en: The TV station provided extensive coverage of the event.
words.example_zh: 电视台对该事件进行了广泛报道。
words.en_def: An amount by which something or someone is covered.

sentences.en: Before laying sod on that clay, the ground needs two inches of coverage with topsoil.
sentences.zh: 在粘土上铺草皮之前，地面需要覆盖两英寸的表土。

sentences.en: Mobile phone coverage is poor in some areas.
sentences.zh: 某些地区的移动电话覆盖率较差。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“刻 raft（筏子）”，刻筏子是种手艺
words.example_en: She learned the craft of pottery in a small village.
words.example_zh: 她在一个小村庄里学会了制陶手艺。
words.en_def: Strength; power; might; force .

sentences.en: The craft of writing plays.
sentences.zh: 写作技巧发挥着作用。

sentences.en: He learned his craft as an apprentice.
sentences.zh: 他作为学徒学习了自己的手艺。

sentences.en: She represented the craft of brewers.
sentences.zh: 她代表了酿酒师的工艺。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像碰撞坠毁的声音
words.example_en: The plane crashed into the mountains due to bad weather.
words.example_zh: 由于恶劣天气，飞机坠毁在山区。
words.en_def: A sudden, intense, loud sound, as made for example by cymbals.

sentences.en: After the lightning came the crash of thunder.
sentences.zh: 闪电过后，便是雷霆轰鸣。

sentences.en: Nobody survived the plane crash
sentences.zh: 飞机失事无人幸存

sentences.en: My computer had a crash so I had to reboot it.
sentences.zh: 我的电脑崩溃了，所以我不得不重新启动它。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“可揉”，爬行时身体像可揉动一样
words.example_en: The baby began to crawl across the room.
words.example_zh: 婴儿开始爬过房间。
words.en_def: The act of moving slowly on hands and knees etc, or with frequent stops.

sentences.en: My computer has slowed down to a crawl since I installed that software package.
sentences.zh: 自从我安装了该软件包后，我的电脑速度就慢得像爬行一样。

sentences.en: Clutching my wounded side, I crawled back to the trench.
sentences.zh: 我抓着受伤的一侧，爬回战壕。

sentences.en: The rush-hour traffic crawled around the bypass.
sentences.zh: 高峰时段的交通在绕行道上缓慢行驶。

words.mnemonic_zh: create（创造）+ or（人），即创造者
words.example_en: The creator of this masterpiece spent years on it.
words.example_zh: 这部杰作的创作者为此花费了数年时间。
words.en_def: Something or someone which creates or makes something.

sentences.en: Kenneth E. Iverson was the creator of APL.
sentences.zh: 肯尼思·艾弗森 (Kenneth E. Iverson) 是 APL 的创始人。

sentences.en: creator economy
sentences.zh: 创造者经济

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示具备某种性质或能力
words.mnemonic_zh: cred（相信）加上 ibility（性质），就是可信性
words.example_en: The credibility of this news source has been questioned recently.
words.example_zh: 最近，这个新闻来源的可靠性受到了质疑。
words.en_def: Reputation impacting one's ability to be believed.

words.mnemonic_zh: cred（相信）加 ible（可…的），即可信的
words.example_en: He gave a credible explanation for his absence.
words.example_zh: 他为自己的缺席给出了可信的解释。
words.en_def: Believable or plausible.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可锐普”，可想象尖锐物体前慢慢爬行
words.example_en: The snake began to creep through the grass.
words.example_zh: 蛇开始在草丛中爬行。
words.en_def: To move slowly with the abdomen close to the ground.

sentences.en: christmas creep
sentences.zh: 圣诞节蠕动

sentences.en: Stop following me, you creep!
sentences.zh: 别再跟着我了，你这个变态！

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态等
words.mnemonic_zh: criter（评判）加 ion（名词后缀），即评判的标准
words.example_en: We need clear criteria to evaluate this project.
words.example_zh: 我们需要明确的标准来评估这个项目。
words.en_def: A standard or test by which individual things or people may be compared and judged.

sentences.en: Criterion of choice, of decision, of selection
sentences.zh: 选择、决定、选择的标准

words.mnemonic_zh: crit（批评）加 ic（人），就是批评家
words.example_en: The critic gave a harsh review of the new movie.
words.example_zh: 这位评论家对这部新电影给出了严厉的评价。
words.en_def: A person who appraises the works of others.

sentences.en: Bob liked most of my presentation, but offered three minor critiques.
sentences.zh: 鲍勃喜欢我的大部分演讲，但提出了三个小批评。

words.suffix_cn: 名词或动词后缀，表评论等
words.mnemonic_zh: crit（批评）加 ique，就是批评评论
words.example_en: The professor's critique of the paper was very insightful.
words.example_zh: 教授对这篇论文的评论很有见地。
words.en_def: The art of criticism.

sentences.en: Bob liked most of my presentation, but offered three minor critiques.
sentences.zh: 鲍勃喜欢我的大部分演讲，但提出了三个小批评。

sentences.en: I want you to critique this new idea of mine.
sentences.zh: 我希望你批评我的这个新想法。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: cross（穿过）加 ing，穿过的地方即十字路口
words.example_en: Be careful when you pass the crossing.
words.example_zh: 你经过十字路口时要小心。
words.en_def: To make or form a cross.

sentences.en: They managed to cross a sheep with a goat.
sentences.zh: 他们成功地将绵羊与山羊杂交。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可绕的”，一群人可绕着走
words.example_en: A large crowd gathered in the square.
words.example_zh: 一大群人聚集在广场上。
words.en_def: A group of people congregated or collected into a close body without order.

sentences.en: After the movie let out, a crowd of people pushed through the exit doors.
sentences.zh: 电影上映后，一群人挤进了出口门。

sentences.en: There was a crowd of toys pushed beneath the couch where the children were playing.
sentences.zh: 孩子们正在玩耍的沙发底下堆满了一堆玩具。

sentences.en: That obscure author's fans were a nerdy crowd which hardly ever interacted before the Internet age.
sentences.zh: 这位默默无闻的作者的粉丝是一群书呆子，在互联网时代之前几乎没有互动。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可荣”，戴上皇冠很荣耀
words.example_en: The king placed the crown on his head.
words.example_zh: 国王把王冠戴在了自己头上。
words.en_def: A royal, imperial or princely headdress; a diadem.

sentences.en: the martyr's crown
sentences.zh: 烈士的王冠

sentences.en: Treasure recovered from shipwrecks automatically becomes property of the Crown.
sentences.zh: 从沉船中打捞出来的宝藏自动成为国王的财产。

sentences.en: The mother was in the second stage of labor and the fetus had just crowned, prompting a round of encouragement from the midwives.
sentences.zh: 产妇正处于第二产程，胎儿刚刚出生，助产士们不断地鼓励。

words.cn_def: 粗糙的；天然的；未加工的
words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可入的”，未加工的东西易入眼看出粗糙
words.example_en: Crude oil is an important energy resource.
words.example_zh: 原油是一种重要的能源资源。
words.en_def: Any substance in its natural state.

sentences.en: crude oil
sentences.zh: 原油

sentences.en: a crude shelter
sentences.zh: 简陋的庇护所

sentences.en: a crude truth
sentences.zh: 一个粗俗的事实

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可rush”，可猛冲去压碎东西
words.example_en: The heavy box will crush the fragile items inside.
words.example_zh: 那个沉重的箱子会把里面易碎的物品压坏。
words.en_def: A violent collision or compression; a crash; destruction; ruin.

sentences.en: a crush at a reception
sentences.zh: 接待处的暗恋

sentences.en: I've had a huge crush on her since we met many years ago.
sentences.zh: 自从我们多年前见面以来，我就非常迷恋她。

sentences.en: to crush grapes
sentences.zh: 压碎葡萄

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可锐透”，水晶可尖锐透明
words.example_en: This beautiful crystal is a precious gift from her friend.
words.example_zh: 这块漂亮的水晶是她朋友送的珍贵礼物。
words.en_def: A solid composed of an array of atoms or molecules possessing long-range order and arranged in a pattern which is periodic in three dimensions.

sentences.en: "Do I make myself clear?" / "Crystal."
sentences.zh: “我说清楚了吗？” / “水晶。”

words.mnemonic_zh: 可联想培养出的极端信仰
words.example_en: The cult has some strange and extreme beliefs.
words.example_zh: 这个异教有一些奇怪且极端的信仰。
words.en_def: A group or sect of people with a deviant religious, philosophical or cultural identity, often existing on the margins of society or exploitative towards its members.

sentences.en: Oh my gosh, I'm in a repressive cult! How can I leave it?
sentences.zh: 哦天哪，我身处一个压制性的邪教之中！ 我怎么能离开它呢？

sentences.en: a cult horror movie
sentences.zh: 一部邪教恐怖电影

sentences.en: You gotta wear make-up at kvlt gigs or you'll be thrown out.
sentences.zh: 在 kvlt 演出时你必须化妆，否则你会被赶出去。

words.mnemonic_zh: cult（培养）+ ivate，使培养成习惯
words.example_en: We should cultivate good study habits from childhood.
words.example_zh: 我们应该从小培养良好的学习习惯。
words.en_def: To grow plants, notably crops

sentences.en: Most farmers in this region cultivate maize.
sentences.zh: 该地区的大多数农民种植玉米。

sentences.en: They tried to cultivate an interest in learning among their students.
sentences.zh: 他们试图培养学生的学习兴趣。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: cultivate（培养）去掉 e 加 ion，培养的结果
words.example_en: The cultivation of crops requires a lot of hard work.
words.example_zh: 农作物的耕种需要付出很多辛勤劳动。
words.en_def: The art or act of cultivating; improvement of land for or by agriculture

sentences.en: The heavy cultivation of the hillside led to soil erosion.
sentences.zh: 山坡上的大量耕种导致水土流失。

sentences.en: These fields are in cultivation.
sentences.zh: 这些田地正在耕种中。

sentences.en: His steadfast cultivation of their relationship finally bore fruit.
sentences.zh: 他对他们关系的不懈培养终于结出硕果。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“可愈”，可以治愈
words.example_en: This new medicine can cure many diseases.
words.example_zh: 这种新药能治愈很多疾病。
words.en_def: A method, device or medication that restores good health.

sentences.en: Unaided nature cured him.
sentences.zh: 自然的帮助治愈了他。

sentences.en: Unaided nature cured his ailments.
sentences.zh: 自然的帮助治愈了他的疾病。

sentences.en: Experience will cure him of his naïveté.
sentences.zh: 经验会治愈他的天真。

words.mnemonic_zh: cur（关心）+ iosity，对事物关心产生好奇
words.example_en: Her curiosity led her to explore the unknown world.
words.example_zh: 她的好奇心驱使她去探索未知世界。
words.en_def: (uncountable) Inquisitiveness; the tendency to ask and learn about things by asking questions, investigating, or exploring.

sentences.en: He put the strangely shaped rock in his curiosity cabinet.
sentences.zh: 他把这块形状奇怪的石头放进了他的好奇柜里。

words.mnemonic_zh: cust（看管）+ ody，看管的状态即监护
words.example_en: The child is in the custody of his grandparents.
words.example_zh: 这个孩子由他的祖父母监护。
words.en_def: The legal right to take care of something or somebody, especially children.

sentences.en: The court awarded custody to the child's father.
sentences.zh: 法院将监护权判给了孩子的父亲。

sentences.en: I couldn't pay the bill and now my passport is in custody of the hotel management.
sentences.zh: 我无法支付账单，现在我的护照由酒店管理人员保管。

sentences.en: He was mistreated while in police custody.
sentences.zh: 他在警方拘留期间受到虐待。

words.mnemonic_zh: custom（习俗）+ ary，与习俗有关即惯例的
words.example_en: It is customary to exchange gifts during festivals.
words.example_zh: 节日期间交换礼物是一种习俗。
words.en_def: A book containing laws and usages, or customs; a custumal.

sentences.en: customary tenants
sentences.zh: 习惯租户

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“咔它”，切割时有咔的声音
words.example_en: He used a sharp knife to cut the bread.
words.example_zh: 他用一把锋利的刀切面包。
words.en_def: The act of cutting.

sentences.en: He made a fine cut with his sword.
sentences.zh: 他用剑划出了一道细痕。

sentences.en: a smooth or clear cut
sentences.zh: 光滑或清晰的切口

sentences.en: Look at this cut on my finger!
sentences.zh: 看看我手指上的伤口！

words.suffix_cn: 向后，此处表示削减动作的结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 把东西切回去，就是削减
words.example_en: The company made a cutback in its advertising budget this year.
words.example_zh: 该公司今年削减了广告预算。
words.en_def: A reduction of some sort in an existing program.

words.suffix_cn: 动词的现在分词形式，也可作形容词后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: 切割的动作让人感觉很尖锐
words.example_en: She gave him a cutting remark that made him feel bad.
words.example_zh: 她对他说了句尖刻的话，让他很不好受。
words.en_def: (heading) To incise, to cut into the surface of something.

sentences.en: After the actors read their lines, the director yelled, "Cut!"
sentences.zh: 演员们念完台词后，导演喊道：“停！”

sentences.en: The camera then cut to the woman on the front row who was clearly overcome and crying tears of joy.
sentences.zh: 然后镜头切到前排的那位女士，她显然被感动了，流下了喜悦的泪水。

sentences.en: Select the text, cut it, and then paste it in the other application.
sentences.zh: 选择文本，剪切它，然后将其粘贴到其他应用程序中。

words.cn_def: 愤世嫉俗的；冷嘲热讽的
words.mnemonic_zh: 像愤世嫉俗者一样的
words.example_en: He has a cynical attitude towards politicians' promises.
words.example_zh: 他对政客的承诺持愤世嫉俗的态度。
words.en_def: Of or relating to the belief that human actions are motivated only or primarily by base desires or selfishness.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“挡”，水坝就是挡水的
words.example_en: The dam holds back the water of the river.
words.example_zh: 水坝拦住了河水。
words.en_def: A structure placed across a flowing body of water to stop the flow or part of the flow, generally for purposes such as retaining or diverting some of the water or retarding the release of accumulated water to avoid abrupt flooding.

sentences.en: A dam is often an essential source of water to farmers of hilly country.
sentences.zh: 大坝通常是丘陵地区农民的重要水源。

sentences.en: Boats may only be used at places set aside for boating on the dam.
sentences.zh: 船只只能在大坝上划船的地方使用。

words.suffix_cn: 动词的现在分词形式，也可作形容词后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: 正在造成损害的
words.example_en: The scandal had a damaging effect on his reputation.
words.example_zh: 这一丑闻对他的声誉造成了损害。
words.en_def: To impair the soundness, goodness, or value of; to harm or cause destruction.

sentences.en: Be careful not to damage any of the fragile items while unpacking them.
sentences.zh: 打开包装时小心不要损坏任何易碎物品。

sentences.en: The politician resigned after damaging information was revealed.
sentences.zh: 这位政客在破坏性信息被披露后辞职。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“大黑”，又大又黑就是黑暗
words.example_en: It's too dark to read without a light.
words.example_zh: 没有灯光太暗了，没法看书。
words.en_def: Having an absolute or (more often) relative lack of light.

sentences.en: The room was too dark for reading.
sentences.zh: 房间太暗了，不适合看书。

sentences.en: my sister's hair is darker than mine;  her skin grew dark with a suntan
sentences.zh: 我姐姐的头发比我的黑； 她的皮肤因晒黑而变黑

sentences.en: a dark villain;  a dark deed
sentences.zh: 一个黑暗的恶棍； 黑暗的行为

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“得”，约会时要得到对方同意
words.example_en: Can you tell me the date of the meeting?
words.example_zh: 你能告诉我会议的日期吗？
words.en_def: The fruit of the date palm, Phoenix dactylifera, somewhat in the shape of an olive, containing a soft, sweet pulp and enclosing a hard kernel.

sentences.en: We made a nice cake from dates.
sentences.zh: 我们用枣做了一个漂亮的蛋糕。

sentences.en: There were a few dates planted around the house.
sentences.zh: 房子周围种了几颗枣子。

sentences.en: the date of a letter, of a will, of a deed, of a coin, etc.
sentences.zh: 信件、遗嘱、契约、硬币等的日期。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“到”，黎明到了
words.example_en: The birds start singing at dawn every day.
words.example_zh: 鸟儿每天黎明时分开始歌唱。
words.en_def: The morning twilight period immediately before sunrise.

sentences.en: She rose before dawn to meet the train.
sentences.zh: 她在黎明前起床去迎接火车。

sentences.en: the dawn of civilization
sentences.zh: 文明的黎明

sentences.en: A new day dawns.
sentences.zh: 新的一天即将来临。

words.mnemonic_zh: 白天进行照料
words.example_en: Many parents send their kids to daycare centers.
words.example_zh: 许多家长把孩子送到日托中心。
words.en_def: Daytime supervision, usually of children.

words.mnemonic_zh: 白天做的梦就是白日梦
words.example_en: She often has daydreams about traveling around the world.
words.example_zh: 她经常幻想环游世界。
words.en_def: A spontaneous and fanciful series of thoughts while awake not connected to immediate reality.

sentences.en: Stop daydreaming and get back to work!
sentences.zh: 别再做白日梦了，回去工作吧！

words.mnemonic_zh: day加s变复数就是很多天
words.example_en: He spent several days finishing this project.
words.example_zh: 他花了好几天完成这个项目。
words.en_def: Any period of 24 hours.

sentences.en: I've been here for two days and a bit.
sentences.zh: 我来这里已经两天多了。

sentences.en: The day begins at midnight.
sentences.zh: 这一天从午夜开始。

sentences.en: A day on Mars is slightly over 24 hours.
sentences.zh: 火星上的一天略多于 24 小时。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“呆的”，没生气像死了
words.example_en: The dead tree was cut down last week.
words.example_zh: 那棵枯树上周被砍掉了。
words.en_def: (with "the", a demonstrative, or a possessive) Those who have died.

sentences.en: Have respect for the dead.
sentences.zh: 尊重死者。

sentences.en: The dead of night. The dead of winter.
sentences.zh: 夜深人静。 冬天的死寂。

sentences.en: All of my grandparents are dead.
sentences.zh: 我所有的祖父母都死了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“得不如碎”，东西散成碎片
words.example_en: The debris after the explosion was everywhere.
words.example_zh: 爆炸后的碎片到处都是。
words.en_def: Rubble, wreckage, scattered remains of something destroyed.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“得步”，迈出第一步登台
words.example_en: Her debut in the play was a great success.
words.example_zh: 她在这部戏里的首次登台大获成功。
words.en_def: A performer's first performance to the public, in sport, the arts or some other area.

sentences.en: Since making its debut two years ago, the program has gained cult status.
sentences.zh: 自两年前首次亮相以来，该节目已获得了狂热的关注。

sentences.en: Amalgamated Software Systems debuted release 3.2 in Spring of 2004.
sentences.zh: Amalgamated Software Systems 于 2004 年春季推出了 3.2 版。

sentences.en: Release 3.2 debuted to mixed reviews in Spring of 2004.
sentences.zh: 3.2 版于 2004 年春季首次推出，评价褒贬不一。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…性质
words.mnemonic_zh: decide去掉e加ive，有决定性质的
words.example_en: This is a decisive moment for our company.
words.example_zh: 这对我们公司来说是个决定性的时刻。
words.en_def: Having the power or quality of deciding a question or controversy; putting an end to contest or controversy; final; conclusive.

sentences.en: A decisive battle is fatal for one side's war chances
sentences.zh: 决战对一方战机来说是致命的

sentences.en: A noble instance of this attribute of the decisive character. -J. Foster.
sentences.zh: 这是决定性性格这一属性的一个崇高例子。 -J。 促进。

words.mnemonic_zh: de强调，clar弄清楚，ation变名词，声明讲清事
words.example_en: The government issued a declaration on this issue.
words.example_zh: 政府就这个问题发表了一份声明。
words.en_def: A written or oral indication of a fact, opinion, or belief.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…特征
words.mnemonic_zh: de强调，dic说，ated变形容词，一心说要做
words.example_en: The dedicated teacher always helps his students.
words.example_zh: 这位敬业的老师总是帮助他的学生。
words.en_def: To set apart for a deity or for religious purposes; consecrate.

sentences.en: dedicated their money to scientific research.
sentences.zh: 将他们的钱用于科学研究。

sentences.en: dedicated ourselves to starting our own business.
sentences.zh: 致力于开创自己的事业。

sentences.en: dedicate a monument.
sentences.zh: 奉献一座纪念碑。

words.mnemonic_zh: de强调，dic说，ation变名词，说出奉献的话
words.example_en: His dedication to the project is admirable.
words.example_zh: 他对这个项目的奉献精神令人钦佩。
words.en_def: The act of dedicating or the state of being dedicated.

words.mnemonic_zh: de向下，duct引导，ion变名词，向下引导得出推论或扣除
words.example_en: The deduction of taxes is necessary every month.
words.example_zh: 每月扣除税款是必要的。
words.en_def: That which is deducted; that which is subtracted or removed

sentences.en: You might want to donate the old junk and just take the deduction.
sentences.zh: 您可能想捐赠旧垃圾并只接受扣除。

sentences.en: He arrived at the deduction that the butler didn't do it.
sentences.zh: 他推断管家没有这么做。

sentences.en: Through his powers of deduction, he realized that the plan would never work.
sentences.zh: 通过他的推理能力，他意识到这个计划永远不会成功。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“地的”，地上做的事
words.example_en: His heroic deeds are widely praised.
words.example_zh: 他的英雄事迹受到广泛赞扬。
words.en_def: An action or act; something that is done.

sentences.en: I have fulfilled my promise in word and in deed.
sentences.zh: 我已经在言语和行动上履行了我的承诺。

sentences.en: I inherited the deed to the house.
sentences.zh: 我继承了房子的地契。

sentences.en: He deeded over the mineral rights to some fellas from Denver.
sentences.zh: 他将矿权转让给了丹佛的一些人。

words.mnemonic_zh: “迪姆”认为自己很棒
words.example_en: The court deems his action as illegal.
words.example_zh: 法庭认为他的行为是违法的。
words.en_def: An opinion, a judgment, a surmise.

sentences.en: She deemed his efforts insufficient.
sentences.zh: 她认为他的努力还不够。

words.mnemonic_zh: 让深度增加，即加深
words.example_en: Reading more books can deepen your understanding.
words.example_zh: 多读些书可以加深你的理解。
words.en_def: To make deep or deeper

sentences.en: They deepened the well by 200 feet.
sentences.zh: 他们将井加深了 200 英尺。

sentences.en: The event deepened the prevailing gloom.
sentences.zh: 该事件加深了普遍的忧郁情绪。

sentences.en: News of her death deepened my sorrow.
sentences.zh: 她去世的消息加深了我的悲伤。

words.mnemonic_zh: 偏离正确做法，即违约；常用状态即默认
words.example_en: He defaulted on the loan payment last month.
words.example_zh: 他上个月贷款违约了。
words.en_def: The condition of failing to meet an obligation.

sentences.en: He failed to make payments on time and is now in default.
sentences.zh: 他未能按时付款，现已违约。

sentences.en: The team's three losses include one default.
sentences.zh: 该队的三场失利包括一场违约。

sentences.en: The man became the leader of the group as a default.
sentences.zh: 该男子默认成为该团体的领导者。

words.mnemonic_zh: 没做好，所以有缺点
words.example_en: The defect in the machine caused the accident.
words.example_zh: 机器的缺陷导致了事故。
words.en_def: A fault or malfunction.

sentences.en: a defect in the ear or eye; a defect in timber or iron; a defect of memory or judgment
sentences.zh: 耳朵或眼睛有缺陷； 木材或铁的缺陷； 记忆或判断力缺陷

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 抵挡危险，就是防御
words.example_en: The country加强 its defence against potential threats.
words.example_zh: 该国加强了对潜在威胁的防御。
words.en_def: The action of defending, of protecting from attack, danger or injury.

sentences.en: Department of Defence
sentences.zh: 国防部

words.mnemonic_zh: 抵挡危险来保卫
words.example_en: They defend their homeland bravely.
words.example_zh: 他们勇敢地保卫自己的祖国。
words.en_def: To ward off attacks against; to fight to protect; to guard.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，具有……性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 有抵挡性质的，即防御性的
words.example_en: He took a defensive stance in the argument.
words.example_zh: 他在争论中采取了防御性的姿态。
words.en_def: A means, attitude or position of defense.

sentences.en: a defensive perimeter
sentences.zh: 防守范围

sentences.en: a defensive missile system
sentences.zh: 防御导弹系统

sentences.en: defensive driving
sentences.zh: 防御性驾驶

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示状态、性质
words.mnemonic_zh: 没做好，所以有不足
words.example_en: The deficiency of vitamins affects his health.
words.example_zh: 维生素的缺乏影响了他的健康。
words.en_def: Inadequacy or incompleteness.

words.mnemonic_zh: 没做好，导致亏损
words.example_en: The company suffered a large deficit last year.
words.example_zh: 该公司去年出现了巨额亏损。
words.en_def: Deficiency in amount or quality; a falling short; lack.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 强调划出界限，即给出定义
words.example_zh: Can you give a clear definition of this concept?
words.example_en: 你能给这个概念下一个清晰的定义吗？
words.en_def: A statement of the meaning of a word or word group or a sign or symbol (dictionary definitions).

sentences.en: Her comic genius is beyond definition.
sentences.zh: 她的喜剧天赋是无法定义的。

sentences.en: Improve the definition of an image.
sentences.zh: 提高图像的清晰度。

sentences.en: A jacket with distinct waist definition.
sentences.zh: 腰部轮廓分明的夹克。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（反）+ fy（做），反着做就是违抗
words.example_en: He decided to defy the unjust rule and fight for his rights.
words.example_zh: 他决定违抗不公正的规定，为自己的权利而斗争。
words.en_def: A challenge.

sentences.en: to defy an enemy;   to defy the power of a magistrate;   to defy the arguments of an opponent;   to defy public opinion
sentences.zh: 反抗敌人； 藐视地方法官的权力； 无视对手的论点； 不顾舆论

sentences.en: If you defy your teacher you may end up in detention.
sentences.zh: 如果你反抗老师，你可能会被拘留。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（下）+ leg（选）+ ate，向下选人委派
words.example_en: The manager will delegate some tasks to his subordinates.
words.example_zh: 经理将把一些任务委派给他的下属。
words.en_def: A person authorized to act as representative for another; a deputy

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: delegate（委派）+ ation，委派的人组成代表团
words.example_en: A delegation from the company visited the partner's factory.
words.example_zh: 公司的一个代表团参观了合作伙伴的工厂。
words.en_def: An act of delegating.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“得嘞，凯特”，想象凯特拿着精致物品
words.example_en: She handled the delicate vase with great care.
words.example_zh: 她非常小心地拿着那个易碎的花瓶。
words.en_def: A delicate item of clothing, especially underwear or lingerie.

sentences.en: Don't put that in with your jeans: it's a delicate!
sentences.zh: 不要把它和牛仔裤放在一起：它很脆弱！

sentences.en: The negotiations were very delicate.
sentences.zh: 谈判非常微妙。

sentences.en: Her face was delicate.
sentences.zh: 她的脸很精致。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（强调）+ liver（给），强调给予就是递送
words.example_en: The postman will deliver the letters to your house tomorrow.
words.example_zh: 邮递员明天会把信件送到你家。
words.en_def: To set free from restraint or danger.

sentences.en: deliver a captive from the prison
sentences.zh: 将一名俘虏从监狱中解救出来

sentences.en: deliver a package;  deliver the mail
sentences.zh: 交付包裹； 递送邮件

sentences.en: deliver the thief to the police
sentences.zh: 将小偷交给警察

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“敌猛”，敌人很猛像恶魔
words.example_en: In the story, the hero fought against the powerful demon.
words.example_zh: 在故事中，英雄与强大的恶魔战斗。
words.en_def: An evil supernatural spirit.

sentences.en: He’s a demon at the card tables.
sentences.zh: 他是牌桌上的恶魔。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（强调）+ monstr（显示）+ ate，强调显示就是证明
words.example_en: The scientist demonstrated the new theory with experiments.
words.example_zh: 科学家用实验证明了新理论。
words.en_def: To show how to use (something).

sentences.en: Can you demonstrate the new tools for us?
sentences.zh: 您能为我们演示一下新工具吗？

sentences.en: Those people outside are demonstrating against the election results.
sentences.zh: 外面的人正在示威反对选举结果。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: demonstrate（证明）+ ation，证明的行为或活动
words.example_en: There was a large demonstration in the city center yesterday.
words.example_zh: 昨天市中心有一场大规模的示威游行。
words.en_def: The act of demonstrating; showing or explaining something.

sentences.en: I have to give a demonstration to the class tomorrow, and I'm ill-prepared.
sentences.zh: 明天我必须给全班做演示，而我准备不足。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: de（否定）+ ni（拒绝）+ al，否定拒绝的行为
words.example_en: His denial of the accusation surprised everyone.
words.example_zh: 他对指控的否认让每个人都很惊讶。
words.en_def: The negation in logic.

sentences.en: The denial of "There might be X" is the null, "False, there is no X."
sentences.zh: 否认“可能有X”是无效的，“假，不存在X”。

sentences.en: Every time we asked for an interview we got a denial.
sentences.zh: 每次我们要求采访时都遭到拒绝。

sentences.en: The singer has issued a sweeping denial of all the rumors.
sentences.zh: 这位歌手彻底否认了所有谣言。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（强调）+ nounce（宣布），强调宣布坏事就是谴责
words.example_en: The public denounced the politician's corrupt behavior.
words.example_zh: 公众谴责了这位政治家的腐败行为。
words.en_def: To make known in a formal manner; to proclaim; to announce; to declare.

sentences.en: to denounce someone as a swindler, or as a coward
sentences.zh: 谴责某人是骗子或胆小鬼

sentences.en: to denounce a confederate in crime
sentences.zh: 谴责犯罪同伙

sentences.en: to denounce war; to denounce punishment
sentences.zh: 谴责战争； 谴责惩罚

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘等死’，人密集的地方易被困等‘死’。
words.example_en: The forest is so dense that sunlight can hardly penetrate.
words.example_zh: 这片森林如此茂密，阳光几乎无法穿透。
words.en_def: A thicket.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: dens（密集）+ity，表密集的性质即‘密度’。
words.example_en: The density of population in big cities is very high.
words.example_zh: 大城市的人口密度非常高。
words.en_def: A measure of the mass of matter contained by a unit volume.

sentences.en: The number of particles per unit volume of a specified volume can be considered to be the particle density for the specified volume.
sentences.zh: 指定体积的每单位体积的颗粒数可以被认为是指定体积的颗粒密度。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（去除）+odor（气味）+ant，能去除气味的东西。
words.example_en: He always uses deodorant to keep fresh.
words.example_zh: 他总是使用除臭剂来保持清爽。
words.en_def: Any agent acting to eliminate, reduce, mask, or control odor.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: de（加强）+pend（依赖）+ence，强调依赖的状态。
words.example_en: The country's economic development shows some dependence on imports.
words.example_zh: 该国的经济发展表现出对进口有一定的依赖。
words.en_def: The state of being dependent, of relying upon another.

sentences.en: He had a deep dependence on her for guidance.
sentences.zh: 他非常依赖她的指导。

sentences.en: Her dependence on cocaine led to her ruin.
sentences.zh: 她对可卡因的依赖导致了她的毁灭。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（加强）+pict（画），使劲画出来即‘描绘’。
words.example_en: The novel depicts the life of ordinary people vividly.
words.example_zh: 这部小说生动地描绘了普通人的生活。
words.en_def: To render a representation of something, using words, sounds, images, or other means.

words.mnemonic_zh: de（使）+ploy（展开），使展开就像‘部署’兵力。
words.example_en: The military decided to deploy troops to the border.
words.example_zh: 军方决定向边境部署军队。
words.en_def: Deployment

sentences.en: "Deploy two units of infantry along the enemy's flank," the general ordered.
sentences.zh: “沿敌人侧翼部署两个步兵单位，”将军下令。

sentences.en: He waited tensely for his parachute to deploy.
sentences.zh: 他紧张地等待着降落伞展开。

sentences.en: The process for the deployment scenario includes: building a master installation of the operating system, creating its image and deploying the image onto a destination computer.
sentences.zh: 部署场景的过程包括：构建操作系统的主安装、创建其映像并将映像部署到目标计算机上。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: deploy（部署）+ment，表部署的行为或结果。
words.example_en: The deployment of resources requires careful planning.
words.example_zh: 资源的调配需要精心规划。
words.en_def: An arrangement or classification of things.

words.cn_def: 存放；存款（动词义为存放，名词义为存款）
words.mnemonic_zh: de（向下）+posit（放置），向下放置钱即‘存款’。
words.example_en: She went to the bank to deposit some money yesterday.
words.example_zh: 她昨天去银行存了一些钱。
words.en_def: Sediment or rock that is not native to its present location or is different from the surrounding material. Sometimes refers to ore or gems.

sentences.en: a deposit of seaweed on the shore
sentences.zh: 海岸上的海藻沉积物

sentences.en: They put a deposit on the apartment.
sentences.zh: 他们为公寓付了押金。

sentences.en: A crocodile deposits her eggs in the sand.
sentences.zh: 鳄鱼将卵产在沙子里。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（剥夺）+priv（个人的）+e，剥夺个人的东西。
words.example_en: The accident deprived him of his ability to walk.
words.example_zh: 这场事故使他丧失了行走能力。
words.en_def: To take something away from (someone) and keep it away; to deny someone something.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成
words.mnemonic_zh: deprive（剥夺）+ed，被剥夺的状态即贫困的。
words.example_en: Children from deprived families need more care.
words.example_zh: 来自贫困家庭的孩子需要更多关爱。
words.en_def: To take something away from (someone) and keep it away; to deny someone something.

words.mnemonic_zh: de 向下委派 put 的人，就是副职
words.example_en: The deputy will handle the daily affairs during the manager's absence.
words.example_zh: 经理不在时，副职将处理日常事务。
words.en_def: One appointed as the substitute of another, and empowered to act for them, in their name or their behalf; a substitute in office

sentences.en: As the deputy store manager, he is able to fire staff.
sentences.zh: 作为店副经理，他有权解雇员工。

sentences.en: At today's meeting, Deputy Ryan will speak on local issues.
sentences.zh: 在今天的会议上，瑞安副议员将就当地问题发表讲话。

sentences.en: The sheriff's deputies took the suspect into custody.
sentences.zh: 治安官的代表将嫌疑人拘留。

words.mnemonic_zh: de 向下 scend 走，就是下降
words.example_en: The plane began to descend as it approached the airport.
words.example_zh: 飞机接近机场时开始下降。
words.en_def: To pass from a higher to a lower place; to move downwards; to come or go down in any way, for example by falling, flowing, walking, climbing etc.

sentences.en: The rain descended, and the floods came.
sentences.zh: 雨倾盆而下，洪水来了。

sentences.en: And on the suitors let thy wrath descend.
sentences.zh: 让你的愤怒降临在追求者身上。

sentences.en: he descended from his high estate
sentences.zh: 他是从他的高位继承人

words.mnemonic_zh: de 向下 scent 走的动作，就是下降
words.example_en: The climber's rapid descent was quite dangerous.
words.example_zh: 登山者快速下降相当危险。
words.en_def: An instance of descending; act of coming down.

sentences.en: We climbed the mountain with difficulty, but the descent was easier.
sentences.zh: 我们爬山很困难，但下山就轻松多了。

sentences.en: We had difficulty in finding the correct descent.
sentences.zh: 我们很难找到正确的下降路线。

sentences.en: The descent into the cavern was wet and slippery.
sentences.zh: 进入洞穴的通道又湿又滑。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动、完成
words.mnemonic_zh: de 离开 sert 加入的地方，就是被遗弃的
words.example_en: They found a deserted house in the middle of the forest.
words.example_zh: 他们在森林中央发现了一座被遗弃的房子。
words.en_def: To leave (anything that depends on one's presence to survive, exist, or succeed), especially when contrary to a promise or obligation; to abandon; to forsake.

sentences.en: You can't just drive off and desert me here, in the middle of nowhere.
sentences.zh: 你不能就这么开车把我丢在这荒无人烟的地方。

sentences.en: Anyone found deserting will be punished.
sentences.zh: 任何被发现逃兵的人都会受到惩罚。

words.mnemonic_zh: de 强调 sign 标记，就是精心设计
words.example_en: The architect spent months on the design of the new building.
words.example_zh: 建筑师花了几个月时间设计这座新建筑。
words.en_def: A specification of an object or process, referring to requirements to be satisfied and thus conditions to be met for them to solve a problem.

sentences.en: To be hateful of the truth by design.
sentences.zh: 故意憎恨真相。

sentences.en: Danish furniture design is world-famous.
sentences.zh: 丹麦的家具设计举世闻名。

sentences.en: The king designed to mount an expedition to the New World.
sentences.zh: 国王计划对新大陆进行一次探险。

words.mnemonic_zh: de 强调 sign 标记，然后任命
words.example_en: The board decided to designate him as the new manager.
words.example_zh: 董事会决定任命他为新经理。
words.en_def: To mark out and make known; to point out; to indicate; to show; to distinguish by marks or description

sentences.en: to designate the boundaries of a country
sentences.zh: 指定一个国家的边界

words.mnemonic_zh: de 强调 sir 渴望的东西，是值得拥有的
words.example_en: A good education is a desirable asset for future career.
words.example_zh: 良好的教育是未来职业的理想资产。
words.en_def: A thing that people want; something that is desirable.

sentences.en: There are plenty of desirables on display in the window.
sentences.zh: 橱窗里陈列着许多令人向往的东西。

sentences.en: This applicant has almost all desirable properties.
sentences.zh: 这位申请人几乎拥有所有理想的属性。

words.mnemonic_zh: de 强调 sir 渴望，就是强烈欲望
words.example_en: He has a strong desire to achieve success in his field.
words.example_zh: 他有强烈的愿望在自己的领域取得成功。
words.en_def: Someone or something wished for.

sentences.en: It is my desire to speak with you.
sentences.zh: 我希望与你交谈。

sentences.en: His desire for her kept him awake at night.
sentences.zh: 他对她的渴望让他彻夜难眠。

sentences.en: Too much desire can seriously affect one’s judgment.
sentences.zh: 太多的欲望会严重影响一个人的判断力。

words.mnemonic_zh: desk 桌子的 top 顶部，就是桌面
words.example_en: There are several important files on his desktop.
words.example_zh: 他的桌面上有几个重要文件。
words.en_def: The top surface of a desk.

sentences.en: Laptops are often more expensive than desktops.
sentences.zh: 笔记本电脑通常比台式机更贵。

sentences.en: I installed a new application and it added its icon to my desktop.
sentences.zh: 我安装了一个新应用程序，并将其图标添加到我的桌面上。

words.mnemonic_zh: de 强调 stin 立好的事，即命运
words.example_en: Some people believe that destiny determines their lives.
words.example_zh: 有些人相信命运决定他们的人生。
words.en_def: That to which any person or thing is destined; a predetermined state; a condition predestined by the Divine or by human will

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: de（否定）+ struct（建造），不建造就是破坏的
words.example_en: The destructive storm caused great damage to the coastal area.
words.example_zh: 这场破坏性的风暴给沿海地区造成了巨大损失。
words.en_def: Causing destruction; damaging.

sentences.en: Catabolism is a destructive metabolism that involves the breakdown of molecules and release of energy.
sentences.zh: 分解代谢是一种破坏性的新陈代谢，涉及分子的分解和能量的释放。

sentences.en: Blurring an image is a destructive operation, but rotating an image is not.
sentences.zh: 模糊图像是一种破坏性操作，但旋转图像则不是。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成
words.mnemonic_zh: de（分离）+ tach（绑），解开绑的就是分离的
words.example_en: He remained detached from the heated argument.
words.example_zh: 他在激烈的争论中保持超然态度。
words.en_def: To take apart from; to take off.

sentences.en: to detach the tag from a newly purchased garment
sentences.zh: 从新购买的衣服上取下标签

sentences.en: to detach a ship from a fleet, or a company from a regiment
sentences.zh: 将一艘船从舰队中分离出来，或将一个连从一个团中分离出来

sentences.en: Now that the zipper has detached, my winter coat won't keep me very warm.
sentences.zh: 现在拉链已经脱开了，我的冬衣就不再保暖了。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（加强）+ tain（拿），强力拿着就是拘留
words.example_en: The police can detain suspects for a certain period.
words.example_zh: 警察可以在一定时间内拘留嫌疑人。
words.en_def: To keep someone from proceeding by holding them back or making claims on their attention.

words.mnemonic_zh: de（揭开）+ tect（遮盖），揭开遮盖就是察觉
words.example_en: This device can detect even the slightest movement.
words.example_zh: 这个装置甚至能检测到最轻微的移动。
words.en_def: To discover or find by careful search, examination, or probing

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 由 detect 加 -ion 变名词
words.example_en: Early detection of the disease is crucial for treatment.
words.example_zh: 疾病的早期检测对治疗至关重要。
words.en_def: The act of detecting or sensing something; discovering something that was hidden or disguised.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表行为或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 由 detain 加 -ion 变名词
words.example_en: The suspect was placed in detention for further investigation.
words.example_zh: 嫌疑人为进一步调查被拘留。
words.en_def: The act of detaining or the state of being detained.

words.mnemonic_zh: de（恶化）+ terior（更…），变得更糟就是恶化
words.example_en: His health began to deteriorate after a long - term illness.
words.example_zh: 长期患病后，他的健康开始恶化。
words.en_def: To make worse; to make inferior in quality or value; to impair.

sentences.en: to deteriorate the mind
sentences.zh: 使精神恶化

words.mnemonic_zh: de（加强）+ termin（界限），明确界限就是决定
words.example_en: The result of the experiment will determine our next step.
words.example_zh: 实验结果将决定我们的下一步行动。
words.en_def: To set the boundaries or limits of.

sentences.en: The news of his father's illness determined him to depart immediately.
sentences.zh: 他父亲生病的消息决定他立即离开。

sentences.en: The court has determined the cause.
sentences.zh: 法院已确定原因。

sentences.en: I determined to go home at once.
sentences.zh: 我决定立刻回家。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（彻底）+ vast（荒芜），使彻底荒芜就是摧毁
words.example_en: The earthquake devastated the small town.
words.example_zh: 地震摧毁了这座小镇。
words.en_def: To ruin many or all things over a large area, such as most or all buildings of a city, or cities of a region, or trees of a forest.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成
words.mnemonic_zh: 由 devastate 加 -ated 变形容词
words.example_en: She was devastated by the sudden loss of her pet.
words.example_zh: 她因宠物的突然离世而极度震惊。
words.en_def: To ruin many or all things over a large area, such as most or all buildings of a city, or cities of a region, or trees of a forest.

sentences.en: the devastated city
sentences.zh: 被毁坏的城市

sentences.en: a devastated widow
sentences.zh: 一个悲痛欲绝的寡妇

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有……性质
words.mnemonic_zh: de（去除）+ vast（大量），把大量东西去除，破坏力强
words.example_en: The earthquake had a devastating impact on the small town.
words.example_zh: 地震对这个小镇造成了极具破坏力的影响。
words.en_def: To ruin many or all things over a large area, such as most or all buildings of a city, or cities of a region, or trees of a forest.

words.mnemonic_zh: develop（开发）+ er（人），搞开发的人
words.example_en: The software developer fixed the bugs in the program.
words.example_zh: 软件开发者修复了程序中的漏洞。
words.en_def: A person or entity engaged in the creation or improvement of certain classes of products.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“带我走”，魔鬼要带你走
words.example_en: People often associate the devil with evil and darkness.
words.example_zh: 人们常把魔鬼与邪恶和黑暗联系在一起。
words.en_def: An evil creature.

sentences.en: The devil in me wants to let him suffer.
sentences.zh: 我内心的恶魔想让他受苦。

sentences.en: Those two kids are devils in a toy store.
sentences.zh: 这两个孩子是玩具店里的魔鬼。

sentences.en: That math problem was a devil.
sentences.zh: 那道数学题简直就是魔鬼。

words.mnemonic_zh: de（强调）+ vis（看），仔细看后设计出来
words.example_en: The scientist managed to devise a new method to solve the problem.
words.example_zh: 科学家设法设计出一种新方法来解决这个问题。
words.en_def: The act of leaving real property in a will.

sentences.en: to devise an argument; to devise a machine, or a new system of writing
sentences.zh: 提出一个论据； 设计一台机器，或者一种新的书写系统

words.mnemonic_zh: dia（两者间）+ gnos（知道），在症状间找到病因
words.example_en: The doctor can diagnose the disease based on the symptoms.
words.example_zh: 医生能根据症状诊断疾病。
words.en_def: To determine which disease is causing a sick person's signs and symptoms; to find the diagnosis.

words.mnemonic_zh: 由 diagnose 变来，诊断的名词形式
words.example_en: The diagnosis of the illness was confirmed by several tests.
words.example_zh: 经过几次检查，疾病的诊断结果得到了确认。
words.en_def: To determine which disease is causing a sick person's signs and symptoms; to find the diagnosis.

sentences.en: He was given the wrong treatment due to an erroneous diagnosis.
sentences.zh: 由于错误的诊断，他受到了错误的治疗。

words.mnemonic_zh: dict（说）+ ate（动词后缀），说话让人做，即命令
words.example_en: The boss likes to dictate his ideas to his employees.
words.example_zh: 老板喜欢向员工口述他的想法。
words.en_def: An order or command.

sentences.en: I must obey the dictates of my conscience.
sentences.zh: 我必须服从我良心的指挥。

sentences.en: She is dictating a letter to a stenographer.
sentences.zh: 她正在向速记员口述一封信。

words.mnemonic_zh: dict（说）+ ator（人），一个说了算的人
words.example_en: The dictator ruled the country with an iron fist.
words.example_zh: 独裁者用铁腕统治这个国家。
words.en_def: A totalitarian leader of a country, nation, or government.

sentences.en: Dictators are always punished eventually.
sentences.zh: 独裁者最终总是受到惩罚。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“柴油”
words.example_en: Many trucks run on diesel because of its high energy density.
words.example_zh: 许多卡车使用柴油，因为其能量密度高。
words.en_def: A fuel derived from petroleum (or other oils) but heavier than gasoline/petrol. Used to power diesel engines which burn this fuel using the heat produced when air is compressed.

sentences.en: The only reason the VW bug has a solenoid is to prevent it from dieseling.
sentences.zh: 大众汽车配备电磁阀的唯一原因是为了防止柴油机熄火。

words.mnemonic_zh: dif（不同）+ fer（携带），携带不同东西可区分
words.example_zh: It's important to differentiate between right and wrong in life.
words.example_en: 在生活中区分对错很重要。
words.en_def: Something that has been differentiated or stratified.

words.mnemonic_zh: 把食物‘带’进身体里消化
words.example_en: It takes time to digest a large meal properly.
words.example_zh: 好好消化一顿大餐需要时间。
words.en_def: To distribute or arrange methodically; to work over and classify; to reduce to portions for ready use or application.

sentences.en: to digest laws
sentences.zh: 消化法律

sentences.en: I just ate an omelette and I'm waiting for it to digest.
sentences.zh: 我刚刚吃了一个煎蛋卷，正在等它消化。

sentences.en: Comyn's Digest
sentences.zh: 科明文摘

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程
words.mnemonic_zh: digest（消化）的名词形式
words.example_en: Poor digestion can lead to various health problems.
words.example_zh: 消化不好会导致各种健康问题。
words.en_def: The process, in the gastrointestinal tract, by which food is converted into substances that can be utilized by the body.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 有价值就有尊严
words.example_en: She faced the difficulties with great dignity.
words.example_zh: 她非常有尊严地面对困难。
words.en_def: The state of being dignified or worthy of esteem: elevation of mind or character.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘地雷嘛’，陷入有地雷的地方就是困境
words.example_en: He was in a dilemma about whether to accept the job offer.
words.example_zh: 他在是否接受这份工作邀请上陷入了困境。
words.en_def: A circumstance in which a choice must be made between two or more alternatives that seem equally undesirable.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 分开测量得出尺寸、维度
words.example_en: This problem has multiple dimensions that need to be considered.
words.example_zh: 这个问题有多个方面需要考虑。
words.en_def: A single aspect of a given thing.

sentences.en: The dimension of velocity is length divided by time.
sentences.zh: 速度的量纲是长度除以时间。

words.mnemonic_zh: 使东西分开变小
words.example_en: The supply of fresh water will diminish during the drought.
words.example_zh: 干旱期间淡水供应会减少。
words.en_def: To make smaller.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘滴’，浸一下会滴下水
words.example_en: She dipped the bread into the soup.
words.example_zh: 她把面包蘸进汤里。
words.en_def: A lower section of a road or geological feature.

sentences.en: There is a dip in the road ahead.
sentences.zh: 前面的路有一个下坡。

sentences.en: I'm going for a dip before breakfast.
sentences.zh: 早餐前我要去泡一泡。

sentences.en: This onion dip is just scrumptious.
sentences.zh: 这个洋葱酱真是太美味了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 外交官要能处理双重关系
words.example_en: A good diplomat can resolve conflicts effectively.
words.example_zh: 优秀的外交官能有效解决冲突。
words.en_def: A person, such as an ambassador, who is accredited to represent a government officially in its relations with other governments or international organisations

words.cn_def: 外交的；有策略的，圆滑的
words.mnemonic_zh: diplomat（外交官）的形容词形式
words.example_en: He has diplomatic skills to handle tough situations.
words.example_zh: 他有处理棘手情况的外交手腕。
words.en_def: The science of diplomas, or the art of deciphering ancient writings and determining their age, authenticity, etc.; paleography.

sentences.en: Albania immediately severed diplomatic relations with Zimbabwe.
sentences.zh: 阿尔巴尼亚立即与津巴布韦断绝外交关系。

sentences.en: Thoughtful corrections can be diplomatic as well as instructional.
sentences.zh: 深思熟虑的纠正既可以是外交性的，也可以是指导性的。

sentences.en: Whereas a diplomatic edition uses as its base text a single, "best" manuscript, to which other textual evidence is collated and organized into an apparatus, a critical text of the LXX/OG [= Septuagint or Old Greek] may be described as a collection of the oldest recoverable texts, carefully restored book by book (or section by section), aiming at achieving the closest approximation to the original translations (from Hebrew or Aramaic) or compositions (in Greek), systematically reconstructed from the widest array of relevant textual data (including controlled conjecture).  The International Organization for Septuagint and Cognate Studies, Critical Editions of Septuagint/Old Greek Texts.
sentences.zh: 外交版本使用单一的“最佳”手稿作为基础文本，其他文本证据被整理并组织成一个装置，而《七十士译本》/OG [=七十士译本或古希腊语]的关键文本可以被描述为最古老的可恢复文本的集合，逐本书（或逐节）仔细修复，旨在实现最接近原始翻译（来自希伯来语或阿拉姆语）或作品（希腊语），从最广泛的相关资料中系统地重建。 文本数据（包括受控猜想）。 国际七十士译本和同源研究组织，七十士译本/古希腊文本的批评版本。

words.mnemonic_zh: 分开使变直，即指导方向
words.example_en: The teacher directed the students to complete the task.
words.example_zh: 老师指导学生完成任务。
words.en_def: To manage, control, steer.

sentences.en: to direct the affairs of a nation or the movements of an army
sentences.zh: 指挥国家事务或军队行动

sentences.en: He directed his question to the room in general.
sentences.zh: 他把问题指向整个房间。

sentences.en: He directed me to the left-hand road.
sentences.zh: 他带我到左边的路。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: direct（引导）状态就是“方向”
words.example_en: The compass helps sailors find the right direction at sea.
words.example_zh: 指南针帮助水手们在海上找到正确的方向。
words.en_def: A theoretical line (physically or mentally) followed from a point of origin or towards a destination. May be relative (e.g. up, left, outbound, dorsal), geographical (e.g. north), rotational (e.g. clockwise), or with respect to an object or location (e.g. toward Boston).

sentences.en: Keep going in the same direction.
sentences.zh: 继续朝同一个方向前进。

sentences.en: The trombonist looked to the bandleader for direction.
sentences.zh: 长号手向乐队指挥寻求方向。

sentences.en: The screenplay was good, but the direction was weak.
sentences.zh: 剧本很好，但导演很弱。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示场所、地点
words.mnemonic_zh: direct（引导）信息的本子是“目录”
words.example_en: You can find his phone number in the company directory.
words.example_zh: 你可以在公司通讯录里找到他的电话号码。
words.en_def: A list of names, addresses etc, of specific classes of people or organizations, often in alphabetical order or in some classification.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有某种特征
words.mnemonic_zh: 没有（dis-）“优势”就是“不利”的
words.example_en: The government provides support for disadvantaged children.
words.example_zh: 政府为处于不利地位的儿童提供支持。
words.en_def: To place at a disadvantage.

sentences.en: They fear it might disadvantage honest participants to allow automated entries.
sentences.zh: 他们担心允许自动输入可能会对诚实的参与者不利。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis-（否定）“赞成”就是“反对”
words.example_en: Her parents showed their disapproval of her dating choice.
words.example_zh: 她父母对她的约会对象表示反对。
words.en_def: The act of disapproving; condemnation.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…的性质
words.mnemonic_zh: dis-（坏）星象带来“灾难”
words.example_zh: The earthquake had a disastrous impact on the small town.
words.example_en: 地震给小镇带来了灾难性的影响。
words.en_def: Of the nature of a disaster; calamitous.

words.mnemonic_zh: 打牌时去掉（dis-）不要的“牌”
words.example_en: He decided to discard his old clothes.
words.example_zh: 他决定扔掉他的旧衣服。
words.en_def: Anything discarded.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis-（分离）负担，即“释放”
words.example_en: The patient was discharged from the hospital yesterday.
words.example_zh: 这位病人昨天出院了。
words.en_def: Pus or exudate (other than blood) from a wound or orifice, usually due to infection or pathology.

sentences.en: to discharge a prisoner
sentences.zh: 释放囚犯

sentences.en: to discharge a cargo
sentences.zh: 卸货

sentences.en: A pipe discharges water.
sentences.zh: 一根管子排出水。

words.mnemonic_zh: “迪士”高要守“cipline”（纪律）
words.example_en: Students should follow the school discipline.
words.example_zh: 学生们应该遵守学校纪律。
words.morph_note: 此词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: A controlled behaviour; self-control.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis-（相反）关闭，即“揭露”
words.example_en: The reporter managed to disclose the truth.
words.example_zh: 记者设法揭露了真相。
words.en_def: A disclosure.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: dis-（相反）关闭的行为是“披露”
words.example_en: The disclosure of the scandal shocked the public.
words.example_zh: 丑闻的披露震惊了公众。
words.en_def: The act of revealing something.

sentences.en: get full disclosure
sentences.zh: 得到充分披露

words.mnemonic_zh: dis表示否定，让舒适没了，就是不适
words.example_en: The tight shoes caused her discomfort during the long walk.
words.example_zh: 在长时间的步行中，紧鞋让她感到不适。
words.en_def: Mental or bodily distress.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis否定，让满意没了，就是不满
words.example_en: The workers' discontent led to a strike in the factory.
words.example_zh: 工人们的不满导致了工厂的罢工。
words.en_def: Dissatisfaction.

words.mnemonic_zh: 话语分散开来，就是论述、谈话
words.example_en: The professor's discourse on history was very inspiring.
words.example_zh: 教授关于历史的论述很有启发性。
words.en_def: Verbal exchange, conversation.

sentences.en: The preacher gave us a long discourse on duty.
sentences.zh: 传道人在值班时给我们做了长篇演讲。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: dis去除覆盖，就有了发现
words.example_en: The scientist's discovery changed the field of medicine.
words.example_zh: 这位科学家的发现改变了医学领域。
words.en_def: Something discovered.

sentences.en: This latest discovery should eventually lead to much better treatments for disease.
sentences.zh: 这一最新发现最终应该会带来更好的疾病治疗方法。

sentences.en: Automatic discovery of RSS feeds by a Web browser.
sentences.zh: Web 浏览器自动发现 RSS 源。

sentences.en: The prosecution moved to suppress certain items turned up during discovery.
sentences.zh: 检方采取行动压制发现过程中出现的某些物品。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 能分开辨别，做事就会谨慎
words.example_en: You should use your discretion when making this decision.
words.example_zh: 你做这个决定时应谨慎行事。
words.en_def: The quality of being discreet or circumspect.

sentences.en: Bob showed great discretion despite his knowledge of the affair.
sentences.zh: 尽管鲍勃对这件事了如指掌，但他还是表现出了极大的谨慎。

sentences.en: I leave that to your discretion.
sentences.zh: 我将其留给您自行决定。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis分开，对人分开评判，就是歧视
words.example_en: It's illegal to discriminate against people based on race.
words.example_zh: 基于种族歧视他人是违法的。
words.en_def: To make distinctions.

sentences.en: The law prohibits discriminating against people based on their skin color.
sentences.zh: 法律禁止基于肤色歧视他人。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 可以由动词discriminate联想，-ation变名词
words.example_en: We should fight against all forms of discrimination.
words.example_zh: 我们应该反对一切形式的歧视。
words.en_def: Discernment, the act of discriminating, discerning, distinguishing, noting or perceiving differences between things, with intent to understand rightly and make correct decisions.

sentences.en: reverse discrimination
sentences.zh: 反向歧视

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示被动或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: dis否定，味道不好，让人厌恶
words.example_en: She looked disgusted when she saw the dirty food.
words.example_zh: 她看到那脏食物时一脸厌恶。
words.en_def: To cause an intense dislike for something.

sentences.en: It disgusts me to see her chew with her mouth open.
sentences.zh: 看到她张着嘴咀嚼东西，我感到恶心。

sentences.en: The sight of the squirming mass of maggots left me disgusted.
sentences.zh: 看到那群蠕动的蛆虫让我感到恶心。

sentences.en: I'm disgusted with her egocentric behaviour.
sentences.zh: 我对她以自我为中心的行为感到厌恶。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis否定诚实，-ly变副词，即不诚实地
words.example_en: He acted dishonestly in the business deal.
words.example_zh: 他在这笔生意中行事不诚实。
words.en_def: In a dishonest manner.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis分开，送离岗位，就是解雇
words.example_en: The manager decided to dismiss the lazy employee.
words.example_zh: 经理决定解雇那个懒惰的员工。
words.en_def: To discharge; to end the employment or service of.

sentences.en: The company dismissed me after less than a year.
sentences.zh: 不到一年，公司就解雇了我。

sentences.en: The soldiers were dismissed after the parade.
sentences.zh: 阅兵结束后，士兵们被解散。

sentences.en: He dismissed all thoughts of acting again.
sentences.zh: 他打消了一切再次演戏的念头。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: dis（否定）+ miss（送）+ al → 送出去不要了，即解雇
words.example_en: His dismissal from the company was a big shock to everyone.
words.example_zh: 他被公司解雇让所有人都大为震惊。
words.en_def: The act of sending someone away.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（否定）+ order（秩序）→ 没有秩序，即混乱
words.example_en: The room was in complete disorder after the party.
words.example_zh: 派对结束后，房间里一片混乱。
words.en_def: Absence of order; state of not being arranged in an orderly manner.

sentences.en: After playing the children left the room in disorder.
sentences.zh: 玩完后，孩子们乱七八糟地离开了房间。

sentences.en: The army tried to prevent disorder when claims the elections had been rigged grew stronger.
sentences.zh: 当选举被操纵的说法越来越强烈时，军队试图阻止骚乱。

sentences.en: Bulimia is an eating disorder.
sentences.zh: 暴食症是一种饮食失调症。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（离开）+ place（位置）→ 使离开原来位置，即取代
words.example_en: Machines have displaced many workers in this factory.
words.example_zh: 在这家工厂，机器已经取代了很多工人。
words.en_def: To put out of place; to disarrange.

sentences.en: Electronic calculators soon displaced the older mechanical kind.
sentences.zh: 电子计算器很快取代了老式的机械计算器。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: dis（离开）+ place（位置）+ ment → 使离开位置的结果，即取代、位移
words.example_en: The displacement of traditional methods by new technologies is inevitable.
words.example_zh: 新技术取代传统方法是不可避免的。
words.en_def: The act of displacing, or the state of being displaced; a putting out of place.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: dis（分开）+ pose（放置）+ al → 分开来放置处理，即处置
words.example_en: The proper disposal of waste is crucial for environmental protection.
words.example_zh: 正确处理垃圾对环境保护至关重要。
words.en_def: An arrangement, categorization or classification of things.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（分开）+ pose（放置）→ 分开来放置处理
words.example_en: They need to dispose of these old books properly.
words.example_zh: 他们需要妥善处理这些旧书。
words.en_def: The disposal or management of something.

sentences.en: I dispose of my trash in the garbage can.
sentences.zh: 我把垃圾扔进垃圾桶。

sentences.en: In these uncertain times, I am disposed towards caution.
sentences.zh: 在这些不确定的时期，我倾向于谨慎行事。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（相反）+ pute（思考）→ 想法相反，即争论
words.example_en: They often dispute about political issues.
words.example_zh: 他们经常就政治问题进行争论。
words.en_def: An argument or disagreement, a failure to agree.

sentences.en: Some residents disputed the proposal, saying it was based more on emotion than fact.
sentences.zh: 一些居民对这一提议提出异议，称这更多是基于情感而非事实。

sentences.en: to dispute assertions or arguments
sentences.zh: 对断言或论点提出异议

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（否定）+ respect（尊重）→ 不尊重
words.example_en: His disrespect for others made him unpopular.
words.example_zh: 他对他人的不尊重使他不受欢迎。
words.en_def: A lack of respect, esteem or courteous behaviour.

words.mnemonic_zh: dis（分开）+ rupt（破裂）→ 使破裂分开，即破坏、扰乱
words.example_en: The storm disrupted the communication system.
words.example_zh: 暴风雨破坏了通信系统。
words.en_def: To throw into confusion or disorder.

sentences.en: Hecklers disrupted the man's speech.
sentences.zh: 质问者打断了该男子的讲话。

sentences.en: Work on the tunnel was disrupted by a strike.
sentences.zh: 隧道施工因罢工而中断。

sentences.en: The internet makes it easier for leaner businesses to disrupt the larger and more unwieldy ones.
sentences.zh: 互联网使精简的企业更容易颠覆规模更大、更笨重的企业。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: dis（分开）+ rupt（破裂）+ ion → 使破裂分开的结果，即破坏、扰乱
words.example_en: The strike caused a great disruption to the city's transport.
words.example_zh: 罢工给城市交通造成了极大的混乱。
words.en_def: An interruption to the regular flow or sequence of something.

sentences.en: There was great disruption in the classroom when the teacher left.
sentences.zh: 老师离开后，教室里一片混乱。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 分开插入观点，写成学位论文
words.example_en: He spent months writing his dissertation on ancient history.
words.example_zh: 他花了几个月时间撰写关于古代历史的学位论文。
words.en_def: A formal exposition of a subject, especially a research paper that students write in order to complete the requirements for a doctoral degree; a thesis.

words.mnemonic_zh: 把东西分开松开，就溶解了
words.example_en: The sugar will dissolve quickly in hot water.
words.example_zh: 糖在热水中会很快溶解。
words.en_def: A form of film punctuation in which there is a gradual transition from one scene to the next

sentences.en: The ruling party or coalition sometimes dissolves parliament early when the polls are favorable, hoping to reconvene with a larger majority.
sentences.zh: 执政党或联盟有时会在民意调查有利时提前解散议会，希望以更多多数重新召开会议。

sentences.en: to dissolve an injunction
sentences.zh: 解除禁令

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 分开站立，距离遥远
words.example_en: The distant mountains look very beautiful in the sunset.
words.example_zh: 远处的山峦在夕阳下看起来很美。
words.en_def: Far off (physically, logically or mentally).

sentences.en: We heard a distant rumbling but didn't pay any more attention to it.   She was surprised to find that her fiancé was a distant relative of hers.   His distant look showed that he was not listening to me.
sentences.zh: 我们听到远处传来隆隆声，但没有再去注意。 她惊讶地发现，自己的未婚夫竟然是自己的远房亲戚。 他冷漠的表情表明他没有在听我说话。

sentences.en: Ever since our argument, she has been totally distant toward me.
sentences.zh: 自从我们吵架之后，她就对我完全疏远了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 分开刺激，特征明显
words.example_en: There is a distinct smell of coffee in the room.
words.example_zh: 房间里有一股明显的咖啡味。
words.en_def: Capable of being perceived very clearly.

sentences.en: Her voice was distinct despite the heavy traffic.
sentences.zh: 尽管交通繁忙，她的声音还是清晰的。

sentences.en: Horses are distinct from zebras.
sentences.zh: 马与斑马不同。

sentences.en: Olga's voice is quite distinct because of her accent.
sentences.zh: 由于口音，奥尔加的声音很明显。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 分开刺激产生区别
words.example_en: We should make a clear distinction between right and wrong.
words.example_zh: 我们应该明确区分是非。
words.en_def: That which distinguishes; a single occurrence of a determining factor or feature, the fact of being divided; separation, discrimination.

sentences.en: There is a distinction to be made between resting and slacking.
sentences.zh: 休息和懈怠是有区别的。

sentences.en: She had the distinction of meeting the Queen.
sentences.zh: 她有幸见到了女王。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 分开刺激，有独特特征
words.example_en: This town has its own distinctive culture.
words.example_zh: 这个城镇有自己独特的文化。
words.en_def: A distinctive thing: a quality or property permitting distinguishing; a characteristic.

sentences.en: a product in distinctive packaging
sentences.zh: 具有独特包装的产品

sentences.en: his distinctive bass voice
sentences.zh: 他独特的低音

words.mnemonic_zh: 分开扭曲，把东西弄变形
words.example_en: Don't distort the facts to suit your needs.
words.example_zh: 不要为了满足自己的需求而歪曲事实。
words.en_def: To bring something out of shape, to misshape.

sentences.en: In their articles, journalists sometimes distort the truth.
sentences.zh: 记者在文章中有时会歪曲事实。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 把注意力分开拉走，造成分心
words.example_en: The noise in the street was a big distraction for her.
words.example_zh: 街上的噪音对她来说是很大的干扰。
words.en_def: Something that distracts.

sentences.en: Poking one's eye is a good distraction from a hurting toe.
sentences.zh: 戳眼睛可以很好地分散人们对受伤脚趾的注意力。

sentences.en: We have to reduce distraction in class if we want students to achieve good results.
sentences.zh: 如果我们希望学生取得好成绩，我们就必须减少课堂上的干扰。

sentences.en: The incessant nightmares drove him to distraction.
sentences.zh: 连续不断的噩梦让他心烦意乱。

words.mnemonic_zh: 压力反过来，就成了痛苦
words.example_en: The news of his failure caused him great distress.
words.example_zh: 他失败的消息让他非常痛苦。
words.en_def: (Cause of) discomfort.

sentences.en: She distressed the new media cabinet so that it fit with the other furniture in the room.
sentences.zh: 她对新的媒体柜进行了仿旧处理，使其与房间里的其他家具相匹配。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示处于…状态的
words.mnemonic_zh: 有压力反效果，处于痛苦状态
words.example_en: The distressed look on her face worried us all.
words.example_zh: 她脸上痛苦的表情让我们都很担心。
words.en_def: To cause strain or anxiety to someone.

sentences.en: She distressed the new media cabinet so that it fit with the other furniture in the room.
sentences.zh: 她对新的媒体柜进行了仿旧处理，使其与房间里的其他家具相匹配。

sentences.en: I'm distressed that John hasn't answered my calls. I hope nothing bad happened to him on the way here.
sentences.zh: 约翰没有接我的电话，我感到很难过。 我希望他来这里的路上没有发生什么不好的事情。

words.mnemonic_zh: dis分开 + tribut分配，即分开分配
words.example_en: They distribute free samples to attract more customers.
words.example_zh: 他们分发免费样品以吸引更多顾客。
words.en_def: To divide into portions and dispense.

sentences.en: He distributed the bread amongst his followers.
sentences.zh: 他将面包分发给他的追随者。

sentences.en: The agency distributes newspapers to local shops.
sentences.zh: 该机构向当地商店分发报纸。

sentences.en: A network of children distributes flyers to every house.
sentences.zh: 儿童网络向每家每户分发传单。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: distribute的名词形式，表分配的行为或结果
words.example_en: The distribution of resources should be more balanced.
words.example_zh: 资源的分配应该更加均衡。
words.en_def: An act of distributing or state of being distributed.

sentences.en: The distribution of my little rock magazine is about 3,000.
sentences.zh: 我的小摇滚杂志发行量大约有3000份。

sentences.en: The wealth distribution became extremely skewed in the kleptocracy.
sentences.zh: 盗贼统治下的财富分配变得极其不平衡。

sentences.en: The declarer had 3-6-2-2 distribution.
sentences.zh: 庄家的分配是3-6-2-2。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示状态或性质
words.mnemonic_zh: dis反 + turb扰乱，造成的状态即干扰
words.example_en: The police were called to deal with the disturbance.
words.example_zh: 警方被叫来处理这场骚乱。
words.en_def: The act of disturbing, being disturbed.

sentences.en: That guy causes a lot of trouble, you know, he's such a disturbance.
sentences.zh: 那家伙惹了很多麻烦，你知道，他真是个麻烦事。

words.mnemonic_zh: disturb加ing，表令人扰乱的
words.example_en: There are some disturbing news in the newspaper.
words.example_zh: 报纸上有一些令人不安的消息。
words.en_def: To confuse a quiet, constant state or a calm, continuous flow, in particular: thoughts, actions or liquids.

sentences.en: A school of fish disturbed the water.
sentences.zh: 一群鱼扰乱了水面。

sentences.en: A mudslide disturbed the course of the river.
sentences.zh: 泥石流扰乱了河道。

sentences.en: A disturbing film that tries to explore the mind of a serial killer.
sentences.zh: 一部令人不安的电影，试图探索连环杀手的思想。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: di不同 + vers转，不同转变带来多样性
words.example_en: The city's cultural diversity makes it very attractive.
words.example_zh: 这座城市的文化多样性使其极具吸引力。
words.en_def: The quality of being diverse or different; difference or unlikeness.

words.mnemonic_zh: di分开 + vert转，转向别处
words.example_en: They diverted the river to irrigate the fields.
words.example_zh: 他们使河流改道以灌溉农田。
words.en_def: To turn aside from a course.

sentences.en: The workers diverted the stream away from the road.
sentences.zh: 工人们将水流从道路上引开。

sentences.en: Don't let him divert your attention; keep your eye on the ball.
sentences.zh: 不要让他转移你的注意力； 密切关注球。

words.mnemonic_zh: 联想“分开、划分”场景记忆
words.example_en: Let's divide the work among us equally.
words.example_zh: 让我们把工作平均分配给大家。
words.en_def: A thing that divides.

sentences.en: Stay on your side of the divide, please.
sentences.zh: 请站在分歧的一边。

sentences.en: The divide left most of the good land on my share of the property.
sentences.zh: 分割后，大部分好土地都留在了我的那份财产上。

sentences.en: There is a great divide between us.
sentences.zh: 我们之间存在很大的分歧。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“迪万”，联想神圣非凡的人物
words.example_en: The priest believed in the divine power.
words.example_zh: 牧师相信神的力量。
words.en_def: One skilled in divinity; a theologian.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“到客”，客人到码头
words.example_en: The ship will arrive at the dock tomorrow.
words.example_zh: 这艘船明天将抵达码头。
words.en_def: Any of the genus Rumex of coarse weedy plants with small green flowers related to buckwheat, especially common dock, and used as potherbs and in folk medicine, especially in curing nettle rash.

sentences.en: to dock an entail
sentences.zh: 对接蕴涵

sentences.en: coffee dock
sentences.zh: 咖啡码头

sentences.en: I docked the laptop and allowed it to recharge for an hour.
sentences.zh: 我将笔记本电脑插入坞站并让它充电一个小时。

words.mnemonic_zh: doct教 + rine，有关教导的学说
words.example_en: The school follows a progressive doctrine.
words.example_zh: 这所学校遵循一种进步的学说。
words.en_def: A belief or tenet, especially about philosophical or theological matters.

sentences.en: The four noble truths summarise the main doctrines of Buddhism.
sentences.zh: 四圣谛概括了佛教的主要教义。

sentences.en: What is the understanding of marriage and family in orthodox Marxist doctrine?
sentences.zh: 正统马克思主义学说对婚姻家庭的理解是怎样的？

words.suffix_cn: -ment：名词后缀，表示行为或结果； -ation：名词后缀，表行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: docu（文件）加上后缀表相关文件资料
words.example_en: The project requires comprehensive documentation for review.
words.example_zh: 该项目需要全面的文件资料以供审查。
words.en_def: Something transposed from a thought to a document; the written account of an idea.

words.mnemonic_zh: dom（统治）的范围就是领地、领域
words.example_en: He is an expert in the domain of artificial intelligence.
words.example_zh: 他是人工智能领域的专家。
words.en_def: A geographic area owned or controlled by a single person or organization.

sentences.en: The king ruled his domain harshly.
sentences.zh: 国王严厉地统治着他的领地。

sentences.en: Dealing with complaints isn't really my domain: get in touch with customer services.
sentences.zh: 处理投诉并不是我的职责：与客户服务部门联系。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: domin（统治）加后缀表统治的状态即优势地位
words.example_en: The company achieved dominance in the global market.
words.example_zh: 该公司在全球市场取得了统治地位。
words.en_def: The state of being dominant; of prime importance; supremacy.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: domin（统治）加后缀表有统治性质即主导的
words.example_en: The dominant color in this painting is blue.
words.example_zh: 这幅画中占主导地位的颜色是蓝色。
words.en_def: The fifth major tone of a musical scale (five major steps above the note in question); thus G is the dominant of C, A of D, and so on.

sentences.en: The dominant party controlled the government.
sentences.zh: 执政党控制着政府。

sentences.en: The dominant plants of the Carboniferous were lycopods and early conifers.
sentences.zh: 石炭纪的优势植物是石松类和早期针叶树。

words.mnemonic_zh: domin（统治）加后缀表使处于统治地位即支配
words.example_en: He tried to dominate the conversation.
words.example_zh: 他试图主导这场对话。
words.en_def: Ruling; governing; prevailing

sentences.en: The dominant party controlled the government.
sentences.zh: 执政党控制着政府。

sentences.en: The dominant plants of the Carboniferous were lycopods and early conifers.
sentences.zh: 石炭纪的优势植物是石松类和早期针叶树。

words.mnemonic_zh: domin（统治）加后缀表统治的行为或状态
words.example_en: The country suffered under foreign domination.
words.example_zh: 这个国家曾遭受外国统治。
words.en_def: A lid.

sentences.en: The soldiers took cover behind a ruined building.
sentences.zh: 士兵们躲在一栋废墟后面。

sentences.en: There's a $15 cover tonight.
sentences.zh: 今晚有 15 美元的封面。

sentences.en: We need to set another cover for the Smith party.
sentences.zh: 我们需要为史密斯派对设置另一个掩护。

words.mnemonic_zh: don（给予）加后缀表使给予出去即捐赠
words.example_en: They decided to donate money to the charity.
words.example_zh: 他们决定向慈善机构捐款。
words.en_def: To make a donation; to give away something of value to support or contribute towards a cause or for the benefit of another.

sentences.en: He donated an etching from his own collection to the new art gallery.
sentences.zh: 他将自己收藏的一幅蚀刻版画捐赠给了新美术馆。

words.mnemonic_zh: don（给予）加后缀表给予者即捐赠者
words.example_en: The hospital is looking for more blood donors.
words.example_zh: 医院正在寻找更多的献血者。
words.en_def: One who makes a donation.

sentences.en: The charity raised $2,000 from various donors.
sentences.zh: 该慈善机构从各种捐助者那里筹集了 2,000 美元。

sentences.en: a carbonyl donor molecule
sentences.zh: 羰基供体分子

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“都死”，一剂药可能让人有这感觉，助记剂量
words.example_en: Take one dose of this medicine twice a day.
words.example_zh: 这种药一天服两次，每次一剂。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“捣他”，因怀疑才想捣他
words.example_en: There is no doubt that he is qualified for the job.
words.example_zh: 毫无疑问，他胜任这份工作。
words.en_def: Disbelief or uncertainty (about something); a particular instance of such disbelief or uncertainty.

sentences.en: I have doubts about how to convert this code to JavaScript.
sentences.zh: 我对如何将此代码转换为 JavaScript 有疑问。

sentences.en: He doubted that was really what you meant.
sentences.zh: 他怀疑这确实是你的意思。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘倒’，东西倒下就是向下
words.example_en: The ball rolled down the hill quickly.
words.example_zh: 球很快地滚下了山。
words.en_def: A negative aspect; a downer.

sentences.en: I love almost everything about my job. The only down is that I can't take Saturdays off.
sentences.zh: 我几乎热爱我工作的一切。 唯一的缺点是我周六不能休息。

sentences.en: I bet after the third down, the kicker will replace the quarterback on the field.
sentences.zh: 我打赌第三次进攻后，踢球手将取代场上的四分卫。

sentences.en: I haven't solved 12 or 13 across, but I've got most of the downs.
sentences.zh: 我还没有解决12或13个问题，但我已经解决了大部分问题。

words.mnemonic_zh: 向下的一面，常指不好的方面
words.example_en: The downside of this job is the long working hours.
words.example_zh: 这份工作的缺点是工作时间长。
words.en_def: A disadvantageous aspect of something that is normally advantageous.

sentences.en: The downside of obtaining a higher rank is that far more work is expected.
sentences.zh: 获得更高级别的缺点是需要做更多的工作。

words.mnemonic_zh: down（向下）加上表示方向的 ward，即向下的
words.example_en: The downward movement of the elevator made her dizzy.
words.example_zh: 电梯的下降运动让她头晕。
words.en_def: Moving, sloping or oriented downward.

sentences.en: He spoke with a downward glance.
sentences.zh: 他低着头说道。
