words.en_def: The act of identifying, or proving to be the same.

sentences.en: Much education and experience is required for proper identification of bird species
sentences.zh: 正确识别鸟类需要大量的教育和经验

sentences.en: information necessary to make a good identification
sentences.zh: 进行良好识别所需的信息

sentences.en: The authorities asked for his identification
sentences.zh: 当局要求他提供身份证明

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 使事情填满完成，就是实施
words.example_en: The implementation of this policy will bring many changes.
words.example_zh: 这项政策的实施将带来许多变化。
words.en_def: The process of moving an idea from concept to reality. In business, engineering and other fields, implementation refers to the building process rather than the design process.

sentences.en: His implementation works, but it needs some fine-tuning.
sentences.zh: 他的实现有效，但需要一些微调。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 使意思缠绕其中，有暗示含义
words.example_en: The implication of his words is not hard to understand.
words.example_zh: 他话语的含义不难理解。
words.en_def: The act of implicating.

sentences.en: There are serious implications for the environment of such reforms.
sentences.zh: 这种改革的环境会产生严重影响。

words.mnemonic_zh: 向内搬运东西，就是进口
words.example_en: They import a lot of goods from foreign countries.
words.example_zh: 他们从外国进口很多货物。
words.en_def: Something brought in from an exterior source, especially for sale or trade.

sentences.en: It was a matter of great import.
sentences.zh: 这是一件非常重要的事情。

sentences.en: How can I import files from older versions of this application?
sentences.zh: 如何从此应用程序的旧版本导入文件？

words.mnemonic_zh: 使东西放置在别人身上，就是强加
words.example_en: The government may impose new taxes next year.
words.example_zh: 政府明年可能会征收新税。
words.en_def: To establish or apply by authority.

sentences.en: Congress imposed new tariffs.
sentences.zh: 国会征收新关税。

sentences.en: I don't wish to impose upon you.
sentences.zh: 我不想强加给你。

sentences.en: Social relations impose courtesy
sentences.zh: 社会关系强加礼貌

words.mnemonic_zh: 使人进入监狱，就是监禁
words.example_en: The criminal was imprisoned for ten years.
words.example_zh: 这名罪犯被监禁了十年。
words.en_def: To put in or as if in prison; confine.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 使人进入监狱的状态，即监禁
words.example_en: His imprisonment was a great shock to his family.
words.example_zh: 他被监禁对他的家人来说是个巨大的打击。
words.en_def: A confinement in a place, especially a prison or a jail, as punishment for a crime.

words.mnemonic_zh: 没有能力，就是无能
words.example_en: His inability to solve the problem made him frustrated.
words.example_zh: 他无力解决这个问题，这让他很沮丧。
words.en_def: Lack of the ability to do something; incapability.

words.mnemonic_zh: 没有准确性，就是不准确
words.example_en: The inaccuracy of the data led to wrong decisions.
words.example_zh: 数据的不准确导致了错误的决策。
words.en_def: The property of being inaccurate; lack of accuracy.

words.mnemonic_zh: 不够适当，就是不充分
words.example_en: The resources are inadequate to meet the demand.
words.example_zh: 资源不足以满足需求。
words.en_def: An individual who is inadequate.

sentences.en: inadequate representation
sentences.zh: 代表性不足

words.mnemonic_zh: 不恰当，就是不合适
words.example_zh: 他在那种场合穿的衣服不合适。
words.example_en: His clothes were inappropriate for that occasion.
words.en_def: Not appropriate; not suitable for the situation, time, or place.

sentences.en: It is inappropriate to burp at a formal dinner.
sentences.zh: 在正式的晚餐上打嗝是不合适的。

sentences.en: kids saying inappropriate things
sentences.zh: 孩子说不恰当的话

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，表示方式、程度
words.mnemonic_zh: in表示否定，appropri是合适，连起来就是不合适地
words.example_en: He behaved inappropriately at the formal dinner party.
words.example_zh: 他在正式晚宴上举止不当。
words.en_def: In an inappropriate manner

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: in使进入，cid发生，进入发生状态即发生率
words.example_en: The incidence of this disease has decreased in recent years.
words.example_zh: 这种疾病的发生率近年来有所下降。
words.en_def: The act of something happening; occurrence.

words.mnemonic_zh: in使发生，顺便发生的事就顺便说
words.example_en: Incidentally, I met your old friend in the street yesterday.
words.example_zh: 顺便说一下，我昨天在街上遇到了你的老朋友。
words.en_def: (manner) In an incidental manner; not of central or critical importance.

sentences.en: The book discussed the subject, but only incidentally.
sentences.zh: 这本书讨论了这个主题，但只是顺便提及。

sentences.en: Incidentally, did you hear anything new from your brother yesterday?
sentences.zh: 顺便问一下，昨天你有从你哥哥那里听到什么新消息吗？

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…的性质
words.mnemonic_zh: in使倾斜，内心倾斜就是有倾向
words.example_en: She is inclined to trust others easily.
words.example_zh: 她倾向于轻易相信别人。
words.en_def: To bend or move (something) out of a given plane or direction, often the horizontal or vertical.

sentences.en: He had to incline his body against the gusts to avoid being blown down in the storm.
sentences.zh: 他不得不倾斜身体以抵御狂风，以免在暴风雨中被吹倒。

sentences.en: Over the centuries the wind made the walls of the farmhouse incline.
sentences.zh: 几个世纪以来，风使农舍的墙壁倾斜。

sentences.en: He inclines to believe anything he reads in the newspapers.
sentences.zh: 他倾向于相信他在报纸上读到的任何事情。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: in使进入，clud包含，进入包含范围即纳入
words.example_en: The inclusion of new members made the team stronger.
words.example_zh: 新成员的加入使团队更强大了。
words.en_def: An addition or annex to a group, set, or total.

sentences.en: The poem was a new inclusion in the textbook.
sentences.zh: 这首诗被新列入教科书。

sentences.en: The inclusion of the poem added value to the course.
sentences.zh: 这首诗的加入为课程增加了价值。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质
words.mnemonic_zh: in使包含，有包含性质的
words.example_en: The price is inclusive of all taxes.
words.example_zh: 这个价格包含了所有税费。
words.en_def: Including (almost) everything within its scope.

sentences.en: an inclusive list of data formats
sentences.zh: 包含数据格式的列表

sentences.en: numbers 1 to 10 inclusive
sentences.zh: 数字 1 到 10（含）

sentences.en: The pronoun in "If you want, we could go back to my place for coffee" is an inclusive "we".
sentences.zh: “如果你愿意，我们可以回我家喝咖啡”中的代词是一个包容性的“我们”。

words.mnemonic_zh: in否定，convenience便利，否定便利就是不便
words.example_en: The delay caused a lot of inconvenience to the passengers.
words.example_zh: 延误给乘客带来了很多不便。
words.en_def: The quality of being inconvenient.

words.mnemonic_zh: in不，cred相信，让人不敢相信就是极其、非常
words.example_en: The movie is incredibly popular among young people.
words.example_zh: 这部电影在年轻人中极其受欢迎。
words.en_def: (manner) In an incredible manner; not to be believed.

sentences.en: He was incredibly wealthy.
sentences.zh: 他非常富有。

sentences.en: Incredibly, when he died they found he had left a million dollars to the Poetry Foundation.
sentences.zh: 令人难以置信的是，当他去世时，他们发现他给诗歌基金会留下了一百万美元。

words.mnemonic_zh: in使，cur发生，使发生就是招致
words.example_en: His carelessness incurred a big loss to the company.
words.example_zh: 他的粗心给公司招致了重大损失。
words.en_def: To bring upon oneself or expose oneself to, especially something inconvenient, harmful, or onerous; to become liable or subject to

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“引戴克斯”，引导查找之意像索引
words.example_en: You can find the information quickly through the index.
words.example_zh: 你可以通过索引快速找到信息。
words.en_def: An alphabetical listing of items and their location.

sentences.en: The index of a book lists words or expressions and the pages of the book upon which they are to be found.
sentences.zh: 一本书的索引列出了单词或表达方式以及可以在其中找到它们的书页。

words.suffix_cn: 动词后缀，表使动等意义
words.mnemonic_zh: “in”使“dic”说出来，即表明
words.example_en: The arrow on the map indicates the direction to the city center.
words.example_zh: 地图上的箭头指示着去市中心的方向。
words.en_def: To point out; to discover; to direct to a knowledge of; to show; to make known.

sentences.en: The guard blew his whistle to indicate imminent departure.
sentences.zh: 警卫吹响了哨子，示意即将离开。

sentences.en: Great prostration of strength indicates the use of stimulants.
sentences.zh: 力量的大幅下降表明使用了兴奋剂。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表动作、状态等
words.mnemonic_zh: indicate的名词形式，表明的内容就是迹象
words.example_en: There are some indications that the economy is improving.
words.example_zh: 有一些迹象表明经济正在好转。
words.en_def: Act of pointing out or indicating.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表做某事的人或物
words.mnemonic_zh: 能表明情况的东西就是指示器
words.example_en: The fuel indicator shows that we need to refuel soon.
words.example_zh: 燃油指示器显示我们很快需要加油了。
words.en_def: A pointer or index that indicates something.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表行为、结果等
words.mnemonic_zh: “in”使“dict”说出来指控的话，即控告
words.example_en: The indictment against the suspect was based on strong evidence.
words.example_zh: 对嫌疑人的起诉是基于有力的证据。
words.en_def: An official formal accusation for a criminal offence, or the process by which it is brought to a jury.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有……性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 在本地出生的，就是本土的
words.example_en: The indigenous people have a rich cultural heritage.
words.example_zh: 土著人民拥有丰富的文化遗产。
words.en_def: Born or originating in, native to a land or region, especially before an intrusion.

words.mnemonic_zh: “in”表示否定，即不直接的
words.example_en: He gave an indirect answer to the question.
words.example_zh: 他对这个问题给出了一个间接的回答。
words.en_def: An indirect cost.

words.mnemonic_zh: indirect的副词形式，表间接的方式
words.example_en: The problem was solved indirectly through a third - party.
words.example_zh: 这个问题通过第三方间接地得到了解决。
words.en_def: In an indirect manner.

words.mnemonic_zh: 不能再分割，就是单独地
words.example_en: The teacher evaluated the students' work individually.
words.example_zh: 老师分别对学生们的作业进行了评估。
words.en_def: As individuals, separately, independently

words.mnemonic_zh: “in”使“duc”引导进来，即引诱
words.example_en: The promise of a reward induced him to take the job.
words.example_zh: 有报酬的承诺诱使他接受了这份工作。
words.en_def: To lead by persuasion or influence; incite or prevail upon.

sentences.en: His meditation induced a compromise.   Opium induces sleep.
sentences.zh: 他的冥想导致了妥协。 鸦片有催眠作用。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“因大乐”，因为太快乐而沉溺
words.example_en: She often indulges in chocolate when she's stressed.
words.example_zh: 她压力大的时候经常纵情吃巧克力。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: (often followed by "in"): To yield to a temptation or desire.

sentences.en: He looked at the chocolate but didn't indulge.
sentences.zh: 他看着巧克力，但没有沉迷。

sentences.en: Grandma indulges the kids with sweets.
sentences.zh: 奶奶给孩子们准备了糖果。

sentences.en: to indulge sloth, pride, selfishness, or inclinations
sentences.zh: 放纵懒惰、骄傲、自私或倾向

words.suffix_cn: -al: 形容词后缀，表“……的”； -ization: 名词后缀，表示“……化”
words.mnemonic_zh: industry（工业）加上 -al 变形容词，再加 -ization 表“工业化”
words.example_en: The rapid industrialization has changed the face of this small town.
words.example_zh: 快速的工业化改变了这个小镇的面貌。
words.en_def: A process of social and economic change whereby a human society is transformed from a pre-industrial to an industrial state.

words.suffix_cn: -al: 形容词后缀，表“……的”； -ized: 动词过去分词后缀，表“被……化”
words.mnemonic_zh: industry 先加 -al 变形容词，再加 -ized 表“已工业化的”
words.example_en: Most industrialized countries have high - tech industries.
words.example_zh: 大多数工业化国家都有高科技产业。
words.en_def: (of a country) To develop industry; to become industrial.

words.mnemonic_zh: in- 表否定，ed 是“吃”，-ible 表“可……的”，即不可吃的
words.example_en: Some mushrooms are inedible and even poisonous.
words.example_zh: 有些蘑菇不可食用，甚至有毒。
words.en_def: Anything inedible; that which is not a foodstuff.

words.mnemonic_zh: in- 否定 efficient（有效率的），就是无效率的
words.example_en: This old machine is inefficient and needs to be replaced.
words.example_zh: 这台旧机器效率低下，需要更换。
words.en_def: A person who cannot or does not work efficiently.

sentences.en: Celery is an inefficient food.
sentences.zh: 芹菜是一种低效食物。

sentences.en: Jessica was terribly inefficient at cleaning, so her brother usually had to clean the whole room.
sentences.zh: 杰西卡打扫卫生的效率极低，所以她哥哥通常不得不打扫整个房间。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: in- 否定 equ（平等），-ality 表名词，即不平等
words.example_en: Social inequality is a serious problem in many countries.
words.example_zh: 社会不平等在许多国家是一个严重的问题。
words.en_def: An unfair, not equal, state.

words.mnemonic_zh: in- 否定 evit（避免），-able 表“可……的”，即不可避免的
words.example_en: Failure is an inevitable part of the learning process.
words.example_zh: 失败是学习过程中不可避免的一部分。
words.en_def: Something that is predictable, necessary, or cannot be avoided.

sentences.en: We were going so fast that the collision was inevitable.
sentences.zh: 我们开得太快了，碰撞是不可避免的。

sentences.en: My outburst met with the inevitable punishment.
sentences.zh: 我的爆发不可避免地受到了惩罚。

words.suffix_cn: -able: 形容词后缀，表示“可……的”； -ly: 副词后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: inevitable 加 -ly 变成副词，即不可避免地
words.example_en: As we grow older, we will inevitably face some health problems.
words.example_zh: 随着年龄增长，我们不可避免地会面临一些健康问题。
words.en_def: In a manner that is impossible to avoid or prevent.

sentences.en: Despite the town's best efforts, the dam inevitably gave way.
sentences.zh: 尽管该镇尽了最大努力，大坝还是不可避免地垮塌了。

sentences.en: Inevitably, the next-door neighbour began to mow his lawn just as she lays down her head after a long night shift.
sentences.zh: 不可避免的是，当她结束了漫长的夜班后，正当她低下头时，隔壁邻居开始修剪草坪。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示“具有……性质的”
words.mnemonic_zh: in- 否定 fam（名声），-ous 表性质，即坏名声的、臭名昭著的
words.example_en: The infamous criminal was finally caught by the police.
words.example_zh: 那个臭名昭著的罪犯最终被警方抓获。
words.en_def: Having a bad reputation, disreputable; notoriously bad, unpleasant or evil; widely known, especially for something bad.

sentences.en: He was an infamous perjurer.
sentences.zh: 他是一个臭名昭著的伪证者。

sentences.en: This infamous deed tarnishes all involved.
sentences.zh: 这一臭名昭著的行为玷污了所有参与者。

words.mnemonic_zh: in- 表否定，fan 是“说话”，婴儿不会说话
words.example_en: The mother took good care of her infant day and night.
words.example_zh: 母亲日夜悉心照料她的婴儿。
words.en_def: A very young human being, from birth to somewhere between six months and two years of age, needing almost constant care and/or attention.

words.mnemonic_zh: in- 进入，fect 作用，病菌进入身体起作用即感染
words.example_en: The virus can easily infect people in crowded places.
words.example_zh: 病毒在拥挤的地方很容易感染人。
words.en_def: To bring into contact with a substance that causes illness (a pathogen).

sentences.en: Not everyone will be infected when an epidemic strikes.
sentences.zh: 当流行病来袭时，并不是每个人都会被感染。

sentences.en: Her passion for dancing has infected me.
sentences.zh: 她对舞蹈的热情感染了我。

words.suffix_cn: 比较级形容词后缀，表‘较…的’
words.mnemonic_zh: 向下携带，品质就变次等啦
words.example_en: This product is inferior to the one we bought last time.
words.example_zh: 这个产品比我们上次买的那个差。
words.en_def: A person of lower stature to another

sentences.en: As you are my inferior, I can tell you to do anything I want.
sentences.zh: 因为你是我的下等人，所以我可以告诉你做任何我想做的事。

sentences.en: Anna had always felt inferior to her brother due to poor school grades.
sentences.zh: 由于学业成绩不佳，安娜一直觉得自己不如她的哥哥。

sentences.en: an inferior officer
sentences.zh: 下级官员

words.mnemonic_zh: 使进入打击状态
words.example_en: The storm inflicted heavy damage on the coastal village.
words.example_zh: 暴风雨给沿海村庄造成了严重破坏。
words.en_def: To thrust upon; to impose.

sentences.en: They inflicted terrible pains on her to obtain a confession.
sentences.zh: 为了让她招供，他们对她施加了极大的痛苦。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表‘有…性质的’
words.mnemonic_zh: 向内流动影响力
words.example_en: He is an influential figure in the business world.
words.example_zh: 他是商界有影响力的人物。
words.en_def: A person who has influence

sentences.en: Jane was very influential in getting the motion passed.
sentences.zh: 简对于这项动议的通过非常有影响力。

words.mnemonic_zh: 没有形式地，就是非正式
words.example_en: They met informally to discuss the new project.
words.example_zh: 他们非正式会面讨论新项目。
words.en_def: In an irregular or informal manner; without the usual forms.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表‘有…作用的’
words.mnemonic_zh: 使形成信息，就是有益的
words.example_en: The documentary is very informative about wildlife.
words.example_zh: 这部纪录片关于野生动物的信息很丰富。
words.en_def: Providing information; especially, providing useful or interesting information.

sentences.en: I read a very informative newspaper article on that subject last week.
sentences.zh: 上周我读到了一篇关于这个主题的信息非常丰富的报纸文章。

words.mnemonic_zh: 在下面的建筑结构，就是基础设施
words.example_en: The city needs to improve its infrastructure urgently.
words.example_zh: 这座城市急需改善其基础设施。
words.en_def: (systems theory) An underlying base or foundation especially for an organization or system.

sentences.en: The parasitic tyranny's infrastructure depends on secrecy in order to be effective.
sentences.zh: 寄生暴政的基础设施依赖于保密才能发挥作用。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表‘具有…性质的’
words.mnemonic_zh: 在里面黏附的，就是固有的
words.example_en: There are inherent risks in this investment.
words.example_zh: 这项投资有内在风险。
words.en_def: Naturally as part or consequence of something.

words.mnemonic_zh: 使拿住，就是抑制住
words.example_en: Stress can inhibit a person's ability to think clearly.
words.example_zh: 压力会抑制一个人清晰思考的能力。
words.en_def: To hold in or hold back; to keep in check; restrain.

words.mnemonic_zh: 使走起来，就是开始
words.example_en: The company decided to initiate a new marketing campaign.
words.example_zh: 公司决定发起一场新的营销活动。
words.en_def: A new member of an organization.

words.mnemonic_zh: 开始走的行为，就是主动性
words.example_en: Taking the initiative is crucial in achieving success.
words.example_zh: 采取主动对取得成功至关重要。
words.en_def: A beginning; a first move.

words.mnemonic_zh: in（进入）+ sert（放置），进入后放置即插入
words.example_en: Please insert the key into the lock carefully.
words.example_zh: 请小心地把钥匙插入锁中。
words.en_def: An image inserted into text.

sentences.en: This software can print compact disc inserts if you have the right size of paper.
sentences.zh: 如果您有合适的纸张尺寸，该软件可以打印光盘插页。

sentences.en: a threaded insert
sentences.zh: 螺纹插入件

sentences.en: In order to withdraw money from a cash machine, you have to insert your debit card.
sentences.zh: 为了从自动取款机取款，您必须插入借记卡。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示动作或行为的结果
words.mnemonic_zh: insert（插入）+ ion（名词后缀），表示插入的行为或事物
words.example_en: The insertion of a new clause in the contract is necessary.
words.example_zh: 在合同中插入一个新条款是必要的。
words.en_def: The act of inserting, or something inserted.

words.mnemonic_zh: in（在内）+ side（边）+ er（人），在内部一边的人即知情人
words.example_en: The insider provided some important information to the police.
words.example_zh: 知情人向警方提供了一些重要信息。
words.en_def: A person who has special knowledge about the inner workings of a group, organization, or institution.

words.mnemonic_zh: in（向内）+ sight（看），向内看即有洞察力
words.example_en: His insight into the problem impressed everyone.
words.example_zh: 他对这个问题的深刻见解给大家留下了深刻印象。
words.en_def: A sight or view of the interior of anything; a deep inspection or view; introspection; frequently used with into.

words.mnemonic_zh: in（不）+ significant（重要的），即不重要的
words.example_en: This detail is insignificant compared to the whole plan.
words.example_zh: 与整个计划相比，这个细节无关紧要。
words.en_def: Not significant; not important, inconsequential, or having no noticeable effect.

sentences.en: Such things are insignificant details compared to the main goal.
sentences.zh: 与主要目标相比，这些事情都是微不足道的细节。

words.mnemonic_zh: in（向内）+ spect（看），向内仔细看即检查
words.example_en: The police will inspect the building for any clues.
words.example_zh: 警方将检查这栋建筑物以寻找线索。
words.en_def: To examine critically or carefully; especially, to search out problems or determine condition; to scrutinize.

sentences.en: Inspect the system for leaks.
sentences.zh: 检查系统是否有泄漏。

sentences.en: The general inspected the troops and their barracks.
sentences.zh: 将军视察了部队和军营。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或过程
words.mnemonic_zh: inspect（检查）+ ion（名词后缀），表示检查的行为
words.example_en: The regular inspection of equipment is very important.
words.example_zh: 定期检查设备非常重要。
words.en_def: The act of examining something, often closely.

sentences.en: Upon closer inspection, the animal turned out to be a dolphin, not a shark!
sentences.zh: 仔细一看，原来是海豚，不是鲨鱼！

sentences.en: The inspection fined the restaurant's owner because the kitchen was dirty.
sentences.zh: 检查中因厨房脏乱对餐厅老板处以罚款。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: in（向内）+ spir（呼吸）+ ation（名词后缀），向内呼吸获得精神力量即灵感
words.example_en: His speech was a great inspiration to the young people.
words.example_zh: 他的演讲对年轻人是极大的鼓舞。
words.en_def: The drawing of air into the lungs, accomplished in mammals by elevation of the chest walls and flattening of the diaphragm, as part of the act of respiration.

sentences.en: She was waiting for inspiration to write a book.
sentences.zh: 她正在等待写书的灵感。

sentences.en: The trip was an inspiration to her for writing a book.
sentences.zh: 这次旅行给了她写书的灵感。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: in（使）+ stall（放置）+ ation（名词后缀），使放置好即安装
words.example_en: The installation of the new software took several hours.
words.example_zh: 新软件的安装花了几个小时。
words.en_def: An act of installing.

words.mnemonic_zh: in（在……中）+ stance（站立），在众多事物中站出来的即例子
words.example_en: This is a typical instance of how to solve the problem.
words.example_zh: 这是一个解决该问题的典型例子。
words.en_def: Urgency of manner or words; an urgent request; insistence.

sentences.en: It sends some precious instance of itself/ After the thing it loves. Hamlet IV. v. ca. 1602
sentences.zh: 它在它所爱的事物之后发送一些珍贵的自身实例。 哈姆雷特四世。 v. ca. 1602

words.mnemonic_zh: 内心被刺激出的反应，即本能
words.example_en: Animals often rely on instinct to find food and avoid danger.
words.example_zh: 动物常常依靠本能寻找食物和躲避危险。
words.en_def: A natural or inherent impulse or behaviour.

sentences.en: Many animals fear fire by instinct.
sentences.zh: 许多动物本能地害怕火。

sentences.en: Debbie's instinct was to distrust John.
sentences.zh: 黛比的本能是不信任约翰。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与……有关的
words.mnemonic_zh: 机构建立起来的就是制度性的
words.example_en: The country needs institutional reforms to promote economic growth.
words.example_zh: 该国需要进行制度改革以促进经济增长。
words.en_def: Of, pertaining to, characteristic of, or organized along the lines of an institution.

words.mnemonic_zh: 内心构建知识并传授，即指导
words.example_en: The teacher will instruct the students on how to solve the problem.
words.example_zh: 老师将指导学生如何解决这个问题。
words.en_def: Instruction.

sentences.en: Listen carefully when someone instructs you how to assemble the furniture.
sentences.zh: 当有人指导您如何组装家具时，请仔细聆听。

sentences.en: The doctor instructed me to keep my arm immobilised and begin physiotherapy.
sentences.zh: 医生指示我保持手臂不动并开始物理治疗。

words.mnemonic_zh: 内部使用的工具，就是仪器等
words.example_en: Scientists use various instruments to conduct experiments.
words.example_zh: 科学家使用各种仪器进行实验。
words.en_def: A device used to produce music.

sentences.en: The violinist was a master of her instrument.
sentences.zh: 这位小提琴家是她的乐器大师。

sentences.en: The instrument detected an increase in radioactivity.
sentences.zh: 仪器检测到放射性增加。

sentences.en: The dentist set down his tray of instruments.
sentences.zh: 牙医放下他的器械托盘。

words.cn_def: 有帮助的；起作用的；乐器的
words.mnemonic_zh: 和工具相关的，能起作用的
words.example_en: His advice was instrumental in solving the difficult problem.
words.example_zh: 他的建议对解决这个难题起了重要作用。
words.en_def: (grammar) The instrumental case.

sentences.en: He was instrumental in conducting the business.
sentences.zh: 他在开展业务方面发挥了重要作用。

sentences.en: An instrumental part
sentences.zh: 器乐部分

sentences.en: the instrumental case
sentences.zh: 乐器案例

words.mnemonic_zh: 不充足的就是不够的
words.example_en: The funds allocated for the project are insufficient.
words.example_zh: 为该项目分配的资金不足。
words.en_def: Not sufficient.

sentences.en: Insufficient time is available to reflect on the problem
sentences.zh: 没有足够的时间来反思问题

words.mnemonic_zh: 冲着人跳起来攻击，即侮辱
words.example_en: He felt deeply hurt by the insult from his colleague.
words.example_zh: 他因同事的侮辱而深感受伤。
words.en_def: Action or form of speech deliberately intended to be rude; a particular act or statement having this effect.

sentences.en: The way the orchestra performed tonight was an insult to my ears.
sentences.zh: 乐团今晚的表演方式对我的耳朵来说是一种侮辱。

words.mnemonic_zh: 没有被接触破坏，所以完好
words.example_en: The ancient vase remained intact after the earthquake.
words.example_zh: 地震后，那个古代花瓶依然完好无损。
words.en_def: Left complete or whole; not touched, defiled, sullied or otherwise damaged

sentences.en: I packed my belongings carefully so that they would survive the move intact.
sentences.zh: 我仔细地打包了我的物品，以便它们在搬家过程中完好无损。

sentences.en: The opposite of a circumcised penis is an intact penis.
sentences.zh: 与割过包皮的阴茎相反的是完整的阴茎。

words.mnemonic_zh: 向内拿取，就是摄入
words.example_en: The doctor advised him to control his daily calorie intake.
words.example_zh: 医生建议他控制每日的卡路里摄入量。
words.en_def: The place where water, air or other fluid is taken into a pipe or conduit; opposed to outlet.

sentences.en: the intake of air
sentences.zh: 空气的摄入量

sentences.en: an intake of oxygen or food
sentences.zh: 吸入氧气或食物

sentences.en: the new intake of students
sentences.zh: 新入学学生

words.cn_def: 不可或缺的；重要的；完整的
words.mnemonic_zh: 和整体相关的，是不可或缺的
words.example_en: Teamwork is an integral part of the project's success.
words.example_zh: 团队合作是项目成功不可或缺的一部分。
words.en_def: A number, the limit of the sums computed in a process in which the domain of a function is divided into small subsets and a possibly nominal value of the function on each subset is multiplied by the measure of that subset, all these products then being summed.

sentences.en: The integral of x\mapsto x^2 on [0,1] is \frac{1}{3}.
sentences.zh: x\mapsto x^2 在 [0,1] 上的积分为 \frac{1}{3}。

sentences.en: The integral of x^2 is \frac{x^3}{3} plus a constant.
sentences.zh: x^2 的积分是 \frac{x^3}{3} 加一个常数。

words.mnemonic_zh: 让东西完整在一起，即整合
words.example_en: They try to integrate different cultures in the community.
words.example_zh: 他们试图让社区里不同的文化相互融合。
words.en_def: To form into one whole; to make entire; to complete; to renew; to restore; to perfect.

sentences.en: They were keen to integrate their new skills into the performance.
sentences.zh: 他们热衷于将新技能融入到表演中。

sentences.en: The refugees were well integrated into the community.
sentences.zh: 难民们很好地融入了社区。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成
words.mnemonic_zh: 被整合好的，就是综合的
words.example_en: The school offers an integrated curriculum for students.
words.example_zh: 学校为学生提供了综合课程。
words.en_def: To form into one whole; to make entire; to complete; to renew; to restore; to perfect.

sentences.en: They were keen to integrate their new skills into the performance.
sentences.zh: 他们热衷于将新技能融入到表演中。

sentences.en: The refugees were well integrated into the community.
sentences.zh: 难民们很好地融入了社区。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 整合这个行为的结果就是融合
words.example_en: The integration of new technology boosts the company's development.
words.example_zh: 新技术的融合推动了公司的发展。
words.en_def: The act or process of making whole or entire.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 人品德完整就是正直诚实
words.example_en: People respect him for his integrity in business.
words.example_zh: 人们因他在商业中的正直而尊敬他。
words.en_def: Steadfast adherence to a strict moral or ethical code.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有……性质
words.mnemonic_zh: 能在事物间筛选的人有才智
words.example_en: He has an intellectual approach to solving problems.
words.example_zh: 他用一种有才智的方式解决问题。
words.en_def: An intelligent, learned person, especially one who discourses about learned matters.

sentences.en: intellectual powers, activities, etc.
sentences.zh: 智力、活动等

sentences.en: an intellectual person
sentences.zh: 一个知识分子

sentences.en: intellectual employments
sentences.zh: 智力就业

words.mnemonic_zh: 拉紧的状态就是强烈的
words.example_en: The intense heat made people stay indoors.
words.example_zh: 酷热让人们待在室内。
words.en_def: Strained; tightly drawn.

sentences.en: intense study;  intense thought
sentences.zh: 紧张的学习； 强烈的思考

sentences.en: The artist was a small, intense man with piercing blue eyes.
sentences.zh: 这位艺术家身材矮小，性格热情，有一双锐利的蓝眼睛。

words.mnemonic_zh: 使拉紧，就是增强
words.example_en: They plan to intensify the marketing campaign.
words.example_zh: 他们计划强化营销活动。
words.en_def: To render more intense

sentences.en: to intensify a photographic negative
sentences.zh: 强化摄影负片

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 拉紧的程度就是强度
words.example_en: The intensity of the storm caused great damage.
words.example_zh: 风暴的强度造成了巨大损失。
words.en_def: The quality of being intense.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有……性质
words.mnemonic_zh: 拉紧集中起来就是密集的
words.example_en: He attended an intensive language course.
words.example_zh: 他参加了一个密集的语言课程。
words.en_def: Form of a word with a stronger or more forceful sense than the root on which the intensive is built.

sentences.en: This job is difficult because it is so labour-intensive.
sentences.zh: 这项工作很困难，因为它是劳动密集型的。

sentences.en: I took a three-day intensive course in finance.
sentences.zh: 我参加了为期三天的金融强化课程。

sentences.en: an intensive verb or preposition
sentences.zh: 密集动词或介词

words.mnemonic_zh: 以拉紧集中的方式，即强烈集中地
words.example_en: The students studied intensively for the exam.
words.example_zh: 学生们为考试进行了集中的学习。
words.en_def: In an intensive way.

words.mnemonic_zh: 一心伸展去做，有意图
words.example_en: His intent was clear from the way he spoke.
words.example_zh: 从他说话的方式可以清楚看出他的意图。
words.en_def: A purpose; something that is intended.

sentences.en: a mind intent on self-improvement
sentences.zh: 致力于自我完善的思想

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程
words.mnemonic_zh: 相互行动产生交流
words.example_en: The interaction between the two groups was very positive.
words.example_zh: 这两个群体之间的交流非常积极。
words.en_def: The situation or occurrence in which two or more objects or events act upon one another to produce a new effect; the effect resulting from such a situation or occurrence.

sentences.en: Be aware of interactions between different medications.
sentences.zh: 注意不同药物之间的相互作用。

sentences.en: I enjoyed the interaction with a bunch of like-minded people.
sentences.zh: 我很享受与一群志同道合的人的互动。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有……性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 相互行动的，是互动的
words.example_en: The interactive display attracted many visitors.
words.example_zh: 交互式展示吸引了很多游客。
words.en_def: A feature (as in a museum) that can be interacted with.

sentences.en: interactive teaching methods
sentences.zh: 互动式教学方法

sentences.en: interactive user interface
sentences.zh: 交互式用户界面

words.mnemonic_zh: 处于事物之间，产生兴趣
words.example_en: She has a great interest in art history.
words.example_zh: 她对艺术史有浓厚的兴趣。
words.en_def: The price paid for obtaining, or price received for providing, money or goods in a credit transaction, calculated as a fraction of the amount or value of what was borrowed.

sentences.en: Our bank offers borrowers an annual interest of 5%.
sentences.zh: 我们银行向借款人提供 5% 的年利率。

sentences.en: He has a lot of interest in vintage cars.
sentences.zh: 他对老式汽车很感兴趣。

sentences.en: I have business interests in South Africa.
sentences.zh: 我在南非有商业利益。

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，由形容词加-ly 构成，表示方式
words.mnemonic_zh: 有兴趣地做，有趣地
words.example_en: Interestingly, he changed his decision at the last minute.
words.example_zh: 有趣的是，他在最后一刻改变了决定。
words.en_def: In an interesting way

words.mnemonic_zh: 相互接触的面，即界面
words.example_en: The software has a user - friendly interface.
words.example_zh: 这款软件有一个用户友好的界面。
words.en_def: The point of interconnection or contact between entities.

sentences.en: Public relations firms often serve as the interface between a company and the press.
sentences.zh: 公共关系公司通常充当公司和媒体之间的桥梁。

sentences.en: If water and oil are mixed together, they tend to separate, and at equilibrium they are in different strata with an oil-water interface in between.
sentences.zh: 如果水和油混合在一起，它们往往会分离，并且在平衡时它们处于不同的地层，其间存在油水界面。

sentences.en: The data is sent over the air interface to the remote system.
sentences.zh: 数据通过空中接口发送到远程系统。

words.mnemonic_zh: 跑到中间来干扰
words.example_en: Don't interfere in other people's affairs.
words.example_zh: 不要干涉别人的事情。
words.en_def: To get involved or involve oneself, causing disturbance.

sentences.en: I always try not to interfere with other people’s personal affairs.
sentences.zh: 我总是尽量不干涉别人的私事。

sentences.en: Correlated waves interfere to produce interesting patterns, while uncorrelated waves overlap without interfering.
sentences.zh: 相关波干涉产生有趣的图案，而不相关波重叠而不会产生干扰。

sentences.en: The investigation found the boys had been interfered with.
sentences.zh: 调查发现男孩们受到了干扰。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 干涉行为的名词形式
words.example_en: The interference from the radio affected the signal.
words.example_zh: 收音机的干扰影响了信号。
words.en_def: The act of interfering with something, or something that interferes.

sentences.en: They were glued to the TV, as the referee called out a fifteen yard penalty for interference.
sentences.zh: 他们全神贯注地看着电视，裁判因干扰而判罚十五码。

sentences.en: They wanted to watch the game on TV, but there was too much interference to even make out the score on the tiny screen.
sentences.zh: 他们想在电视上观看比赛，但干扰太多，连小屏幕上的比分都看不清。

words.mnemonic_zh: 存在于两段时间之间，是过渡时期
words.example_en: In the interim, we have to find a temporary solution.
words.example_zh: 在此期间，我们必须找到一个临时解决方案。
words.en_def: A transitional or temporary period between other events.

sentences.en: His car is in the shop, but they gave him a rental to drive in the interim.
sentences.zh: 他的车在店里，但他们暂时给他租了一辆。

sentences.en: Iraq's government is interim.
sentences.zh: 伊拉克政府是临时政府。

sentences.en: You are interim manager until he returns from hospital.
sentences.zh: 在他从医院回来之前，你是临时经理。

words.mnemonic_zh: 在更里面的部分，即内部
words.example_en: The interior of the house is beautifully decorated.
words.example_zh: 房子的内部装饰得很漂亮。
words.en_def: The inside of a building, container, cavern, or other enclosed structure.

sentences.en: Sir Richard Burton explored far into the African interior.
sentences.zh: 理查德·伯顿爵士深入非洲内陆进行了探索。

sentences.en: the interior apartments of a house; the interior surface of a hollow ball
sentences.zh: 房屋的内部公寓； 空心球的内表面

sentences.en: the interior parts of a region or country
sentences.zh: 一个地区或国家的内陆地区

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有……性质
words.mnemonic_zh: 在两者中间的就是中级的
words.example_en: This course is designed for intermediate learners of English.
words.example_zh: 这门课程是为中级英语学习者设计的。
words.en_def: Anything in an intermediate position.

sentences.en: Central banks need to regulate the entities that intermediate monetary transactions.
sentences.zh: 中央银行需要监管货币交易中介实体。

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，表示方式、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 在内部地，即‘内心’状态地
words.example_en: The organization is well - structured internally.
words.example_zh: 该组织内部结构良好。
words.en_def: In an internal manner; within or inside of external limits; in an inner part or situation.

words.mnemonic_zh: 在两者之间传达意思就是解释、口译
words.example_en: He can interpret French speeches for us.
words.example_zh: 他能为我们口译法语演讲。
words.en_def: To explain or tell the meaning of; to translate orally into intelligible or familiar language or terms. applied especially to language, but also to dreams, signs, conduct, mysteries, etc.

sentences.en: to interpret an Indian speech
sentences.zh: 翻译印度演讲

sentences.en: The actor interpreted the character of Hamlet with great skill.
sentences.zh: 这位演员以高超的技巧诠释了哈姆雷特的性格。

sentences.en: He interpreted at the meeting between the Chinese and French associates.
sentences.zh: 他在中法同事会面时担任翻译。

words.mnemonic_zh: 来到两者之间就是干预
words.example_en: The police had to intervene in the fight.
words.example_zh: 警察不得不介入这场打斗。
words.en_def: To become involved in a situation, so as to alter or prevent an action.

sentences.en: The police had to be called to intervene in the fight.
sentences.zh: 警方不得不被叫来介入这场斗殴。

sentences.en: An instant intervened between the flash and the report.
sentences.zh: 闪光和报告之间有一个瞬间的间隔。

sentences.en: Nothing intervened to prevent the undertaking.
sentences.zh: 没有任何干预来阻止这项工作。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示动作或行为的结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 来到其中的行为就是干预
words.example_en: The timely intervention saved the situation.
words.example_zh: 及时的干预挽救了局面。
words.en_def: The action of intervening; interfering in some course of events.

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似‘引题目’，能分享私人话题的就是亲密的
words.example_en: They have an intimate relationship.
words.example_zh: 他们有着亲密的关系。
words.morph_note: 该词难以进行典型的构词拆分
words.en_def: A very close friend.

sentences.en: Only a couple of intimates had ever read his writing.
sentences.zh: 只有几个亲密的人读过他的作品。

sentences.en: You'll find bras and panties in the women's intimates section upstairs.
sentences.zh: 您可以在楼上的女士内衣区找到胸罩和内裤。

sentences.en: He intimated that we should leave before the argument escalated.
sentences.zh: 他暗示我们应该在争吵升级之前离开。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有……性质或特征
words.mnemonic_zh: 能激起人兴趣的就是迷人有趣的
words.example_en: The speaker presented an intriguing idea.
words.example_zh: 演讲者提出了一个有趣的想法。
words.en_def: To conceive or carry out a secret plan intended to harm; to form a plot or scheme.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 向内引导，引出相关信息就是介绍
words.example_en: The introduction of new technology improved efficiency.
words.example_zh: 新技术的引进提高了效率。
words.en_def: The act or process of introducing.

sentences.en: the introduction of a new product into the market
sentences.zh: 将新产品引入市场

words.mnemonic_zh: 走进别人领地就是入侵
words.example_en: The enemy tried to invade the country.
words.example_zh: 敌人试图入侵这个国家。
words.en_def: To move into.

sentences.en: Under some circumstances police are allowed to invade a person's privacy.
sentences.zh: 在某些情况下，警察可以侵犯一个人的隐私。

sentences.en: Argentinian troops invaded the Falkland Islands in 1982.
sentences.zh: 1982年，阿根廷军队入侵福克兰群岛。

sentences.en: The picnic was invaded by ants.
sentences.zh: 野餐被蚂蚁入侵了。

words.prefix_cn: 此处表强调，不能按否定理解
words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有……能力或性质
words.cn_def: 非常宝贵的；极有价值的
words.mnemonic_zh: 强调价值大，就是极有价值的
words.example_en: Her advice was of invaluable help to me.
words.example_zh: 她的建议对我有极大的帮助。
words.morph_note: 这里的‘in - ’不表否定，注意与‘valuable’区分
words.en_def: Of great value; costly, precious, priceless.

words.mnemonic_zh: 进入追踪痕迹的人就是调查者
words.example_en: The investigator carefully examined the crime scene for clues.
words.example_zh: 调查者仔细检查了犯罪现场以寻找线索。
words.en_def: One who investigates.

words.mnemonic_zh: 不能被看到的就是看不见的
words.example_en: Air is invisible but we can feel its movement.
words.example_zh: 空气是看不见的，但我们能感觉到它的流动。
words.en_def: An invisible person or thing; specifically, God, the Supreme Being.

sentences.en: I went invisible so that my ex-girlfriend wouldn't send me instant messages.
sentences.zh: 我隐身了，这样我的前女友就不会给我发即时消息。

words.mnemonic_zh: 把人召唤进来就是邀请
words.example_en: She decided to invite her friends to her birthday party.
words.example_zh: 她决定邀请朋友们参加她的生日派对。
words.en_def: To ask for the presence or participation of someone or something.

sentences.en: We invited our friends round for dinner.
sentences.zh: 我们邀请我们的朋友来吃晚饭。

sentences.en: I invite you all to be seated.
sentences.zh: 我请大家就座。

sentences.en: I always invite criticism of my definitions.
sentences.zh: 我总是邀请对我的定义提出批评。

words.mnemonic_zh: 使呼喊出来，即唤起、援引
words.example_en: The lawyer invoked a relevant law to support his argument.
words.example_zh: 律师援引了一条相关法律来支持他的论点。
words.en_def: To call upon (a person, a god) for help, assistance or guidance.

sentences.en: The envoy invoked the King of Kings's magnanimity to reduce his province's tribute after another drought.
sentences.zh: 特使援引万王之王的宽宏大度，在又一次干旱之后减少了他的省份的贡赋。

sentences.en: In certain Christian circles, invoking the Bible constitutes irrefutable proof.
sentences.zh: 在某些基督教圈子里，援引《圣经》就构成了无可辩驳的证据。

sentences.en: This satanist ritual invokes Beelzebub.
sentences.zh: 这种撒旦仪式会召唤别西卜。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 进入卷入的状态就是参与
words.example_en: His involvement in the project brought new ideas.
words.example_zh: 他参与这个项目带来了新的想法。
words.en_def: The act of involving, or the state of being involved.

words.cn_def: 讽刺的；具有讽刺意味的
words.mnemonic_zh: 与反语相关的就是讽刺的
words.example_en: It's ironic that the fire - fighter's house burned down.
words.example_zh: 消防员的房子被烧毁了，这真是具有讽刺意味。
words.en_def: Characterized by or constituting (any kind of) irony.

sentences.en: It's ironic to have a blizzard in the middle of the summer.
sentences.zh: 仲夏时节竟然下起了暴风雪，真是讽刺。

sentences.en: It's ironic that we are eating a sandwich in Sandwich, Massachusetts.
sentences.zh: 讽刺的是，我们正在马萨诸塞州桑威奇吃三明治。

words.cn_def: 具有讽刺意味地；嘲讽地
words.mnemonic_zh: 以讽刺的方式就是讽刺地
words.example_en: Ironically, he failed the driving test he had prepared for so long.
words.example_zh: 具有讽刺意味的是，他精心准备许久的驾照考试没通过。
words.en_def: (manner) In an ironic manner; in a way displaying irony.

sentences.en: Ironically, the automated checkout system ended up costing more in repairs than the workers it was meant to replace.
sentences.zh: 具有讽刺意味的是，自动结帐系统最终的维修成本比它要取代的工人还要多。

words.cn_def: 讽刺；反语；具有讽刺意味的事
words.mnemonic_zh: 本身就表示讽刺
words.example_en: There is a great deal of irony in his words.
words.example_zh: 他的话里有很多讽刺意味。
words.en_def: A statement that, when taken in context, may actually mean something different from, or the opposite of, what is written literally; the use of words expressing something other than their literal intention, often in a humorous context.

sentences.en: The food had an irony taste to it.
sentences.zh: 食物有一种讽刺的味道。

words.mnemonic_zh: 不相关联的就是不相关的
words.example_en: His comment is irrelevant to the topic we're discussing.
words.example_zh: 他的评论与我们正在讨论的话题无关。
words.en_def: Not related, not applicable, unimportant, not connected.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“易惹他”，容易惹他生气就是激怒
words.example_en: The constant noise outside irritated the residents.
words.example_zh: 外面持续的噪音惹恼了居民们。
words.en_def: To provoke impatience, anger, or displeasure in.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成的状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 像在孤岛上一样，就是孤立的
words.example_en: The isolated house stands at the edge of the forest.
words.example_zh: 那座孤立的房子坐落在森林边缘。
words.en_def: To set apart or cut off from others.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 处于孤岛的状态就是隔离、孤立
words.example_en: He endured long - term isolation in the small village.
words.example_zh: 他在那个小村庄里忍受了长期的孤立。
words.en_def: The state of being isolated, detached, or separated.

sentences.en: Social distancing is social isolation, which is a human rights violation on par with torture and other war crimes.
sentences.zh: 社会疏远就是社会孤立，这是与酷刑和其他战争罪同等的侵犯人权行为。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词或名词后缀，这里作名词后缀表示与……相关的事物
words.mnemonic_zh: 行程方面的东西就是旅行计划
words.example_en: They carefully planned their itinerary for the trip.
words.example_zh: 他们仔细规划了这次旅行的行程。
words.en_def: A written schedule of activities for a vacation or road trip.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“酱”，可记成果酱；人挤一起也叫jam
words.example_en: The traffic jam made them late for the meeting.
words.example_zh: 交通堵塞使他们开会迟到了。
words.en_def: A sweet mixture of fruit boiled with sugar and allowed to congeal. Often spread on bread or toast or used in jam tarts.

sentences.en: A traffic jam caused us to miss the game's first period.
sentences.zh: 由于交通堵塞，我们错过了第一节比赛。

sentences.en: Her poor little baby toe got jammed in the door.
sentences.zh: 她可怜的小脚趾被门卡住了。

sentences.en: The rush-hour train was jammed with commuters.
sentences.zh: 高峰时段的火车挤满了通勤者。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“扎跟”，扎根行业的话即行话
words.example_zh: 医生们交谈时使用了很多专业行话。
words.example_en: The doctors used a lot of jargon when talking to each other.
words.en_def: A technical terminology unique to a particular subject.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，将形容词转化为名词
words.mnemonic_zh: jealous加上y就变成嫉妒的名词形式
words.example_en: Jealousy sometimes ruins good friendships.
words.example_zh: 嫉妒有时会毁掉美好的友谊。
words.en_def: A state of suspicious guarding towards a spouse, lover etc., from fears of infidelity.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“揪疼”，关节疼时会揪着疼
words.example_en: The athlete hurt his knee joint during the game.
words.example_zh: 运动员在比赛中伤了膝关节。
words.en_def: The point where two components of a structure join, but are still able to rotate.

sentences.en: This rod is free to swing at the joint with the platform.
sentences.zh: 该杆在与平台的连接处可以自由摆动。

sentences.en: The water is leaking out of the joint between the two pipes.
sentences.zh: 水从两根管子之间的连接处漏出。

sentences.en: The dovetail joint, while more difficult to make, is also quite strong.
sentences.zh: 燕尾榫接头虽然制造起来比较困难，但也相当坚固。

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，用于修饰动词，表示方式
words.mnemonic_zh: joint（联合）加ly变成副词，共同联合做某事
words.example_en: They worked jointly to complete the difficult project.
words.example_zh: 他们共同努力完成了那个艰巨的项目。
words.en_def: Together, acting as one; collectively.

sentences.en: They jointly raised the child, even though they were no longer married.
sentences.zh: 尽管他们不再结婚，但他们共同抚养孩子。

words.mnemonic_zh: 每天记录的东西就是日记或期刊
words.example_en: She writes in her journal every night before sleep.
words.example_zh: 她每晚睡觉前都会写日记。
words.en_def: A diary or daily record of a person, organization, vessel etc.; daybook.

sentences.en: The university's biology department subscribes to half a dozen academic journals.
sentences.zh: 该大学的生物系订阅了六种学术期刊。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“觉的”，凭感觉去判断
words.example_en: You shouldn't judge a person just by his appearance.
words.example_zh: 你不应该仅仅以貌取人。
words.en_def: A public official whose duty it is to administer the law, especially by presiding over trials and rendering judgments; a justice.

sentences.en: At a boxing match, the decision of the judges is final.
sentences.zh: 在拳击比赛中，裁判的决定是最终决定。

sentences.en: She is a good judge of wine.
sentences.zh: 她是一位很好的品酒鉴赏家。

sentences.en: A higher power will judge you after you are dead.
sentences.zh: 你死后，更高的力量会审判你。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与…相关的
words.mnemonic_zh: jud（判断）加上后缀，和司法审判判断有关
words.example_en: The judicial system plays a crucial role in maintaining social order.
words.example_zh: 司法体系在维护社会秩序方面起着至关重要的作用。
words.en_def: That branch of government which is responsible for maintaining the courts of law and for the administration of justice.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: junct（连接）加后缀，就是连接的地方
words.example_en: There is often heavy traffic at this road junction.
words.example_zh: 这个道路交汇处经常交通拥堵。
words.en_def: The act of joining, or the state of being joined.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“赃克”，像脏东西，就是垃圾
words.example_en: She threw away a lot of junk in the attic.
words.example_zh: 她扔掉了阁楼里的许多废旧杂物。
words.en_def: Discarded or waste material; rubbish, trash.

sentences.en: junk fish; junk trees
sentences.zh: 垃圾鱼； 垃圾树

sentences.en: (On Facebook, a record collector wrote:) "The newest addition to my Annette Hanshaw collection, I junked this beautiful flawless E-copy within walking distance from my house."
sentences.zh: （一位唱片收藏家在 Facebook 上写道：）“这是我安妮特·汉肖 (Annette Hanshaw) 收藏的最新成员，我在离我家步行不远的地方扔掉了这张美丽完美的电子版。”

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: juris（法律）和dict（宣称）结合，表示法律宣称的权力
words.example_en: This case falls under the jurisdiction of the local court.
words.example_zh: 这个案件属于当地法院的管辖范围。
words.en_def: The power, right, or authority to interpret and apply the law.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“追瑞”，想象追着要审判结果的一群人即陪审团
words.example_en: The jury reached a unanimous verdict.
words.example_zh: 陪审团达成了一致的裁决。
words.en_def: A group of individuals chosen from the general population to hear and decide a case in a court of law.

sentences.en: jury mast; jury rudder
sentences.zh: 陪审团桅杆； 陪审团舵

words.mnemonic_zh: 读音像“ justices”（正义），有公正之意
words.example_en: He always tries to make just decisions.
words.example_zh: 他总是努力做出公正的决定。
words.en_def: Factually right, correct; factual.

sentences.en: It is a just assessment of the facts.
sentences.zh: 这是对事实的公正评估。

sentences.en: It looks like a just solution at first glance.
sentences.zh: 乍一看，这似乎是一个公正的解决方案。

sentences.en: He calls it vermilion, but it's just red to me.
sentences.zh: 他称之为朱红色，但对我来说只是红色。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: just（公正）加上后缀，为公正找理由就是辩解
words.example_en: There is no justification for such harmful behavior.
words.example_zh: 这种有害行为没有任何正当理由。
words.en_def: A reason, explanation, or excuse which provides convincing, morally acceptable support for behavior or for a belief or occurrence.

words.mnemonic_zh: just（公正）加后缀，就是被证明公正合理的
words.example_en: His anger was justified given the situation.
words.example_zh: 考虑到当时的情况，他的愤怒是有道理的。
words.en_def: Having a justification.

sentences.en: The act was fully justified.
sentences.zh: 这一行为是完全正当的。

sentences.en: How can you justify spending so much money on clothes?
sentences.zh: 你怎么能证明花这么多钱买衣服是合理的呢？

sentences.en: Nothing can justify your rude behaviour last night.
sentences.zh: 没有什么可以证明你昨晚的粗鲁行为是正当的。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: juven（年轻）加后缀，和青少年、幼稚有关
words.example_en: Juvenile crime is a serious social problem.
words.example_zh: 青少年犯罪是一个严重的社会问题。
words.en_def: A prepubescent child.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“啃”，像啃东西一样专注敏锐
words.example_en: He has a keen interest in astronomy.
words.example_zh: 他对天文学有浓厚的兴趣。
words.en_def: To make cold, to sharpen.

sentences.en: I’m keen on computers.
sentences.zh: 我热衷于电脑。

sentences.en: This boy has a keen appetite.
sentences.zh: 这孩子的胃口真大。

sentences.en: keen satire or sarcasm
sentences.zh: 尖锐的讽刺或挖苦

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“啃葡萄”，啃着葡萄保持悠闲。
words.example_en: She always keeps her room clean and tidy.
words.example_zh: 她总是保持她的房间干净整洁。
words.en_def: The main tower of a castle or fortress, located within the castle walls.

sentences.en: He works as a cobbler's apprentice for his keep.
sentences.zh: 他当补鞋匠的学徒以维持生计。

sentences.en: to be in good keep
sentences.zh: 保持良好状态

sentences.en: to keep silence;  to keep one's word;  to keep possession
sentences.zh: 保持沉默； 遵守诺言； 保持占有

words.mnemonic_zh: kid（小孩）被 nab（逮住），就是绑架。
words.example_en: The criminals planned to kidnap a wealthy businessman.
words.example_zh: 罪犯们计划绑架一位富商。
words.en_def: The crime, or an instance, of kidnapping.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“凯迪呢”，凯迪（人名）担心他的肾。
words.example_en: He donated one of his kidneys to save his sister.
words.example_zh: 他捐出一个肾来救他的妹妹。
words.en_def: An organ in the body that filters the blood, producing urine.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“扣”，扣动扳机杀死人。
words.example_en: The snake's venom can kill small animals quickly.
words.example_zh: 蛇的毒液能迅速杀死小动物。
words.en_def: The act of killing.

sentences.en: The assassin liked to make a clean kill, and thus favored small arms over explosives.
sentences.zh: 刺客喜欢干净利落地杀死敌人，因此更喜欢使用小型武器而不是炸药。

sentences.en: The hunter delivered the kill with a pistol shot to the head.
sentences.zh: 猎人用手枪射击头部，完成了猎杀。

sentences.en: The fox dragged its kill back to its den.
sentences.zh: 狐狸把猎物拖回巢穴。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“金”，国王戴金冠。
words.example_en: The king ruled the country with wisdom and justice.
words.example_zh: 国王以智慧和公正统治国家。
words.en_def: A male monarch; a man who heads a monarchy. If it's an absolute monarchy, then he is the supreme ruler of his nation.

sentences.en: Henry VIII was the king of England from 1509 to 1547.
sentences.zh: 亨利八世是 1509 年至 1547 年间的英格兰国王。

sentences.en: Howard Stern styled himself as the "king of all media".
sentences.zh: 霍华德·斯特恩自诩为“所有媒体之王”。

sentences.en: In times of financial panic, cash is king.
sentences.zh: 金融恐慌时期，现金为王。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示领域、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: king（国王）的 dom（领地）就是王国。
words.example_en: The kingdom was famous for its beautiful castles.
words.example_zh: 这个王国以其美丽的城堡而闻名。
words.en_def: A realm having a king and/or queen as its actual or nominal sovereign.

sentences.en: the kingdom of the dead
sentences.zh: 死者王国

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“挠脖”，像挠脖子的球形物，如把手。
words.example_en: He turned the knob to open the door.
words.example_zh: 他转动旋钮打开了门。
words.en_def: A rounded protuberance, especially one arising from a flat surface; a fleshy lump or caruncle.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示“有……能力的、具备……的”
words.mnemonic_zh: 有 knowledge（知识）的人就是 knowledgeable（博学的）。
words.example_en: The professor is a knowledgeable person in this field.
words.example_zh: 这位教授在这个领域是个博学的人。
words.en_def: A person who has knowledge; an informed party.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“雷波”，打雷前贴标签预警。
words.example_en: Please read the label on the medicine bottle carefully.
words.example_zh: 请仔细阅读药瓶上的标签。
words.en_def: A small ticket or sign giving information about something to which it is attached or intended to be attached.

sentences.en: Although the label priced this poster at three pounds, I got it for two.
sentences.zh: 虽然这张海报的标签标价为三英镑，但我却花了两英镑买了它。

sentences.en: Ever since he started going to the rock club, he's been given the label "waster".
sentences.zh: 自从他开始去摇滚俱乐部，他就被贴上了“废物”的标签。

sentences.en: The label signed the band after hearing a demo tape.
sentences.zh: 唱片公司在听过演示磁带后与乐队签约。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“累吧”，劳动会累。
words.example_en: The construction workers' labour built this tall building.
words.example_zh: 建筑工人的劳动建成了这座高楼。
words.en_def: Effort expended on a particular task; toil, work.

sentences.en: I think we've all got the idea. There's no need to labour the point.
sentences.zh: 我想我们都明白了。 没有必要费力说明这一点。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“来的”，想象一个来的小伙子
words.example_en: The lad is very polite to everyone he meets.
words.example_zh: 这个小伙子对他遇到的每个人都很有礼貌。
words.en_def: A boy or young man.

sentences.en: I think he reckons he's a bit of a lad.
sentences.zh: 我认为他认为自己有点像个小伙子。

sentences.en: Come here, lad, and help me shift these boxes.
sentences.zh: 过来，小伙子，帮我搬这些箱子。

words.root: lad（可能和lad同源表示攀爬相关）
words.mnemonic_zh: lad（小伙子）用er（工具）爬，就是梯子
words.example_en: He leaned the ladder against the wall to pick apples.
words.example_zh: 他把梯子靠在墙上摘苹果。
words.morph_note: 词根来源不确定，是一种可能的联想拆分
words.en_def: A frame, usually portable, of wood, metal, or rope, used for ascent and descent, consisting of two side pieces to which are fastened rungs (cross strips or rounds acting as steps).

sentences.en: Oh damn it, I've laddered my tights!
sentences.zh: 哦该死，我已经把我的紧身衣拉起来了！

words.mnemonic_zh: 土地的主人就是房东或地主
words.example_en: The landlord raised the rent of the apartment.
words.example_zh: 房东提高了公寓的租金。
words.en_def: A person who owns and rents land such as a house, apartment, or condo.

words.mnemonic_zh: 土地上的标记就是地标
words.example_en: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.
words.example_zh: 埃菲尔铁塔是巴黎著名的地标。
words.en_def: An object that marks the boundary of a piece of land (usually a stone, or a tree).

sentences.en: a landmark paper in neurosurgery
sentences.zh: 神经外科领域的里程碑式论文

words.mnemonic_zh: 舌头发出的东西就是语言
words.example_en: English is a widely - spoken language in the world.
words.example_zh: 英语是世界上广泛使用的语言。
words.morph_note: 词根来源不确定，是一种可能的联想拆分
words.en_def: A body of words, and set of methods of combining them (called a grammar), understood by a community and used as a form of communication.

sentences.en: Deaf and mute people communicate using languages like ASL.
sentences.zh: 聋哑人使用美国手语等语言进行交流。

sentences.en: the gift of language
sentences.zh: 语言的恩赐

sentences.en: legal language;   the language of chemistry
sentences.zh: 法律语言； 化学语言

words.mnemonic_zh: 想象人坐着时大腿的样子
words.example_en: The cat curled up on her lap and fell asleep.
words.example_zh: 猫蜷缩在她的大腿上睡着了。
words.en_def: The loose part of a coat; the lower part of a garment that plays loosely; a skirt; an apron.

sentences.en: The boy was sitting on his mother's lap.
sentences.zh: 男孩坐在他母亲的腿上。

sentences.en: the lap of a board
sentences.zh: 木板的一圈

sentences.en: The second boat got a lap of half its length on the leader.
sentences.zh: 第二艘船比领先船绕了一半长度。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“镭射”，就是激光
words.example_en: The surgeon used a laser to perform the operation.
words.example_zh: 外科医生用激光进行手术。
words.en_def: A device that produces a monochromatic, coherent beam of light.

words.mnemonic_zh: 想象排在末尾的就是最后的
words.example_en: He was the last one to leave the classroom.
words.example_zh: 他是最后一个离开教室的人。
words.en_def: Final, ultimate, coming after all others of its kind.

sentences.en: “Eyes Wide Shut” was the last film to be directed by Stanley Kubrick.
sentences.zh: 《大开眼戒》是斯坦利·库布里克导演的最后一部电影。

sentences.en: I have received your note dated the 17th last, and am responding to say that [...]
sentences.zh: 我已收到您 17 日的来信，并回复说 [...]

sentences.en: He is the last person to be accused of theft.
sentences.zh: 他是最后一个被指控盗窃的人。

words.mnemonic_zh: last加er，更靠后的就是后者
words.example_zh: Of the two options, I prefer the latter one.
words.example_en: 在这两个选择中，我更喜欢后者。
words.morph_note: 和last有词源关联，是一种变形
words.en_def: Relating to or being the second of two items.

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“浪起”，像浪涌起一样发射出去
words.example_en: They plan to launch a new product next month.
words.example_zh: 他们计划下个月推出一款新产品。
words.en_def: The movement of a vessel from land into the water; especially, the sliding on ways from the stocks on which it is built. (Compare: to splash a ship.)

sentences.en: book launch
sentences.zh: 新书发布会

sentences.en: The navy launched another ship.
sentences.zh: 海军又下水了另一艘船。

sentences.en: NASA launched several unmanned rockets before launching any of the Mercury astronauts.
sentences.zh: 美国宇航局在发射任何水星宇航员之前发射了几枚无人驾驶火箭。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“垄”，草坪像一垄一垄的
words.example_en: The children are playing football on the lawn.
words.example_zh: 孩子们正在草坪上踢足球。
words.en_def: An open space between woods.

words.mnemonic_zh: 法律相关的诉讼，就是官司
words.example_en: He filed a lawsuit against the company for unfair dismissal.
words.example_zh: 他因被公司不公平解雇而对其提起诉讼。
words.en_def: In civil law, a case where two or more people disagree and one or more of the parties take the case to a court for resolution.

sentences.en: The lawyer advised his client against filing a lawsuit as it would take a lot of time and money to resolve.
sentences.zh: 律师建议他的当事人不要提起诉讼，因为这需要花费大量的时间和金钱来解决。

words.mnemonic_zh: 把东西向外放置，形成布局
words.example_en: The layout of the new bookstore is very user - friendly.
words.example_zh: 新书店的布局非常方便顾客。
words.en_def: A structured arrangement of items within certain limits.

words.mnemonic_zh: 带领大家的人就是领导者
words.example_en: The leader inspired the team to achieve great success.
words.example_zh: 这位领导者激励团队取得了巨大成功。
words.en_def: Any person that leads or directs

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示状态、身份
words.mnemonic_zh: 带领他人的身份和能力就是领导力
words.example_en: Under his leadership, the company has grown rapidly.
words.example_zh: 在他的领导下，公司发展迅速。
words.en_def: The capacity of someone to lead others.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“溜走”，东西溜走就是泄漏
words.example_en: The roof leaks when it rains heavily.
words.example_zh: 大雨时屋顶会漏水。
words.en_def: A crack, crevice, fissure, or hole which admits water or other fluid, or lets it escape.

sentences.en: a leak in a boat
sentences.zh: 船上漏水

sentences.en: The babies' diapers had big leaks.
sentences.zh: 婴儿的尿布有很大的渗漏。

sentences.en: The leaks by Chelsea Manning showed the secrets of the US military.
sentences.zh: 切尔西·曼宁的泄密事件揭示了美国军方的秘密。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“立扑”，立起来扑出去像跳跃
words.example_en: The deer can leap over the fence easily.
words.example_zh: 鹿能轻易地跳过围栏。
words.en_def: The act of leaping or jumping.

sentences.en: It's quite a leap to claim that those cloud formations are evidence of UFOs.
sentences.zh: 声称这些云层是不明飞行物的证据是相当夸张的。

sentences.en: to leap a wall or a ditch
sentences.zh: 跳过墙壁或沟渠

sentences.en: to leap a horse across a ditch
sentences.zh: 使马跃过沟渠

words.mnemonic_zh: 留下的东西就是遗产
words.example_en: He left a large financial legacy to his children.
words.example_zh: 他给孩子们留下了一大笔财产遗产。
words.en_def: Money or property bequeathed to someone in a will.

sentences.en: John Muir left as his legacy an enduring spirit of respect for the environment.
sentences.zh: 约翰·缪尔留下了一种持久的尊重环境的精神作为他的遗产。

sentences.en: Because she was a legacy, her mother's sorority rushed her.
sentences.zh: 因为她是一个遗产，所以她母亲的联谊会催促她。

words.mnemonic_zh: 口口相传的故事就是传说
words.example_en: The legend of the hero has been passed down for generations.
words.example_zh: 这位英雄的传说已经流传了几代人。
words.morph_note: 后缀 end 无典型构词意义，此处拆分仅为辅助理解
words.en_def: An unrealistic story depicting past events.

sentences.en: According to the legend on the map, that building is a school.
sentences.zh: 根据地图上的传说，那座建筑是一所学校。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 和传说有关的就是传奇的
words.example_en: The legendary athlete broke many world records.
words.example_zh: 这位传奇运动员打破了多项世界纪录。
words.en_def: A collection of legends, in particular of lives of saints.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: legis（法律）+ ation（行为），即立法行为
words.example_en: The government is planning new legislation to protect the environment.
words.example_zh: 政府正计划制定新的法规来保护环境。
words.en_def: The act of legislating; preparation and enactment of laws; the laws enacted.

words.mnemonic_zh: legis（法律）+ ative（有……性质），即有立法性质的
words.example_en: The legislative branch plays a crucial role in the country's governance.
words.example_zh: 立法部门在国家治理中起着至关重要的作用。
words.en_def: That branch of government which is responsible for making, or having the power to make, a law or laws.

sentences.en: Although enormously influential in shaping the laws of the land, The House of Lords are not actually a legislative body.
sentences.zh: 尽管上议院在制定国家法律方面具有巨大影响力，但实际上并不是立法机构。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示场所、机构
words.mnemonic_zh: legis（法律）+ ature（机构），即立法的机构
words.example_en: The legislature debated the new tax bill for hours.
words.example_zh: 立法机关就新的税收法案进行了数小时的辩论。
words.en_def: A governmental body with the power to make, amend and repeal laws.

words.mnemonic_zh: legit（合法）+ imate（使……），即使之合法的
words.example_en: His request for a raise is legitimate considering his hard work.
words.example_zh: 考虑到他工作努力，他加薪的请求是合理的。
words.en_def: A person born to a legally married couple.

sentences.en: legitimate reasoning; a legitimate standard or method
sentences.zh: 合理的推理； 合法的标准或方法

sentences.en: legitimate poems of Chaucer; legitimate inscriptions
sentences.zh: 乔叟的合法诗歌； 合法的铭文

words.mnemonic_zh: 联想“long（长的）”，加 th 变名词
words.example_en: The length of the bridge is over 500 meters.
words.example_zh: 这座桥的长度超过了 500 米。
words.en_def: The distance measured along the longest dimension of an object.

sentences.en: the length of a book
sentences.zh: 一本书的长度

sentences.en: a length of rope
sentences.zh: 一段绳子

words.mnemonic_zh: length（长度）+ en（使……），即使长度增加
words.example_en: They decided to lengthen the rope to reach the other side.
words.example_zh: 他们决定把绳子加长以够到另一边。
words.en_def: To make longer, to extend the length of.

sentences.en: The shadows on the lawn lengthened as the sun began to set.
sentences.zh: 太阳开始落山，草坪上的影子拉长了。

words.mnemonic_zh: length（长度）+ y（有……的），即有长的属性
words.example_en: He gave a lengthy speech at the conference.
words.example_zh: 他在会议上作了一个冗长的演讲。
words.en_def: Having length; long and overextended, especially in time rather than dimension.

sentences.en: She died last night after a lengthy illness.
sentences.zh: 她在长期患病后于昨晚去世。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音联想“蕾丝边”
words.example_en: She came out as a lesbian last year.
words.example_zh: 她去年公开了自己女同性恋者的身份。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: A homosexual woman, one who is mostly or exclusively sexually or romantically attracted to other women.

sentences.en: She is lesbian.
sentences.zh: 她是女同性恋。

sentences.en: a lesbian relationship / marriage / kiss
sentences.zh: 女同性恋关系/婚姻/接吻

sentences.en: We're going to a lesbian bar tonight.
sentences.zh: 今晚我们要去一家女同性恋酒吧。

words.mnemonic_zh: less（更少）+ en（使……），即使之变少
words.example_en: Taking exercise can lessen the risk of heart disease.
words.example_zh: 锻炼可以降低患心脏病的风险。
words.en_def: To make less; to diminish; to reduce.

words.mnemonic_zh: less（更少）+ er（比较级），表示更少量的
words.example_en: He played a lesser role in the project.
words.example_zh: 他在这个项目中扮演了次要角色。
words.en_def: A thing that is of smaller size, value, importance etc.

sentences.en: The greater sand hills increasingly do not migrate, but almost all lessers do.
sentences.zh: 较大的沙山越来越不会迁移，但几乎所有较小的沙山都会迁移。

sentences.en: This is a little table.
sentences.zh: 这是一张小桌子。

sentences.en: It's of little importance.
sentences.zh: 这并不重要。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘累透’，累透了可能有致命危险。
words.example_en: The snake's venom is lethal to small animals.
words.example_zh: 这种蛇的毒液对小动物是致命的。
words.en_def: Any weapon that causes death.

words.mnemonic_zh: 想象一个水平的平面，表示稳定的程度。
words.example_en: The water reached a dangerous level after the heavy rain.
words.example_zh: 大雨过后，水位达到了危险的程度。
words.en_def: A tool for finding whether a surface is level, or for creating a horizontal or vertical line of reference.

sentences.en: Hand me the level so I can tell if this is correctly installed.
sentences.zh: 把水平仪交给我，这样我就可以判断它是否安装正确。

sentences.en: By the end of the day, we'd dug down to the level of the old basement floor.
sentences.zh: 到一天结束时，我们已经挖到了旧地下室的水平。

sentences.en: The sound level is much too high; this hurts my ears.   We've reached a new level of success.
sentences.zh: 噪音水平太高； 这让我的耳朵很痛。 我们已经达到了新的成功水平。

words.suffix: ility（名词后缀，表示性质、状态）
words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 被责任‘捆绑’，有负债的压力。
words.example_en: The company faces huge liabilities due to the lawsuit.
words.example_zh: 由于这场诉讼，公司面临着巨额负债。
words.en_def: An obligation, debt or responsibility owed to someone.

words.suffix: able（形容词后缀，表示有……能力或倾向）
words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示有……能力或倾向
words.cn_def: 有责任的，有义务的；可能的
words.mnemonic_zh: 容易被责任‘捆绑’，所以有责任、可能出事。
words.example_en: Drivers are liable for any damage they cause.
words.example_zh: 司机应对他们造成的任何损坏负责。
words.en_def: Bound or obliged in law or equity; responsible; answerable.

sentences.en: 1748. David Hume. Enquiries concerning the human understanding and concerning the principles of moral. London: Oxford University Press, 1973. § 34.
sentences.zh: 1748.大卫·休谟。 关于人类理解和道德原则的询问。 伦敦：牛津大学出版社，1973 年。§ 34。

sentences.en: A man liable to heart disease.
sentences.zh: 一个容易患心脏病的人。

sentences.en: Someone is liable to slip on your icy sidewalk.
sentences.zh: 有人可能会在结冰的人行道上滑倒。

words.mnemonic_zh: 有自由观念的人通常是开明、慷慨的。
words.example_en: He has liberal views on social issues.
words.example_zh: 他在社会问题上有开明的观点。
words.en_def: One with liberal views, supporting individual liberty (see Wikipedia's article on Liberalism).

sentences.en: 1983, David Leslie Wagner, The Seven liberal arts in the Middle Ages
sentences.zh: 1983，大卫·莱斯利·瓦格纳，《中世纪的七门文科》

sentences.en: He was liberal with his compliments.
sentences.zh: 他的赞美很慷慨。

sentences.en: Add a liberal sprinkling of salt.
sentences.zh: 添加适量的盐。

words.suffix: ation（名词后缀，表示行为、状态）
words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 让自由的状态实现，就是解放。
words.example_en: The country celebrated its liberation from colonial rule.
words.example_zh: 这个国家庆祝从殖民统治下获得解放。
words.en_def: The act of liberating or the state of being liberated.

words.suffix: ty（名词后缀，表示性质、状态）
words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 体现自由的状态就是自由权。
words.example_en: People should respect each other's liberty.
words.example_zh: 人们应该尊重彼此的自由。
words.en_def: The condition of being free from control or restrictions.

sentences.en: The army is here, your liberty is assured.
sentences.zh: 军队来了，你的自由有保障。

sentences.en: The prisoners gained their liberty from an underground tunnel.
sentences.zh: 囚犯们从地下隧道中获得了自由。

sentences.en: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.
sentences.zh: 每个人都享有生命权、自由权和人身安全权。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似‘来审视’，需要审查才能发许可证。
words.example_en: You need a license to operate this kind of vehicle.
words.example_zh: 你需要有执照才能驾驶这种车辆。
words.en_def: A legal document giving official permission to do something; a permit.

sentences.en: In order to enter the building, I need to show my license.
sentences.zh: 为了进入大楼，我需要出示我的许可证。

sentences.en: It was decided to license Wikipedia under the GFDL.
sentences.zh: 决定根据 GFDL 授权维基百科。

sentences.en: I am licensed to practice law in this state.
sentences.zh: 我获得在该州执业的许可。

words.mnemonic_zh: 生命那么长，就是终身啦。
words.example_en: He has a lifelong passion for painting.
words.example_zh: 他一生都热爱绘画。
words.en_def: Extending for the entire duration of life.

sentences.en: They were lifelong friends; they met in elementary school and ended their lives in the same rest home.
sentences.zh: 他们是终生的朋友； 他们在小学相识，并在同一所疗养院结束了生命。

words.mnemonic_zh: 以轻的方式做，就是轻轻地、轻松地。
words.example_en: She touched the flower lightly with her finger.
words.example_zh: 她用手指轻轻地触碰那朵花。
words.en_def: In a light manner.

sentences.en: As a teacher, I don't take rudeness in class lightly.
sentences.zh: 作为一名老师，我不会对课堂上的粗鲁行为掉以轻心。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: like（可能）加上 -hood 表状态，就是可能性
words.example_en: There is a high likelihood of rain tomorrow according to the forecast.
words.example_zh: 根据预报，明天很有可能下雨。
words.en_def: The probability of a specified outcome; the chance of something happening; probability; the state or degree of being probable.

sentences.en: In all likelihood the meeting will be cancelled.
sentences.zh: 会议很可能会被取消。

sentences.en: "There is no likelihood between pure light and black darkness, or between righteousness and reprobation." (Sir W. Raleigh)
sentences.zh: “纯粹的光明与黑暗之间、正义与谴责之间没有任何可能。” （W·罗利爵士）

sentences.en: "What of his heart perceive you in his face by any likelihood he showed to-day ?" (Shak)
sentences.zh: “他今天表现出的表情有可能从他的脸上看出你的内心是怎样的吗？” （沙克）

words.mnemonic_zh: like（可能）加 -ly 变成可能的
words.example_en: He is the most likely candidate for the job.
words.example_zh: 他是这份工作最有可能的候选人。
words.en_def: Something or somebody considered likely.

sentences.en: Rain is likely later this afternoon.
sentences.zh: 今天下午晚些时候可能会下雨。

sentences.en: He is likely to succeed at anything he tries.
sentences.zh: 他尝试的任何事情都可能成功。

sentences.en: Jones is a likely candidate for management.
sentences.zh: 琼斯可能是管理层的候选人。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“林步”，林中行走靠四肢
words.example_en: The athlete injured his limb during the competition.
words.example_zh: 运动员在比赛中伤到了他的肢体。
words.en_def: A major appendage of human or animal, used for locomotion (such as an arm, leg or wing).

sentences.en: They limbed the felled trees before cutting them into logs.
sentences.zh: 他们将砍伐的树木砍伐成树枝，然后将其砍成原木。

sentences.en: solar limb
sentences.zh: 太阳肢

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: limit（限制）加 -ation 表状态，就是限制、局限
words.example_en: We should be aware of the limitations of this method.
words.example_zh: 我们应该意识到这种方法的局限性。
words.en_def: The act of limiting or the state of being limited.

sentences.en: Getting into his wheelchair after his amputation, it felt like a limitation you could roll in.
sentences.zh: 截肢后坐上轮椅，感觉就像是一个可以滚动的限制。

sentences.en: The lawyer obtained impunity by dragging his obviously guilty client's case beyond the ten-year limitation.
sentences.zh: 这位律师通过将明显有罪的委托人的案件拖到十年期限之外而获得了有罪不罚的机会。

words.suffix_cn: -ation 是名词后缀，表示行为、状态； -s 是复数后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: limit（限制）加 -ation 表状态，再加 -s 成复数
words.example_en: The limitations of the old system are obvious.
words.example_zh: 旧系统的局限性很明显。
words.en_def: The act of limiting or the state of being limited.

sentences.en: Getting into his wheelchair after his amputation, it felt like a limitation you could roll in.
sentences.zh: 截肢后坐上轮椅，感觉就像是一个可以滚动的限制。

sentences.en: The lawyer obtained impunity by dragging his obviously guilty client's case beyond the ten-year limitation.
sentences.zh: 这位律师通过将明显有罪的委托人的案件拖到十年期限之外而获得了有罪不罚的机会。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“来恩”，画线条来感恩
words.example_en: Please draw a straight line on the paper.
words.example_zh: 请在纸上画一条直线。
words.en_def: A path through two or more points (compare ‘segment’); a continuous mark, including as made by a pen; any path, curved or straight.

sentences.en: The arrow descended in a curved line.
sentences.zh: 箭矢呈曲线下降。

sentences.en: a brake line
sentences.zh: 刹车线

sentences.en: the line of sight
sentences.zh: 视线

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与……有关
words.mnemonic_zh: line（线）加 -ar 表示与线有关，即线性的
words.example_en: This problem requires a linear solution.
words.example_zh: 这个问题需要一个线性的解决方案。
words.en_def: Having the form of a line; straight or roughly straight; following a direct course.

sentences.en: a linear medium
sentences.zh: 线性介质

sentences.en: a linear meter
sentences.zh: 一延米

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“林哥”，林哥在林中徘徊
words.example_en: She likes to linger in the park after dinner.
words.example_zh: 她喜欢晚饭后在公园里徘徊。
words.en_def: To stay or remain in a place or situation, especially as if unwilling to depart or not easily able to do so; to loiter.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与……有关
words.mnemonic_zh: lingu（语言）加 -istic 表示与语言有关，即语言学的
words.example_en: Linguistic research helps us understand human communication better.
words.example_zh: 语言学研究有助于我们更好地理解人类交流。
words.en_def: Of or relating to language.

words.mnemonic_zh: listen（听）加 -er 表示人，就是听众
words.example_en: The speaker attracted a large number of listeners.
words.example_zh: 演讲者吸引了大量的听众。
words.en_def: Someone who listens, especially to a speech or a broadcast.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表动作或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: list 加 ing，成名词表列表
words.example_en: The website provides a listing of local restaurants.
words.example_zh: 该网站提供了当地餐馆的列表。
words.en_def: To create or recite a list.

sentences.en: to list a door
sentences.zh: 列出一扇门

sentences.en: to list a board
sentences.zh: 列出一个板

sentences.en: the steady wind listed the ship
sentences.zh: 稳风使船倾斜

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: liter 关于文字，acy 表状态成能力
words.example_en: Improving literacy is crucial for personal development.
words.example_zh: 提高读写能力对个人发展至关重要。
words.en_def: The ability to read and write.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似'里头'，小东西藏里头
words.example_en: There is little time left for the project.
words.example_zh: 这个项目剩下的时间不多了。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: A small amount.

sentences.en: Can I try a little of that sauce?
sentences.zh: 我可以尝尝那个酱汁吗？

sentences.en: This is a little table.
sentences.zh: 这是一张小桌子。

sentences.en: It's of little importance.
sentences.zh: 这并不重要。

words.mnemonic_zh: 联想活人（li ve r）需要肝脏
words.example_en: The doctor examined his liver carefully.
words.example_zh: 医生仔细检查了他的肝脏。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: A large organ in the body that stores and metabolizes nutrients, destroys toxins and produces bile. It is responsible for thousands of biochemical reactions.

sentences.en: Steve Jobs is a famous liver transplant recipient.
sentences.zh: 史蒂夫·乔布斯是著名的肝脏移植接受者。

sentences.en: I'd like some goose liver pate.
sentences.zh: 我想要一些鹅肝酱。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似'楼壁'，大厅在楼边
words.example_en: People gathered in the lobby before the meeting.
words.example_zh: 会议前人们聚集在大厅里。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: An entryway or reception area; vestibule; passageway; corridor.

sentences.en: I had to wait in the lobby for hours before seeing the doctor.
sentences.zh: 我不得不在大厅等了几个小时才去看医生。

sentences.en: The influence of the tobacco lobby has decreased considerably in the US.
sentences.zh: 在美国，烟草游说团体的影响力已大大下降。

sentences.en: For years, pro-life groups have continued to lobby hard for restrictions on abortion.
sentences.zh: 多年来，反堕胎团体一直在努力游说限制堕胎。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似'咯'，像砍原木声
words.example_en: He wrote down the events in his log.
words.example_zh: 他把事件记录在日志里。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: The trunk of a dead tree, cleared of branches.

sentences.en: They walked across the stream on a fallen log.
sentences.zh: 他们踩着一根倒下的木头走过小溪。

sentences.en: to log the miles travelled by a ship
sentences.zh: 记录船舶行驶的里程

sentences.en: To multiply two numbers, add their logs.
sentences.zh: 要将两个数字相乘，请将它们的对数相加。

words.mnemonic_zh: log 表推理，ic 成逻辑
words.example_en: There is no logic in his argument.
words.example_zh: 他的论证毫无逻辑。
words.en_def: A method of human thought that involves thinking in a linear, step-by-step manner about how a problem can be solved. Logic is the basis of many principles including the scientific method.

sentences.en: It's hard to work out his system of logic.
sentences.zh: 很难弄清楚他的逻辑系统。

sentences.en: Fred is designing the logic for the new controller.
sentences.zh: Fred 正在设计新控制器的逻辑。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表性质或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: lone 孤独，liness 表状态成孤独感
words.example_en: He couldn't bear the loneliness of living alone.
words.example_zh: 他无法忍受独自生活的孤独。
words.en_def: A feeling of depression resulting from being alone or from having no companions.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似'路客'，路人观看一路景
words.example_en: She often looks out of the window.
words.example_zh: 她经常望向窗外。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似'路母'，像路尽头隐现的影子
words.example_en: The problem loomed large in his mind.
words.example_zh: 那个问题在他脑海中显得很严峻。
words.morph_note: 该词不宜强行拆分
words.en_def: A utensil; tool; a weapon; (usually in compound) an article in general.

sentences.en: The clouds loomed over the mountains.
sentences.zh: 云彩笼罩在群山之上。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“路铺”，像路上铺的环形物
words.example_en: The plane made a loop in the sky before landing.
words.example_zh: 飞机着陆前在天空中绕了个圈。
words.en_def: A length of thread, line or rope that is doubled over to make an opening.

sentences.en: Arches, loops, and whorls are patterns found in fingerprints.
sentences.zh: 拱形、环形和螺纹是指纹中发现的图案。

sentences.en: The program loops until the user presses a key.
sentences.zh: 程序循环直到用户按下某个键。

words.mnemonic_zh: 联想：东西溜走（谐音）就失去了
words.example_en: He always tends to lose his keys.
words.example_zh: 他总是容易丢钥匙。
words.en_def: To cause (something) to cease to be in one's possession or capability due to unfortunate or unknown circumstances, events or reasons.

sentences.en: He lost his hearing in the explosion.
sentences.zh: 他在爆炸中失去了听力。

sentences.en: I lost my way in the forest.
sentences.zh: 我在森林里迷了路。

sentences.en: We lost the football match.
sentences.zh: 我们输掉了那场足球比赛。

words.mnemonic_zh: lose 的名词形式，失去的结果就是损失
words.example_en: The company suffered a great loss last year.
words.example_zh: 这家公司去年遭受了重大损失。
words.en_def: The result of no longer possessing an object, a function, or a characteristic due to external causes or misplacement.

sentences.en: In other areas, glacier loss creates serious risk of a dry period across the Third Pole, Wang said.
sentences.zh: 王说，在其他地区，冰川消失造成第三极干旱期的严重风险。

sentences.en: It was a terrible crash; both cars were total losses.
sentences.zh: 这是一次可怕的车祸。 两辆车都全损了。

sentences.en: The match ended in their first loss of the season.
sentences.zh: 这场比赛以他们本赛季的首场失利告终。

words.mnemonic_zh: lose 的过去式和过去分词形式，引申为状态
words.example_zh: 那些迷路的孩子最终被找到了。
words.example_en: The lost children were finally found.
words.en_def: To cause (something) to cease to be in one's possession or capability due to unfortunate or unknown circumstances, events or reasons.

sentences.en: He lost his hearing in the explosion.
sentences.zh: 他在爆炸中失去了听力。

sentences.en: I lost my way in the forest.
sentences.zh: 我在森林里迷了路。

sentences.en: We lost the football match.
sentences.zh: 我们输掉了那场足球比赛。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“浪着”，可在休息室悠闲浪着
words.example_en: They sat in the lounge, chatting and drinking coffee.
words.example_zh: 他们坐在休息室里，边喝咖啡边聊天。
words.en_def: A waiting room in an office, airport etc.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“楼”，低楼就是矮的
words.example_en: The temperature will be low tonight.
words.example_zh: 今晚气温会很低。
words.en_def: Something that is low; a low point.

sentences.en: Economic growth has hit a new low.
sentences.zh: 经济增速再创新低。

sentences.en: Unemployment has reached a ten-year low.
sentences.zh: 失业率已达到十年来的最低点。

sentences.en: He is in a low right now
sentences.zh: 他现在正处于低谷

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: loyal（忠诚的）加后缀成名词
words.example_en: His loyalty to the company is beyond doubt.
words.example_zh: 他对公司的忠诚是毋庸置疑的。
words.en_def: The state of being loyal; fidelity.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质
words.mnemonic_zh: luxur（奢华）加后缀变奢华的
words.example_en: They stayed in a luxurious hotel during the holiday.
words.example_zh: 他们度假时住在一家豪华酒店里。
words.en_def: Very fine in quality and comfortable.

sentences.en: a luxurious hotel suite
sentences.zh: 豪华酒店套房

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: luxur（奢华）加后缀成名词
words.example_en: Buying a yacht is a real luxury for most people.
words.example_zh: 对大多数人来说，买游艇是真正的奢侈行为。
words.en_def: Very wealthy and comfortable surroundings.

words.mnemonic_zh: machine（机器）加后缀表机器总称
words.example_en: The factory is equipped with advanced machinery.
words.example_zh: 这家工厂配备了先进的机器。
words.en_def: The machines constituting a production apparatus, in a plant etc., collectively.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: mag(魔法)+ical(的)，有魔法的就是神奇的
words.example_en: The magician performed some truly magical tricks.
words.example_zh: 魔术师表演了一些真正神奇的魔术。
words.en_def: Of or relating to magic.

sentences.en: The fireworks created a magical atmosphere in that beautiful summer night.
sentences.zh: 烟花在那个美丽的夏夜营造出一种神奇的气氛。

words.mnemonic_zh: magist(权威)+rate(人)，有权威的人是地方官
words.example_en: The magistrate dealt with the minor cases efficiently.
words.example_zh: 地方法官高效地处理了这些轻微案件。
words.en_def: A judicial officer with limited authority to administer and enforce the law. A magistrate's court may have jurisdiction in civil or criminal cases, or both.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表与…有关的
words.mnemonic_zh: magnet(磁铁)+ic(的)，像磁铁一样有磁性或吸引力
words.example_en: The magnetic field affects the movement of charged particles.
words.example_zh: 磁场影响带电粒子的运动。
words.en_def: Of, relating to, operating by, or caused by magnetism.

sentences.en: a magnetic recorder
sentences.zh: 磁记录器

sentences.en: magnetic north
sentences.zh: 磁北

sentences.en: He has a magnetic personality.
sentences.zh: 他具有磁性的个性。

words.mnemonic_zh: magnific(壮观)+ently(地)，壮观地做事
words.example_en: The palace was decorated magnificently for the festival.
words.example_zh: 宫殿为节日进行了华丽的装饰。
words.en_def: In a magnificent manner.

words.mnemonic_zh: magn(大)+itude(状态)，表示大的状态即巨大等
words.example_en: The magnitude of the problem surprised everyone.
words.example_zh: 问题的严重性让每个人都很惊讶。
