words.en_def: The absolute or relative size, extent or importance of something.

words.mnemonic_zh: main(主要的) + land(陆地)，主要的陆地就是大陆
words.example_en: Many tourists travel from the islands to the mainland.
words.example_zh: 许多游客从岛屿前往大陆。
words.en_def: The continent; the principal land, as distinguished from islands or a peninsula.

words.mnemonic_zh: main(主要的) + stream(水流)，主要的水流即主流
words.example_en: His ideas are outside the mainstream of current thought.
words.example_zh: 他的想法偏离了当前的主流思想。
words.en_def: The principal current in a flow, such as a river or flow of air

sentences.en: His ideas were well outside the mainstream, but he presented them intelligently, and we were impressed if not convinced.
sentences.zh: 他的想法远远超出了主流，但他巧妙地表达了这些想法，即使不令人信服，也给我们留下了深刻的印象。

sentences.en: Mainstreaming has become more common in recent years, as studies have shown that many mainstreamed students with mild learning disabilities learn better than their non-mainstreamed counterparts.
sentences.zh: 近年来，主流化变得越来越普遍，研究表明，许多有轻度学习障碍的主流学生比非主流学生学得更好。

sentences.en: They often carry stories you won't find in the mainstream media.
sentences.zh: 他们经常报道你在主流媒体上找不到的故事。

words.mnemonic_zh: mainten(维持)+ance(行为)，维持的行为就是维护
words.example_en: The maintenance of the building costs a lot of money.
words.example_zh: 这座建筑的维护需要花费很多钱。
words.en_def: Actions performed to keep some machine or system functioning or in service.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“没课”，没课就可以制作东西
words.example_en: She can make delicious cakes by herself.
words.example_zh: 她能自己做出美味的蛋糕。
words.en_def: Brand or kind; model.

sentences.en: What make of car do you drive?
sentences.zh: 您开什么牌子的车？

sentences.en: The camera was of German make.
sentences.zh: 相机是德国制造的。

sentences.en: He made as if to punch him, but they both laughed and shook hands.
sentences.zh: 他做出好像要打他的样子，但他们都笑了，握手了。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“妈摸”，妈妈抚摸的动物，像哺乳动物
words.example_en: Most mammals give birth to live young.
words.example_zh: 大多数哺乳动物胎生幼崽。
words.en_def: An animal of the class Mammalia, characterized by being warm-blooded, having hair and feeding milk to its young.

words.mnemonic_zh: 用手做事，管理经营
words.example_en: He can manage this project effectively with his rich experience.
words.example_zh: 凭借丰富的经验，他能有效地管理这个项目。
words.en_def: The act of managing or controlling something.

sentences.en: He managed to climb the tower.
sentences.zh: 他成功地登上了塔楼。

sentences.en: It's a tough job, but I'll manage.
sentences.zh: 这是一项艰巨的工作，但我会做到的。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发出命令来委托做事
words.example_en: The committee gave him a mandate to reorganize the department.
words.example_zh: 委员会授权他重组该部门。
words.en_def: An official or authoritative command; an order or injunction; a commission; a judicial precept.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有……性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 命令下的，具有强制性
words.example_en: Wearing a seat - belt in the car is mandatory.
words.example_zh: 在汽车里系安全带是强制性的。
words.en_def: A sign or line that require the path of the disc to be above, below or to one side of it.

sentences.en: Attendance at a school is usually mandatory for children.
sentences.zh: 儿童通常必须上学。

sentences.en: Mandatory Palestine
sentences.zh: 托管巴勒斯坦

words.mnemonic_zh: 用手打击，让事情明显
words.example_en: His talent for music began to manifest at an early age.
words.example_zh: 他的音乐天赋在早年就开始显现出来。
words.en_def: A list or invoice of the passengers or goods being carried by a commercial vehicle or ship.

sentences.en: His courage manifested itself through the look on his face.
sentences.zh: 他的勇气从他脸上的表情就可见一斑。

words.mnemonic_zh: 用手拉，引申为操纵
words.example_en: He tried to manipulate the situation to his advantage.
words.example_zh: 他试图操纵局势以利于自己。
words.en_def: To move, arrange or operate something using the hands

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 由操纵动作产生的行为
words.example_en: The manipulation of data is unethical in scientific research.
words.example_zh: 在科学研究中操纵数据是不道德的。
words.en_def: The practice of manipulating or the state of being manipulated.

sentences.en: The dealer's manipulations could have removed cards from the deck.
sentences.zh: 庄家的操纵可能会将牌从牌堆中移走。

sentences.en: After a few minutes of manipulation each week, she obtained days of relief from her neck pain.
sentences.zh: 每周进行几分钟的按摩后，她的颈部疼痛就能得到几天的缓解。

sentences.en: The counselor was able to reach the disturbed teen through positive psychological manipulation.
sentences.zh: 辅导员能够通过积极的心理操纵来接触这位受到困扰的青少年。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 可供人长久居住之处
words.example_en: The old mansion stands quietly at the end of the street.
words.example_zh: 那座古老的宅邸静静地矗立在街道尽头。
words.en_def: A large house or building, usually built for the wealthy.

words.mnemonic_zh: 用手写出来的稿件
words.example_en: The author submitted his manuscript to the publisher.
words.example_zh: 作者将他的手稿提交给了出版商。
words.en_def: A book, composition or any other document, written by hand (or manually typewritten), not mechanically reproduced.

words.mnemonic_zh: March发音似“马驰”，像马奔跑前进
words.example_en: The soldiers will march for several kilometers today.
words.example_zh: 士兵们今天要行军数公里。
words.en_def: A formal, rhythmic way of walking, used especially by soldiers, bands and in ceremonies.

sentences.en: the march of time
sentences.zh: 时间的行进

words.mnemonic_zh: 处于边缘的就是微小的
words.example_en: The company made only marginal profits this year.
words.example_zh: 该公司今年仅获得了微薄的利润。
words.en_def: Something that is marginal.

sentences.en: In recent years there has been an increase in violence against marginal groups.
sentences.zh: 近年来，针对边缘群体的暴力行为有所增加。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 物质相关的东西就是材料
words.example_en: They need more building material to finish the project.
words.example_zh: 他们需要更多建筑材料来完成这个项目。
words.en_def: Matter which may be shaped or manipulated, particularly in making something.

sentences.en: Asphalt, composed of oil and sand, is a widely used material for roads.
sentences.zh: 沥青由油和沙组成，是广泛使用的道路材料。

sentences.en: We were a warm-up act at the time; we didn't have enough original material to headline.
sentences.zh: 当时我们只是热身表演； 我们没有足够的原始材料来作为标题。

sentences.en: You'll need about a yard of material to make this.
sentences.zh: 你需要大约一码的材料来制作这个。

words.mnemonic_zh: 和数学有关的就是数学的
words.example_en: This mathematical problem is quite challenging for students.
words.example_zh: 这道数学题对学生来说颇具挑战性。
words.en_def: Of, or relating to mathematics

sentences.en: a mathematical problem
sentences.zh: 一个数学问题

sentences.en: The team has a mathematical chance of being promoted, but they need to win the next seven matches.
sentences.zh: 球队有晋级的数学机会，但他们需要赢得接下来的七场比赛。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“妈就说”，妈妈说的一般是成熟的建议
words.example_en: A mature person can handle problems calmly.
words.example_zh: 一个成熟的人能冷静处理问题。
words.en_def: Fully developed; grown up in terms of physical appearance, behaviour or thinking; ripe.

sentences.en: She is quite mature for her age.
sentences.zh: 就她的年龄而言，她已经相当成熟了。

sentences.en: a mature plan
sentences.zh: 成熟的计划

sentences.en: The headmaster decided to expel the boy after a mature consideration.
sentences.zh: 校长经过深思熟虑后决定开除这个男孩。

words.mnemonic_zh: 让最大的程度发挥出来
words.example_en: We should maximize the use of limited resources.
words.example_zh: 我们应该充分利用有限的资源。
words.en_def: To make as large as possible

words.mnemonic_zh: 充满意义就是有意义的
words.example_en: He had a meaningful conversation with his teacher.
words.example_zh: 他和老师进行了一次有意义的谈话。
words.en_def: Having meaning, significant.

sentences.en: I think we made a meaningful contribution to this project today.
sentences.zh: 我认为我们今天为这个项目做出了有意义的贡献。

words.mnemonic_zh: 中间的时间就是同时、其间
words.example_en: The work will be done soon. Meantime, we can relax a bit.
words.example_zh: 工作很快会完成，其间我们可以放松一下。
words.en_def: The time spent waiting for another event; time in between.

sentences.en: I'll get started tomorrow but, in the meantime, let's see if we can get a few more opinions.
sentences.zh: 我明天就会开始，但与此同时，让我们看看是否能得到更多意见。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“美硕”，测量出美丽硕大的尺寸
words.example_en: You need to measure the length of this rope.
words.example_zh: 你需要测量这根绳子的长度。
words.en_def: A prescribed quantity or extent.

sentences.en: We measured the temperature with a thermometer.   You should measure the angle with a spirit level.
sentences.zh: 我们用温度计测量了温度。 您应该用水平仪测量角度。

sentences.en: The window measured two square feet.
sentences.zh: 窗户有两平方英尺。

sentences.en: I measure that at 10 centimetres.
sentences.zh: 我测量的是 10 厘米。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示体系、机制
words.mnemonic_zh: 机器运行的体系就是机制
words.example_en: The body has a self - repair mechanism.
words.example_zh: 身体有自我修复机制。
words.en_def: (within a machine or machinery) Any mechanical means for the conversion or control of motion, or the transmission or control of power.

sentences.en: political machine
sentences.zh: 政治机器

words.mnemonic_zh: 中间时代的就是中世纪的
words.example_en: Medieval architecture has its unique charm.
words.example_zh: 中世纪建筑有其独特的魅力。
words.en_def: Someone living in the Middle Ages.

sentences.en: Thank God for modern remedies: the medievals were often useless or even harmful.
sentences.zh: 感谢上帝提供了现代疗法：中世纪的疗法往往是无用的，甚至是有害的。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 沉思的行为就是冥想
words.example_en: Meditation can help people relieve stress.
words.example_zh: 冥想可以帮助人们缓解压力。
words.en_def: A devotional exercise of, or leading to contemplation.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“密特”，亲密特别的遇见
words.example_en: They often meet at the coffee shop after work.
words.example_zh: 他们下班后经常在咖啡店见面。
words.en_def: A sports competition, especially for track and field (a track meet) or swimming (a swim meet).

sentences.en: OK, let's arrange a meet with Tyler and ask him.
sentences.zh: 好的，我们安排一次与泰勒的会面并询问他的情况。

sentences.en: This proposal meets my requirements. The company agrees to meet the cost of any repairs.
sentences.zh: 这个建议符合我的要求。 公司同意承担任何维修费用。

sentences.en: The eye met a horrid sight. He met his fate.
sentences.zh: 眼睛看到了可怕的景象。 他遇见了他的命运。

words.mnemonic_zh: “melod”似“美妙的”，加上“y”成旋律
words.example_en: The melody of this song is really catchy.
words.example_zh: 这首歌的旋律非常动听。
words.en_def: Tune; sequence of notes that makes up a musical phrase

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示状态、身份
words.mnemonic_zh: member（成员）加 ship（身份）成会员身份
words.example_en: He applied for membership in the club last week.
words.example_zh: 他上周申请了俱乐部的会员资格。
words.en_def: The state of being a member of a group or organization.

sentences.en: He has memberships in clubs in three cities.
sentences.zh: 他在三个城市的俱乐部拥有会员资格。

sentences.en: The memberships of the state chapters elect delegates to the national convention.
sentences.zh: 州分会的成员选举全国代表大会的代表。

words.mnemonic_zh: “mem”记忆，“o”像便条，合起来是备忘录
words.example_en: She left a memo on the desk for her colleague.
words.example_zh: 她在桌上给同事留了一张便条。
words.en_def: A short note; a memorandum.

sentences.en: I made sure to memo him about the client's complaints.
sentences.zh: 我一定要把客户的投诉告诉他。

words.mnemonic_zh: “memor”记忆，“ir”后缀成回忆录
words.example_en: The famous writer's memoirs are very popular.
words.example_zh: 这位著名作家的回忆录很受欢迎。
words.en_def: An autobiography; a book describing the personal experiences of an author.

sentences.en: When I retire, I'm going to write my memoirs.
sentences.zh: 当我退休时，我要写我的回忆录。

sentences.en: James wrote a memoir of his grandmother shortly after she passed away.
sentences.zh: 詹姆斯在祖母去世后不久写了一本回忆录。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表与……有关；也可作名词后缀
words.mnemonic_zh: “memor”记忆，“ial”后缀表相关事物成纪念碑
words.example_en: People gathered at the memorial to pay their respects.
words.example_zh: 人们聚集在纪念碑前致敬。
words.en_def: Memory; recollection.

sentences.en: a memorial building
sentences.zh: 一座纪念建筑

sentences.en: a memorial possession
sentences.zh: 纪念财产

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: “ment”心智，“ality”后缀表状态成心态
words.example_en: A positive mentality can help you overcome difficulties.
words.example_zh: 积极的心态能帮助你克服困难。
words.en_def: A mindset; a way of thinking; a set of beliefs.

sentences.en: Before he can succeed, he will have to shed the mentality that he can get by without hard work.
sentences.zh: 在他能够成功之前，他必须摆脱不劳而获的心态。

words.mnemonic_zh: “ment”心智，“or”人，用心智指导的人是导师
words.example_en: The young artist found a great mentor to guide him.
words.example_zh: 这位年轻艺术家找到了一位很棒的导师来指导他。
words.en_def: A wise and trusted counselor or teacher

words.mnemonic_zh: “merc”贸易，“ant”人，从事贸易的人是商人
words.example_zh: The merchant traveled far to sell his goods.
words.example_en: 这位商人远行去销售他的货物。
words.en_def: A person who traffics in commodities for profit.

sentences.en: a merchanting service
sentences.zh: 商业服务

words.mnemonic_zh: “merc”恩惠，“y”后缀，给予恩惠即仁慈
words.example_en: The judge showed mercy to the young offender.
words.example_zh: 法官对这位年轻罪犯表示了怜悯。
words.en_def: Relenting; forbearance to cause or allow harm to another.

sentences.en: She took mercy on him and quit embarrassing him.
sentences.zh: 她怜悯他，不再让他难堪。

sentences.en: Have mercy on the poor and assist them if you can.
sentences.zh: 怜悯穷人并尽可能帮助他们。

sentences.en: Mercy is one of his many virtues.
sentences.zh: 怜悯是他众多美德之一。

words.mnemonic_zh: “mere”音似“咪呀”，表示只是小事情
words.example_en: He is a mere child and doesn't understand such complex issues.
words.example_zh: 他只是个孩子，不懂这么复杂的问题。
words.en_def: A body of standing water, such as a lake or a pond. More specifically, it can refer to a lake that is broad in relation to its depth. Also included in place names such as Windermere.

words.mnemonic_zh: mere加ly，“仅仅”变副词
words.example_en: She merely glanced at the report and didn't read it carefully.
words.example_zh: 她只是瞥了一眼报告，没有仔细阅读。
words.en_def: Wholly, entirely.

words.mnemonic_zh: “merge”音似“没治”，两者合并没治了
words.example_en: The two companies decided to merge to increase their competitiveness.
words.example_zh: 两家公司决定合并以提高竞争力。
words.en_def: The joining together of multiple sources.

sentences.en: The merge of the two documents failed.
sentences.zh: 两个文档的合并失败。

sentences.en: Headquarters merged the operations of the three divisions.
sentences.zh: 总部将三个部门的业务合并。

sentences.en: The two companies merged.
sentences.zh: 两家公司合并。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为的结果
words.mnemonic_zh: merge加er，合并的结果
words.example_en: The merger of the two banks created a financial giant.
words.example_zh: 两家银行的合并造就了一个金融巨头。
words.en_def: One that merges.

sentences.en: Club mergers reduced the number of teams by half
sentences.zh: 俱乐部合并使球队数量减少一半

words.mnemonic_zh: “merit”音似“迈瑞特”，很有优点特厉害
words.example_en: This plan has many merits and should be considered seriously.
words.example_zh: 这个计划有很多优点，应该认真考虑。
words.en_def: A claim to commendation or a reward.

sentences.en: For her good performance in the examination, her teacher gave her ten merits.
sentences.zh: 由于她在考试中表现出色，老师给了她十个优点。

sentences.en: His reward for his merit was a check for $50.
sentences.zh: 他的功绩得到了一张 50 美元的支票。

sentences.en: to acquire or make merit
sentences.zh: 获得或创造功绩

words.mnemonic_zh: method加ology，方法的学科
words.example_en: The professor introduced a new methodology in data analysis.
words.example_zh: 教授介绍了一种新的数据分析方法论。
words.en_def: (originally science) The study of methods used in a field.

sentences.en: research methodology
sentences.zh: 研究方法

sentences.en: agile methodology
sentences.zh: 敏捷方法论

words.mnemonic_zh: “middle”音似“米兜”，米在袋子中间
words.example_en: He stood in the middle of the room looking around.
words.example_zh: 他站在房间中间环顾四周。
words.en_def: A centre, midpoint.

sentences.en: The middle of a circle is the point which has the same distance to every point of circle.
sentences.zh: 圆的中心是到圆各点距离相等的点。

sentences.en: I woke up in the middle of the night.
sentences.zh: 我半夜醒来。

sentences.en: the middle point
sentences.zh: 中间点

words.mnemonic_zh: mid加st，强调在中间
words.example_en: In the midst of the chaos, she remained calm.
words.example_zh: 在一片混乱中，她保持冷静。
words.en_def: A place in the middle of something; may be used of a literal or metaphorical location.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: migrat加ion，迁移的行为
words.example_en: The annual migration of birds is a spectacular sight.
words.example_zh: 鸟类的年度迁徙是一幕壮观的景象。
words.en_def: An instance of moving to live in another place for a while.

sentences.en: The migration of lead from a can to the food inside it can cause lead poisoning.
sentences.zh: 铅从罐头迁移到罐内食物中会导致铅中毒。

words.mnemonic_zh: “mild”音似“卖哦的”，温和地卖东西
words.example_en: The weather is quite mild today, suitable for a walk.
words.example_zh: 今天天气很温和，适合散步。
words.en_def: A relatively low-gravity beer, often with a dark colour; mild ale

sentences.en: a mild man
sentences.zh: 一个温和的人

sentences.en: He received a mild sentence.
sentences.zh: 他受到了轻判。

sentences.en: a mild day
sentences.zh: 温和的一天

words.mnemonic_zh: mile 是英里，加 s 变复数
words.example_en: The town is several miles away from here.
words.example_zh: 这个小镇离这里有几英里远。
words.en_def: The international mile: a unit of length precisely equal to 1.609344 kilometers established by treaty among Anglophone nations in 1959, divided into 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards.

sentences.en: The shot missed by a mile.
sentences.zh: 射击偏出一英里。

sentences.en: The runners competed in the mile.
sentences.zh: 赛跑选手们进行一英里比赛。

sentences.en: five miles over the speed limit
sentences.zh: 超速五英里

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: milit（战斗）+ ant，爱战斗的就是激进的
words.example_en: The militant group often takes extreme actions.
words.example_zh: 这个激进组织经常采取极端行动。
words.en_def: A soldier, a combatant.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表集合、场所等
words.mnemonic_zh: milit（战斗）+ ia，战斗人员集合就是民兵组织
words.example_en: The militia was called up to maintain order.
words.example_zh: 民兵组织被召集起来维持秩序。
words.en_def: An army of trained civilians, which may be an official reserve army, called upon in time of need, the entire able-bodied population of a state which may also be called upon, or a private force not under government control.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“磨”，磨坊会磨东西
words.example_en: The old mill has been converted into a museum.
words.example_zh: 这座旧磨坊已改建成一座博物馆。
words.en_def: A grinding apparatus for substances such as grains, seeds, etc.

sentences.en: Pepper has a stronger flavor when it is ground straight from a mill.
sentences.zh: 直接从磨坊中磨碎的胡椒具有更浓郁的味道。

sentences.en: My grandfather worked in a mill.
sentences.zh: 我的祖父在一家工厂工作。

sentences.en: a cider mill; a cane mill
sentences.zh: 苹果酒厂； 甘蔗磨坊

words.mnemonic_zh: mine（采矿）+ er，采矿的人就是矿工
words.example_en: The miner works hard underground every day.
words.example_zh: 这位矿工每天都在地下辛勤工作。
words.en_def: A person who works in a mine.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“ mingle（敏哥儿）喜欢与人交往
words.example_en: People often mingle at social gatherings.
words.example_zh: 人们常在社交聚会上交往。
words.en_def: A mixture.

words.mnemonic_zh: minim（最小）+ al，就是最小的
words.example_en: The damage to the house was minimal.
words.example_zh: 房子受到的损坏极小。
words.en_def: The smallest possible amount, quantity, or degree.

words.cn_def: 使减少到最低限度；最小化
words.mnemonic_zh: minim（最小）+ ize，使最小化
words.example_en: We should minimize the risks in this project.
words.example_zh: 我们应该将这个项目的风险降到最低。
words.en_def: To make (something) as small or as insignificant as possible.

sentences.en: I didn't close anything, but I minimized all the windows so I could see the desktop.
sentences.zh: 我没有关闭任何东西，但我最小化了所有窗口，这样我就可以看到桌面。

words.mnemonic_zh: mine（采矿）+ ing，表采矿这个行为
words.example_en: Mining has a significant impact on the environment.
words.example_zh: 采矿业对环境有重大影响。
words.en_def: To remove (ore) from the ground.

sentences.en: gold mining
sentences.zh: 金矿开采

sentences.en: His extensive mining for apparently statistically significant results made any of his results questionable.
sentences.zh: 他对明显具有统计意义的结果进行了广泛的挖掘，这使得他的任何结果都值得怀疑。

words.mnemonic_zh: minist（服务）+ ry，服务大众的机构是政府部门
words.example_en: The ministry is responsible for economic policies.
words.example_zh: 该部门负责制定经济政策。
words.en_def: Government department, at the administrative level normally headed by a minister (or equivalent rank, e.g. secretary of state), who holds it as portfolio, especially in a constitutional monarchy, but also as a polity

sentences.en: She works for the ministry of finance.
sentences.zh: 她在财政部工作。

sentences.en: The premier offered his last ministry's resignation to the monarch, and is asked to form a new one in accordance with the election results.
sentences.zh: 首相向君主提出辞去最后一个内阁职务，并要求根据选举结果组建新的内阁。

sentences.en: the present ministry of the Holy Spirit
sentences.zh: 圣灵当前的事工

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: minor（较小）加上 ity 变成名词，指少数群体
words.example_en: The minority in this area has its own unique culture.
words.example_zh: 这个地区的少数民族有其独特的文化。
words.en_def: The state of being a minor; youth, the period of a person's life prior to reaching adulthood.

sentences.en: Most people agreed, but a sizable minority were upset by the decision.
sentences.zh: 大多数人都同意，但也有相当一部分人对这一决定感到不安。

sentences.en: The company claims it has hired several minorities since the complaint was lodged.
sentences.zh: 该公司声称，自提出投诉以来，它已经雇用了几名少数族裔。

sentences.en: They hold a minority interest in the company.
sentences.zh: 他们持有该公司的少数股权。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“敏特”，一分钟很敏捷特别
words.example_en: He will arrive in fifteen minutes.
words.example_zh: 他将在十五分钟后到达。
words.en_def: A unit of time equal to sixty seconds (one-sixtieth of an hour).

sentences.en: You have twenty minutes to complete the test.
sentences.zh: 您有二十分钟的时间来完成测试。

sentences.en: Wait a minute, I’m not ready yet!
sentences.zh: 等一下，我还没准备好！

sentences.en: We need to be sure these maps are accurate to within one minute of arc.
sentences.zh: 我们需要确保这些地图的精确度在一分钟以内。

words.mnemonic_zh: 能让人惊奇（mir）的事就是奇迹（miracle）
words.example_en: The doctors said his recovery was a miracle.
words.example_zh: 医生们说他的康复是个奇迹。
words.en_def: An event that appears inexplicable by the laws of nature and so is held to be supernatural in origin.

sentences.en: An example of a miracle associated with Muhammad is the splitting of the moon.
sentences.zh: 与穆罕默德有关的奇迹的一个例子是月亮的分裂。

words.mnemonic_zh: mis（错）+ behave（行为），错误行为就是举止不当
words.example_en: The children tend to misbehave when they're tired.
words.example_zh: 孩子们累了的时候往往会举止不当。
words.en_def: To act or behave in an inappropriate, improper, incorrect, or unexpected manner.

sentences.en: He doesn't mean to misbehave; he just doesn't know better.
sentences.zh: 他并不是有意要行为不端；他并不是有意要行为不端。 他只是不知道更好。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“米舍瑞”，没米的生活很悲惨
words.example_en: War brings only death and misery to people.
words.example_zh: 战争给人们带来的只有死亡和痛苦。
words.en_def: Great unhappiness; extreme pain of body or mind; wretchedness; distress; woe.

sentences.en: Ever since his wife left him you can see the misery on his face.
sentences.zh: 自从他的妻子离开他以来，你可以看到他脸上的痛苦。

words.mnemonic_zh: mis（坏）+ fortune（运气），坏运气就是不幸
words.example_en: He had the misfortune to lose his job last month.
words.example_zh: 他上个月不幸失业了。
words.en_def: Bad luck

sentences.en: It was my fortune, or misfortune, to be called to the office of Chief Executive without any previous political training. - Ulysses S. Grant
sentences.zh: 我在没有任何政治训练的情况下就被任命为行政长官，这对我来说是幸运，也可以说是不幸。 ——尤利西斯·S·格兰特

sentences.en: She had to come to terms with a number of misfortunes.
sentences.zh: 她不得不接受许多不幸。

words.mnemonic_zh: mis（错）+ inform（告知），错误告知就是误报
words.example_en: The media sometimes misinforms the public.
words.example_zh: 媒体有时会向公众提供错误信息。
words.en_def: To give or deliver false, fake, or misleading information.

words.mnemonic_zh: mis（错）+ lead（引导），错误引导就是误导
words.example_en: His words may mislead people into making wrong decisions.
words.example_zh: 他的话可能会误导人们做出错误的决定。
words.en_def: To lead astray, in a false direction.

sentences.en: The preacher elaborated Satan's ways to mislead us into sin
sentences.zh: 传道人详细阐述了撒但误导我们犯罪的方法

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有某种性质
words.mnemonic_zh: mis（错）+ lead（引导）+ ing，有错误引导性质的
words.example_en: The misleading advertisement cheated many consumers.
words.example_zh: 这条误导性的广告欺骗了很多消费者。
words.en_def: To lead astray, in a false direction.

sentences.en: The preacher elaborated Satan's ways to mislead us into sin
sentences.zh: 传道人详细阐述了撒但误导我们犯罪的方法

words.mnemonic_zh: miss（投）+ ile（物），可投掷的物体就是导弹
words.example_en: The country developed a new - type missile.
words.example_zh: 这个国家研发了一种新型导弹。
words.en_def: Any object used as a weapon by being thrown or fired through the air, such as stone, arrow or bullet.

sentences.en: The Rhodians, who used leaden bullets, were able to project their missiles twice as far as the Persian slingers, who used large stones.
sentences.zh: 使用铅弹的罗得岛人能够将导弹投射的距离是使用大石头的波斯投石手的两倍。

sentences.en: That missile is explosive enough to kill hundreds.
sentences.zh: 该导弹的爆炸性足以杀死数百人。

words.mnemonic_zh: 错误地拿取，就是误解、犯错
words.example_en: He was mistaken about her intentions.
words.example_zh: 他误解了她的意图。
words.en_def: To understand wrongly, taking one thing or person for another.

sentences.en: Don't mistake my kindness for weakness.
sentences.zh: 别把我的善良当成软弱。

sentences.en: A mistaken sense of loyalty.
sentences.zh: 错误的忠诚感。

sentences.en: He admitted he was mistaken about the budget numbers.
sentences.zh: 他承认他对预算数字有误。

words.mnemonic_zh: 错误地使用就是滥用
words.example_en: Some people misuse their power for personal gain.
words.example_zh: 有些人滥用权力谋取私利。
words.en_def: An incorrect, improper or unlawful use of something.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“骂爆”，一群人骂爆就是暴民
words.example_en: The mob became violent during the protest.
words.example_zh: 抗议期间暴民变得很暴力。
words.en_def: A large or disorderly group of people; especially one bent on riotous or destructive action.

sentences.en: The fans mobbed a well-dressed couple who resembled their idols.
sentences.zh: 粉丝们围攻了一对穿着考究、酷似他们偶像的情侣。

sentences.en: The shoppers mobbed the store on the first day of the sale.
sentences.zh: 促销第一天，购物者就挤满了商店。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: mob（动）+ility（性质），就是移动性
words.example_en: Urban planning should consider people's mobility needs.
words.example_zh: 城市规划应考虑人们的出行需求。
words.en_def: The ability to move; capacity for movement.

words.mnemonic_zh: 使动起来，就是动员、调动
words.example_en: The government managed to mobilize resources quickly.
words.example_zh: 政府设法迅速调动资源。
words.en_def: To make something mobile.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“谋的”，谋划的方式
words.example_en: The new teaching mode has improved students' interest.
words.example_zh: 新的教学模式提高了学生的兴趣。
words.en_def: One of several ancient Greek scales.

sentences.en: What was the mode of entry?
sentences.zh: 进入方式是什么？

sentences.en: After a series of early setbacks, her political campaign is in crisis mode.
sentences.zh: 在经历了一系列早期挫折后，她的政治竞选陷入了危机模式。

sentences.en: In insert mode, characters typed are directly inserted into the buffer.
sentences.zh: 在插入模式下，键入的字符直接插入到缓冲区中。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: 经过调节的，就是适度的
words.example_en: We should maintain a moderate pace of life.
words.example_zh: 我们应保持适度的生活节奏。
words.en_def: One who holds an intermediate position between extremes, as in politics.

sentences.en: The moderates are the natural advocates of ecumenism against the fanatics of their churches.
sentences.zh: 温和派是普世主义的天然倡导者，反对教会的狂热分子。

sentences.en: to moderate rage, action, desires, etc.
sentences.zh: 控制愤怒、行动、欲望等。

sentences.en: to moderate a synod
sentences.zh: 主持会议

words.mnemonic_zh: 能自我调节，不张扬，就是谦虚适度
words.example_en: A modest person never brags about himself.
words.example_zh: 谦虚的人从不自夸。
words.en_def: Not bragging or boasting about oneself or one's achievements; unpretentious, humble.

sentences.en: He earns a modest amount of money.
sentences.zh: 他挣的钱不多。

sentences.en: modest thoughts or language
sentences.zh: 谦虚的想法或语言

words.mnemonic_zh: modest（谦虚的）加ly变成副词
words.example_en: He answered the questions modestly.
words.example_zh: 他谦虚地回答了问题。
words.en_def: In a modest manner.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: mod（调节）+ification（行为结果），即修改
words.example_en: The plan needs some modification to be perfect.
words.example_zh: 这个计划需要一些修改才能完善。
words.en_def: The form of existence belonging to a particular object, entity etc.; a mode of being.

sentences.en: Jim's modification to the radio's tuning resulted in clearer sound.
sentences.zh: 吉姆对收音机的调音进行了修改，声音更加清晰。

sentences.en: Due to his sunbathing, Jim's body experienced modifications: he got a tan.
sentences.zh: 由于日光浴，吉姆的身体发生了变化：他晒黑了。

sentences.en: The Chinese word "kòu tóu" had a modification made to become the English "kowtow".
sentences.zh: 中文的“kòu tóu”经过修改，变成了英文的“kowtow”。

words.mnemonic_zh: 使模式改变，即修改
words.example_en: They decided to modify the original plan to fit the new situation.
words.example_zh: 他们决定修改原计划以适应新情况。
words.en_def: To change part of.

words.mnemonic_zh: 一个时刻积攒的力量就是动力
words.example_en: The new policy gave fresh momentum to the economic development.
words.example_zh: 新政策给经济发展注入了新动力。
words.en_def: Of a body in motion: the tendency of a body to maintain its inertial motion; the product of its mass and velocity.

words.mnemonic_zh: 负责提醒监督的人就是班长等
words.example_en: The teacher asked the monitor to collect the homework.
words.example_zh: 老师让班长收作业。
words.en_def: Someone who watches over something; a person in charge of something or someone.

sentences.en: The camp monitors look after the children during the night, when the teachers are asleep.
sentences.zh: 夜间，当老师们睡觉时，营地的监护人会照顾孩子们。

sentences.en: The information flashed up on the monitor.
sentences.zh: 显示器上闪现出信息。

sentences.en: a machine code monitor
sentences.zh: 机器代码监视器

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“猛克”，像勇猛克服世俗的人
words.example_en: The monk spends most of his time in meditation.
words.example_zh: 这位僧侣大部分时间都在冥想。
words.en_def: A male member of a monastic order who has devoted his life for religious service.

words.mnemonic_zh: 独自卖就是垄断
words.example_en: The company holds a monopoly on the production of this rare material.
words.example_zh: 该公司垄断了这种稀有材料的生产。
words.en_def: A situation, by legal privilege or other agreement, in which solely one party (company, cartel etc.) exclusively provides a particular product or service, dominating that market and generally exerting powerful control over it.

sentences.en: A land monopoly renders its holder(s) nearly almighty in an agricultural society.
sentences.zh: 土地垄断使其所有者在农业社会中几乎拥有全能。

sentences.en: Granting monopolies in concession constitutes a market-conform alternative to taxation for the state, while the crown sometimes bestowed a monopoly as an outrageous gift.
sentences.zh: 授予垄断权是国家税收的一种符合市场规律的替代方案，而国王有时会将垄断权作为一种令人难以容忍的礼物。

words.mnemonic_zh: 单一声音的，就是单调的
words.example_zh: 他厌倦了日复一日单调的工作。
words.example_en: He got tired of the monotonous work day after day.
words.en_def: Having an unvarying tone or pitch.

words.mnemonic_zh: 符合风俗习惯的就是道德的
words.example_en: We should make moral decisions in our daily life.
words.example_zh: 我们在日常生活中应做出符合道德的决定。
words.en_def: (of a narrative) The ethical significance or practical lesson.

sentences.en: a candidate with strong morals
sentences.zh: 道德高尚的候选人

sentences.en: moral judgments;  a moral poem
sentences.zh: 道德判断； 一首道德诗

sentences.en: a moral obligation
sentences.zh: 道德义务

words.mnemonic_zh: 道德的性质，即道德准则
words.example_en: The society should uphold high standards of morality.
words.example_zh: 社会应维护高标准的道德准则。
words.en_def: Recognition of the distinction between good and evil or between right and wrong; respect for and obedience to the rules of right conduct; the mental disposition or characteristic of behaving in a manner intended to produce morally good results.

words.mnemonic_zh: 使内心移动起来，就是激励
words.example_en: The promise of a bonus can motivate employees to work harder.
words.example_zh: 承诺发奖金能激励员工更努力工作。
words.en_def: To provide someone with an incentive to do something; to encourage.

sentences.en: The weekly staff meeting was meant to motivate employees.
sentences.zh: 每周一次的员工会议旨在激励员工。

sentences.en: He was motivated purely by self-interest.
sentences.zh: 他的动机纯粹是出于自身利益。

words.mnemonic_zh: 激励的状态，就是动力
words.example_en: Good teachers can stimulate students' motivation to learn.
words.example_zh: 优秀的教师能激发学生的学习动力。
words.en_def: Willingness of action especially in behavior.

sentences.en: The motivation scores showed that 65% of people wanted to visit our website to learn more about the offer after watching the commercial.
sentences.zh: 动机得分显示，65% 的人在观看广告后希望访问我们的网站以了解有关优惠的更多信息。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，有……性质的；名词后缀，表相关事物
words.mnemonic_zh: mot（动）+ive，有推动行动的因素即动机
words.example_en: His motive for helping her was purely kindness.
words.example_zh: 他帮助她的动机纯粹是出于善意。
words.en_def: An idea or communication that makes one want to act, especially from spiritual sources; a divine prompting.

sentences.en: No-one could understand why she had hidden the shovel; her motives were obscure at best.
sentences.zh: 没有人能理解她为什么要把铲子藏起来。 她的动机充其量是模糊的。

sentences.en: If you listen carefully, you can hear the flutes mimicking the cello motive.
sentences.zh: 如果你仔细听，你可以听到长笛模仿大提琴动机。

sentences.en: a motive argument
sentences.zh: 动机论证

words.mnemonic_zh: motor（机动车）+ist（人），开机动车的人
words.example_en: The motorist stopped at the red light.
words.example_zh: 驾车者在红灯前停了下来。
words.en_def: One who drives a motor vehicle.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“木乌”，想象木头被乌鸦移动
words.example_en: He can move the heavy box easily.
words.example_zh: 他能轻松地搬动那个沉重的箱子。
words.en_def: The act of moving; a movement.

sentences.en: A slight move of the tiller, and the boat will go off course.
sentences.zh: 舵柄轻轻一动，船就会偏离航线。

sentences.en: He made another move towards becoming a naturalized citizen.
sentences.zh: 他又向入籍公民迈出了一步。

sentences.en: She always gets spontaneous applause for that one move.
sentences.zh: 她的这一举动总是会赢得自发的掌声。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态等
words.mnemonic_zh: move（移动）+ment，移动的行为即运动
words.example_en: The movement of the leaves shows the wind.
words.example_zh: 树叶的晃动显示有风。
words.en_def: Physical motion between points in space.

sentences.en: I saw a movement in that grass on the hill.
sentences.zh: 我看到山上的草丛里有动静。

sentences.en: The labor movement has been struggling in America since the passage of the Taft-Hartley act in 1947.
sentences.zh: 自1947年《塔夫脱-哈特利法案》通过以来，美国的劳工运动一直陷入困境。

sentences.en: Albuquerque International Sunport serviced over 200,000 movements last year.
sentences.zh: 阿尔伯克基国际机场去年为超过 200,000 次航班提供服务。

words.mnemonic_zh: multi（多）+ple（倍数），有多个倍数即多样的
words.example_en: The problem has multiple solutions.
words.example_zh: 这个问题有多种解决方案。
words.en_def: A whole number that can be divided by another number with no remainder.

sentences.en: 14, 21 and 70 are multiples of 7
My Swiss Army knife has multiple blades.
sentences.zh: 我的瑞士军刀有多个刀片。

sentences.en: It was a multiple pregnancy: the woman had triplets.
sentences.zh: 这是一次多胞胎妊娠：这名妇女生了三胞胎。

words.mnemonic_zh: mund（尘世）+ane，尘世的就是平凡世俗的
words.example_en: He leads a mundane life in the small town.
words.example_zh: 他在小镇上过着平凡的生活。
words.en_def: An unremarkable, ordinary human being.

words.mnemonic_zh: muni（公共）+ipal，与公共服务有关的即市政的
words.example_en: The municipal government plans new projects.
words.example_zh: 地方政府规划了新的项目。
words.en_def: A financial instrument issued by a municipality.

words.mnemonic_zh: music（音乐）+al，与音乐有关的
words.example_en: She has a musical talent from childhood.
words.example_zh: 她从小就有音乐天赋。
words.en_def: A stage performance, show or film that involves singing, dancing and musical numbers performed by the cast as well as acting.

sentences.en: musical proportion; musical instruments
sentences.zh: 音乐比例； 乐器

sentences.en: She had a musical voice.
sentences.zh: 她有一副悦耳的声音。

sentences.en: the child is musical; having a musical ear
sentences.zh: 孩子有音乐天赋； 拥有一双音乐耳朵

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“麻思他的”，吃芥末时会麻，让人思索它的味道
words.example_en: The sandwich tastes better with mustard.
words.example_zh: 三明治加了芥末味道更好。
words.en_def: A plant of certain species of the genus Brassica, or of related genera (especially Sinapis alba, in the family Brassicaceae, with yellow flowers, and linear seed pods).

sentences.en: When the waitress brought the food, I asked whether she had any Dijon mustard.
sentences.zh: 当女服务员送来食物时，我问她有没有第戎芥末。

sentences.en: Mustard and cress sandwiches.
sentences.zh: 芥末和水芹三明治。

words.mnemonic_zh: mut（交换）+ual，有交换关系的即相互的
words.example_en: They have mutual interests in sports.
words.example_zh: 他们在体育方面有共同的兴趣。
words.en_def: A mutual fund.

sentences.en: They were mutual enemies.
sentences.zh: 他们是共同的敌人。

sentences.en: Mutual insurance.
sentences.zh: 相互保险。

sentences.en: They had mutual fear of each other.
sentences.zh: 他们互相害怕对方。

words.mnemonic_zh: 神秘（myster）状态加副词后缀，神秘地
words.example_en: The old house was mysteriously quiet at night.
words.example_zh: 那座老房子在夜里静得出奇。
words.en_def: In a mysterious manner

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“迷思”，神话让人迷惑思考
words.example_en: Many cultures have their own creation myths.
words.example_zh: 许多文化都有自己的创世神话。
words.en_def: A traditional story which embodies a belief regarding some fact or phenomenon of experience, and in which often the forces of nature and of the soul are personified; a sacred narrative regarding a god, a hero, the origin of the world or of a people, etc.

sentences.en: Myth was the product of man's emotion and imagination, acted upon by his surroundings. (E. Clodd, Myths & Dreams (1885), 7, cited after OED)
sentences.zh: 神话是人类情感和想象力的产物，受到周围环境的影响。 (E. Clodd, Myths & Dreams (1885), 7, 引用自《牛津英语词典》)

sentences.en: Scientists debunk the myth that gum stays in the human stomach for seven years.
sentences.zh: 科学家揭穿了口香糖在人胃里停留七年的神话。

sentences.en: Father Flanagan was legendary, his institution an American myth. (Tucson (Arizona) Citizen, 20 September 1979, 5A/3, cited after OED)
sentences.zh: 弗拉纳根神父是一位传奇人物，他的机构成为美国神话。 （图森（亚利桑那州）公民，1979 年 9 月 20 日，5A/3，《牛津英语词典》引用）

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“奶味”，有奶味般天真
words.example_en: He has a naive belief in human goodness.
words.example_zh: 他天真地相信人性本善。
words.en_def: A naive person; a greenhorn.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“内可的”，内在可看见，即裸体的
words.example_en: The statue stands naked in the garden.
words.example_zh: 那座雕像裸体立在花园里。
words.en_def: Bare, not covered by clothing.

sentences.en: She was as naked as the day she was born.
sentences.zh: 她就像出生那天一样赤身裸体。

sentences.en: The naked facts lay there on the table, enclosed within the files.
sentences.zh: 赤裸裸的事实就摆在桌子上，包含在文件中。

sentences.en: I entered her naked and came in her too.
sentences.zh: 我赤身裸体地进入了她，也进入了她。

words.mnemonic_zh: 说出名字（name），即指明
words.example_en: Only one student passed the exam, namely Tom.
words.example_zh: 只有一个学生通过了考试，即汤姆。
words.en_def: Specifically; that is to say.

sentences.en: Some of the students — namely Paul, Alice and Jake — seem to have trouble with geometry.
sentences.zh: 一些学生——即保罗、爱丽丝和杰克——似乎在几何方面有困难。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“拿铺”，拿个铺子去小睡
words.example_en: He likes to take a nap after lunch.
words.example_zh: 他喜欢午饭后小睡一会儿。
words.en_def: A short period of sleep, especially one during the day.

sentences.en: The regulators were caught napping by the financial collapse.
sentences.zh: 监管机构因金融崩溃而打瞌睡。

sentences.en: If the fabric has a nap, make sure all pieces are cut with the nap going the same direction.
sentences.zh: 如果织物有绒毛，请确保所有裁片的绒毛方向相同。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“拿肉”，窄地方才好拿肉
words.example_en: The narrow path led us to the village.
words.example_zh: 那条狭窄的小路把我们引向了村庄。
words.en_def: (chiefly in the plural) A narrow passage, especially a contracted part of a stream, lake, or sea; a strait connecting two bodies of water.

sentences.en: the narrows of New York harbor
sentences.zh: 纽约港的狭窄地带

sentences.en: a narrow hallway
sentences.zh: 狭窄的走廊

sentences.en: a narrow interpretation
sentences.zh: 狭义的解释

words.mnemonic_zh: 国家（nation）范围宽广（wide），全国范围的
words.example_en: There is a nationwide campaign against pollution.
words.example_zh: 有一场全国性的反污染运动。
words.en_def: Extending throughout an entire nation.

sentences.en: There was a nationwide search on for the bankrobbers.
sentences.zh: 全国范围内正在搜寻银行劫匪。

words.mnemonic_zh: 自然（nature）加形容词后缀，自然的
words.example_en: We should protect natural resources.
words.example_zh: 我们应该保护自然资源。
words.en_def: A native inhabitant of a place, country etc.

sentences.en: He's a natural on the saxophone.
sentences.zh: 他是萨克斯管的天生演奏者。

sentences.en: The species will be under threat if its natural habitat is destroyed.
sentences.zh: 如果其自然栖息地遭到破坏，该物种将受到威胁。

sentences.en: In the natural world the fit tend to live on while the weak perish.
sentences.zh: 在自然界中，强者往往存活，弱者则灭亡。

words.mnemonic_zh: 自然（nature）加副词后缀，自然地
words.example_en: Naturally, he was angry at the news.
words.example_zh: 他自然会对这个消息感到愤怒。
words.en_def: In a natural manner.

sentences.en: Although he was unused to the situation, he tried to act naturally.
sentences.zh: 尽管他不习惯这种情况，但他还是尽量表现得自然一些。

sentences.en: Boys are naturally aggressive.
sentences.zh: 男孩子天生就有攻击性。

sentences.en: I shall naturally protest at that decision.
sentences.zh: 我自然会抗议这个决定。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 天生的状态就是自然
words.example_en: Many people go to the mountains to enjoy the beauty of nature.
words.example_zh: 很多人去山里欣赏自然之美。
words.en_def: The natural world; that which consists of all things unaffected by or predating human technology, production, and design. (Compare ecosystem.)

sentences.en: Nature never lies (i.e. tells untruths).
sentences.zh: 大自然从不说谎（即说谎）。

words.mnemonic_zh: 和船相关的就是海军的
words.example_en: The naval fleet conducted a large - scale exercise last month.
words.example_zh: 海军舰队上个月进行了一次大规模演习。
words.en_def: Of or relating to a navy.

sentences.en: naval architect
sentences.zh: 海军建筑师

words.mnemonic_zh: neat加ly变成副词表方式
words.example_en: He arranged the books neatly on the shelf.
words.example_zh: 他把书整齐地摆在书架上。
words.en_def: In a neat manner.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 必要的性质就是必要性
words.example_en: Food and water are basic necessities of life.
words.example_zh: 食物和水是生活的基本必需品。
words.en_def: The quality or state of being necessary, unavoidable, or absolutely requisite.

sentences.en: I bought a new table out of necessity. My old one was ruined.
sentences.zh: 出于需要，我买了一张新桌子。 我的旧的已经毁了。

sentences.en: A tent is a necessity if you plan on camping.
sentences.zh: 如果您打算露营，帐篷是必需品。

sentences.en: doctrine of necessity
sentences.zh: 必要性原则

words.mnemonic_zh: 不选择就是忽视
words.example_en: Don't neglect your health while working hard.
words.example_zh: 努力工作时不要忽视自己的健康。
words.en_def: The act of neglecting.

sentences.en: to neglect duty or business;  to neglect to pay debts
sentences.zh: 玩忽职守或玩忽职守； 忽视偿还债务

sentences.en: to neglect strangers
sentences.zh: 忽视陌生人

words.mnemonic_zh: 不闲着去做就是谈判协商
words.example_en: They need to negotiate a new contract with the supplier.
words.example_zh: 他们需要和供应商协商一份新合同。
words.en_def: To confer with others in order to come to terms or reach an agreement.

sentences.en: The client and server computers must first negotiate a network protocol to be used.
sentences.zh: 客户端和服务器计算机必须首先协商要使用的网络协议。

sentences.en: Although the car was quite rickety, he could negotiate the curves very well.
sentences.zh: 虽然车子摇摇晃晃，但他却能很好地通过弯道。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程
words.mnemonic_zh: 谈判协商的行为过程
words.example_en: The negotiation between the two companies lasted for weeks.
words.example_zh: 两家公司的谈判持续了数周。
words.en_def: The process of achieving agreement through discussion.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示正在……的、与……有关的
words.mnemonic_zh: 邻居相关的就是邻近的
words.example_en: The neighbouring countries often cooperate on environmental issues.
words.example_zh: 邻国经常在环境问题上开展合作。
words.en_def: Situated or living nearby or adjacent to.

words.mnemonic_zh: nerve的复数形式
words.example_en: Stress can cause problems with the nerves.
words.example_zh: 压力会导致神经方面的问题。
words.en_def: A bundle of neurons with their connective tissue sheaths, blood vessels and lymphatics.

sentences.en: The nerves can be seen through the skin.
sentences.zh: 透过皮肤可以看到神经。

sentences.en: Some plants have ornamental value because of their contrasting nerves.
sentences.zh: 有些植物因其对比鲜明的神经而具有观赏价值。

sentences.en: He hasn't the nerve to tell her he likes her. What a wimp!
sentences.zh: 他没有勇气告诉她他喜欢她。 真是个懦夫！

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 紧张的状态就是紧张感
words.example_en: His nervousness was obvious during the presentation.
words.example_zh: 他在演讲时的紧张显而易见。
words.en_def: The state or quality of being nervous.

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“耐思它”，鸟儿耐思它的巢。
words.example_en: A bird built a cozy nest in the tree branches.
words.example_zh: 一只鸟在树枝上筑了一个舒适的巢。
words.en_def: A structure built by a bird as a place to incubate eggs and rear young.

sentences.en: That nightclub is a nest of strange people!
sentences.zh: 那家夜总会是一群奇怪的人！

sentences.en: I am aspiring to leave the nest.
sentences.zh: 我渴望离开巢穴。

sentences.en: I was forced to change trumps when I found the ace, jack, and nine of diamonds in the nest.
sentences.zh: 当我发现巢穴​​中有 A、J 和方块 9 时，我被迫更换王牌。

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“耐它”，渔民耐它捕鱼。
words.example_en: The fisherman cast his net into the sea.
words.example_zh: 渔夫把网撒进了海里。

words.mnemonic_zh: 网（net）在运作（work）形成网络。
words.example_en: The city has an extensive transportation network.
words.example_zh: 这座城市有广泛的交通网络。
words.en_def: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals.

sentences.en: A network of roads crisscrossed the country.
sentences.zh: 公路网纵横全国。

sentences.en: To get a job in today's economy, it is important to have a strong network.
sentences.zh: 要在当今的经济中找到工作，拥有强大的网络非常重要。

sentences.en: The copy machine is connected to the network so it can now serve as a printer.
sentences.zh: 复印机已连接到网络，因此它现在可以用作打印机。

words.suffix_cn: 动词或名词后缀，表动作或行为
words.mnemonic_zh: network（网络）+ing，进行网络活动。
words.example_en: Networking is important for career development.
words.example_zh: 建立人际网络对职业发展很重要。
words.en_def: To interact socially for the purpose of getting connections or personal advancement.

sentences.en: Many people find it worthwhile to network for jobs and information.
sentences.zh: 许多人发现通过网络寻找工作和信息是值得的。

sentences.en: If we network his machine to the server, he will be able to see all the files.
sentences.zh: 如果我们将他的机器连接到服务器，他将能够看到所有文件。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: neutr（中）+al，处于中间立场。
words.example_en: Switzerland remained neutral during the war.
words.example_zh: 瑞士在战争期间保持中立。
words.en_def: A nonaligned state, or a member of such a state.

sentences.en: I am neutral regarding the issue of gay marriage.
sentences.zh: 我对同性婚姻问题持中立态度。

words.mnemonic_zh: 把新闻（news）写成信件（letter）就是时事通讯。
words.example_en: The company sends a monthly newsletter to its clients.
words.example_zh: 公司每月给客户发时事通讯。
words.en_def: A periodically sent publication containing current events or the like, generally on a particular topic or geared toward a limited audience.

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“你吃”，你吃的那块市场。
words.example_en: This small business has found its niche in the market.
words.example_zh: 这家小企业在市场中找到了自己的小众领域。
words.en_def: A cavity, hollow, or recess, generally within the thickness of a wall, for a statue, bust, or other erect ornament. Hence, any similar position, literal or figurative.

sentences.en: a niched vase
sentences.zh: 一个壁龛花瓶

sentences.en: niche audience
sentences.zh: 小众受众

words.mnemonic_zh: 额外的（nick）名字（name）就是昵称。
words.example_en: His friends often call him by his nickname.
words.example_zh: 他的朋友们经常叫他的昵称。
words.en_def: A familiar, invented given name for a person or thing used instead of the actual name of the person or thing.

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“脑伯乐”，有高尚思想的伯乐。
words.example_en: He has a noble character and always helps others.
words.example_zh: 他有高尚的品格，总是帮助别人。
words.en_def: An aristocrat; one of aristocratic blood.

sentences.en: This country house was occupied by nobles in the 16th century.
sentences.zh: 这座乡间别墅在 16 世纪由贵族居住。

sentences.en: He is a noble man who would never put his family in jeopardy.
sentences.zh: 他是一个高尚的人，永远不会让自己的家人陷入危险。

sentences.en: a noble edifice
sentences.zh: 一座高贵的建筑

words.mnemonic_zh: 音似“脑得”，脑袋动一下表示点头。
words.example_en: She nodded to show her agreement.
words.example_zh: 她点头表示同意。
words.en_def: An instance of inclining the head up and down, as to indicate agreement, or as a cursory greeting.

sentences.en: For the fifth time in her career she received a Grammy nod, she has yet to win the award.
sentences.zh: 这是她职业生涯中第五次获得格莱美奖，但她尚未赢得该奖项。

sentences.en: The plan is expected to get the nod from councillors at the next meeting.
sentences.zh: 该计划预计将在下次会议上获得议员的认可。

sentences.en: They nodded their assent.
sentences.zh: 他们点头表示同意。

words.suffix_cn: 动词后缀，表使成为、给予等
words.mnemonic_zh: 提名某人，就是给他一个名字和名分
words.example_en: They will nominate a candidate for the upcoming election.
words.example_zh: 他们将为即将到来的选举提名一位候选人。
words.en_def: To name someone as a candidate for a particular role or position, including that of an office.

sentences.en: 1658: the City of Norwich [...] was enlarged, builded and nominated by the Saxons. — Sir Thomas Browne, Urne-Burial (Penguin 2005, p. 12)
sentences.zh: 1658 年：诺威奇市 [...] 被扩大、建造并由撒克逊人提名。 ——托马斯·布朗爵士，《瓮葬》（Penguin 2005，第 12 页）

sentences.en: the nominate subspecies
sentences.zh: 指名亚种

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表行为、过程、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: nominate的名词形式，提名这个行为的表示
words.example_en: His nomination for the award was well - deserved.
words.example_zh: 他获得该奖项的提名是实至名归的。
words.en_def: An act or instance of nominating.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表动作的承受者
words.mnemonic_zh: 得到提名的人
words.example_en: The nominee for the post has rich experience.
words.example_zh: 该职位的被提名人有丰富的经验。
words.en_def: A person named, or designated, by another, to any office, duty, or position; one nominated, or proposed, by others for office or for election to office.

words.mnemonic_zh: 不管怎样，还是
words.example_en: The weather was bad; nonetheless, they went on the trip.
words.example_zh: 天气很糟糕，但他们仍然去旅行了。
words.en_def: Nevertheless.

words.mnemonic_zh: 没有意义的话就是废话
words.example_en: Don't talk nonsense and focus on the work.
words.example_zh: 别胡说八道了，专心工作。
words.en_def: Letters or words, in writing or speech, that have no meaning or pattern or seem to have no meaning.

sentences.en: After my father had a stroke, every time he tried to talk, it sounded like nonsense.
sentences.zh: 我父亲中风后，每次他想说话，听起来都是废话。

sentences.en: He says that I stole his computer, but that's just nonsense.
sentences.zh: 他说我偷了他的电脑，但这只是胡说八道。

words.mnemonic_zh: 可联想noon发音像“暖”，中午时候很暖和
words.example_en: They usually have lunch at noon.
words.example_zh: 他们通常在中午吃午饭。
words.en_def: The ninth hour of the day counted from sunrise; around three o'clock in the afternoon.

sentences.en: 1885, When night was at its noon I heard a voice chanting the Koran in sweetest accents — Sir Richard Burton, The Book of the Thousand Nights and One Night, Night 17:
sentences.zh: 1885 年，当夜晚正午时分，我听到一个声音用最甜美的口音吟诵着《古兰经》——理查德·伯顿爵士，《千夜与一夜之书》，第 17 夜：

words.mnemonic_zh: 可联想“normal”（正常的），符合标准才正常
words.example_en: Social norms play an important role in our life.
words.example_zh: 社会规范在我们生活中起着重要作用。
words.en_def: That which is normal or typical.

sentences.en: Unemployment is the norm in this part of the country.
sentences.zh: 失业是该国这一地区的常态。

sentences.en: Not eating your children is just one of those societal norms.
sentences.zh: 不吃孩子只是社会规范之一。

words.mnemonic_zh: 能够被注意到的，就是显著的
words.example_en: There is a notable change in his attitude.
words.example_zh: 他的态度有显著变化。
words.en_def: A person or thing of distinction.

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，表“显著地”等含义
words.mnemonic_zh: notable的副词形式，表示显著地
words.example_en: Several students did well, notably Tom.
words.example_zh: 有几个学生表现出色，尤其是汤姆。
words.en_def: (focus) As a pointed example; in a notable manner.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音像“闹特”，特别的提醒，就像笔记便条
words.example_en: She left a note on the table for her mother.
words.example_zh: 她在桌子上给她妈妈留了张便条。
words.en_def: (heading) A symbol or annotation.

sentences.en: a poet of note
sentences.zh: 著名诗人

sentences.en: If you look to the left, you can note the old cathedral.
sentences.zh: 如果你向左看，你会注意到古老的大教堂。

sentences.en: We noted his speech.
sentences.zh: 我们注意到他的讲话。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示能够……的
words.mnemonic_zh: 能被注意到的，就是显著的
words.example_en: There is a noticeable change in his attitude towards work.
words.example_zh: 他对工作的态度有了明显的改变。
words.en_def: Capable of being seen or noticed.

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，用于形容词后构成副词
words.mnemonic_zh: notice（注意）加 ly 变成副词，明显地被注意到
words.example_en: The temperature has dropped noticeably in the last few days.
words.example_zh: 最近几天温度明显下降了。
words.en_def: (manner) In a noticeable way.

sentences.en: We all saw it: he paled noticeably.
sentences.zh: 我们都看到了：他脸色明​​显苍白。

sentences.en: It suddenly became noticeably cooler when the sun went behind a cloud.
sentences.zh: 当太阳躲到云层后面时，天气突然变得明显凉爽。

sentences.en: Noticeably, what had been merely annoying to her was becoming infuriating.
sentences.zh: 值得注意的是，原本让她烦恼的事情变得令人恼火。

words.mnemonic_zh: 使别人注意、知晓，就是通知
words.example_en: Please notify me as soon as you get the result.
words.example_zh: 你一拿到结果就请通知我。
words.en_def: To give (someone) notice (of some event).

sentences.en: Once a decision has been reached and notified to the parties it becomes binding.
sentences.zh: 一旦做出决定并通知各方，该决定就具有约束力。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: 对事物的认识形成概念、想法
words.example_en: He has a strange notion about marriage.
words.example_zh: 他对婚姻有个奇怪的想法。
words.en_def: Mental apprehension of whatever may be known, thought, or imagined; idea, concept.

sentences.en: Yankee notions
sentences.zh: 洋基观念

sentences.en: I have a notion to do it.
sentences.zh: 我有一个想法要做。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，具有……性质的
words.cn_def: 臭名昭著的，声名狼藉的
words.mnemonic_zh: 因坏名声而知名，就是臭名昭著的
words.example_en: The area is notorious for its high crime rate.
words.example_zh: 这个地区因高犯罪率而臭名昭著。
words.en_def: Widely known, especially for something negative; infamous.

words.mnemonic_zh: 不管怎样都要面对，就是尽管
words.example_en: Notwithstanding the bad weather, they went on a picnic.
words.example_zh: 尽管天气不好，他们还是去野餐了。
words.en_def: An instance of the word "notwithstanding", often characteristic of legalese.

sentences.en: He, notwithstanding, persisted in his inquiries.
sentences.zh: 尽管如此，他还是坚持询问。

words.mnemonic_zh: 小说往往有新故事，nov 表示新
words.example_en: She is reading a famous novel in her free time.
words.example_zh: 她空闲时正在读一本著名的小说。
words.en_def: Newly made, formed or evolved; having no precedent; of recent origin; new.

words.mnemonic_zh: 直接记忆，数字的意思
words.example_en: The number of students in this class is 30.
words.example_zh: 这个班的学生数量是 30 人。
words.en_def: An abstract entity used to describe quantity.

sentences.en: Zero, one, −1, 2.5, and pi are all numbers.
sentences.zh: 零、一、-1、2.5 和 pi 都是数字。

sentences.en: The number 8 is usually made with a single stroke.
sentences.zh: 数字8通常是用一笔画出来的。

sentences.en: The equation e^{i\pi}+1=0 includes the most important numbers: 1, 0, \pi, i, and e.
sentences.zh: 方程 e^{i\pi}+1=0 包括最重要的数字：1、0、\pi、i 和 e。

words.mnemonic_zh: 和数量有关，就是数量多、众多的
words.example_en: There are numerous reasons for his failure.
words.example_zh: 他失败有众多原因。
words.en_def: Indefinitely large numerically, many.

sentences.en: There are numerous definitions of the word 'man'.
sentences.zh: “人”这个词有多种定义。

words.mnemonic_zh: 养育孩子或植物的地方，就是托儿所或苗圃
words.example_zh: The children are happy in the nursery.
words.example_en: 孩子们在托儿所里很开心。
words.en_def: A place where nursing or the raising of children is carried on.

sentences.en: Commerce is the nursery of seamen.
sentences.zh: 商业是海员的摇篮。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘nutri’像‘牛奶’，牛奶有营养，加‘tion’成名词
words.example_en: Proper nutrition is essential for good health.
words.example_zh: 合理的营养对身体健康至关重要。
words.en_def: The organic process by which an organism assimilates food and uses it for growth and maintenance.

words.mnemonic_zh: ‘nutri’营养，加‘al’成营养的形容词
words.example_en: This meal provides balanced nutritional value.
words.example_zh: 这顿饭提供了均衡的营养价值。
words.en_def: Of, pertaining to, or providing nutrition.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘nutri’营养，加‘ous’变有营养的
words.example_en: Fruits and vegetables are very nutritious foods.
words.example_zh: 水果和蔬菜是非常有营养的食物。
words.en_def: (of food or drink) Providing nutrients; healthy to eat.

words.mnemonic_zh: ‘obese’发音像‘我必死’，胖到‘我必死’
words.example_en: Obese people are more likely to have health problems.
words.example_zh: 肥胖的人更有可能出现健康问题。
words.en_def: Extremely overweight, especially: weighing more than 20% (for men) or 25% (for women) over their ideal weight determined by height and build; or, having a body mass index over 30 kg/m2.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示性质、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘obes’似‘obese’肥胖，加‘ity’变名词
words.example_en: The obesity rate has been rising in recent years.
words.example_zh: 近年来肥胖率一直在上升。
words.en_def: The state of being obese due to an excess of body fat.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘ob’反对，‘ject’扔，把反对意见扔出来
words.example_en: He raised an objection to the new policy.
words.example_zh: 他对新政策提出了反对意见。
words.en_def: The act of objecting.

sentences.en: I have no objection to any person's religion.
sentences.zh: 我不反对任何人的宗教信仰。

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，表示方式、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘ob’‘ject’组成‘object’物体，客观存在，加后缀成副词
words.example_en: We should evaluate the situation objectively.
words.example_zh: 我们应该客观地评估形势。
words.en_def: In an impartial, objective manner.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示具有…性质的、属于…的
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘ob’加强，‘lig’捆绑，被捆绑有必须做的义务
words.example_en: Wearing a seat - belt in the car is obligatory.
words.example_zh: 在汽车里系安全带是必须的。
words.en_def: Imposing obligation, legally, morally, or otherwise; binding; mandatory.

sentences.en: an obligatory promise
sentences.zh: 义务的承诺

words.mnemonic_zh: ‘ob’加强，‘lig’捆绑，加强捆绑就是迫使
words.example_en: The law obliges parents to send their children to school.
words.example_zh: 法律迫使父母送孩子上学。
words.en_def: To constrain someone by force or by social, moral or legal means.

sentences.en: I am obliged to report to the police station every week.
sentences.zh: 我有义务每周到警察局报到。

sentences.en: He obliged me by not parking his car in the drive.
sentences.zh: 他答应了我的要求，没有把他的车停在车道上。

sentences.en: I am obliged to you for your recent help.
sentences.zh: 我很感谢你最近的帮助。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态或结果
words.mnemonic_zh: ‘ob’加强，‘serv’观察，加强观察形成观察结果
words.example_en: Scientists made careful observation of the stars.
words.example_zh: 科学家们对星星进行了仔细的观测。
words.en_def: The act of observing, and the fact of being observed (see observance)

words.mnemonic_zh: “of”音似“哦福”，想到有福之人的所属
words.example_en: The cover of the book is very beautiful.
words.example_zh: 这本书的封面非常漂亮。
words.en_def: Expressing distance or motion.

sentences.en: I have a house and a car.
sentences.zh: 我有房子和汽车。

sentences.en: Do you have the key? (not necessarily one's own key)
sentences.zh: 你有钥匙吗？ （不一定是自己的密钥）

sentences.en: I have a really mean boss.
sentences.zh: 我有一个非常刻薄的老板。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“拗夫”，像拗开丈夫，有离开之意
words.example_en: He took his hat off and greeted us.
words.example_zh: 他摘下帽子向我们打招呼。
words.en_def: (usually in phrases such as 'from the off', 'at the off', etc.) Beginning; starting point.

sentences.en: He has been very obviously an untrustworthy narrator right from the off.
sentences.zh: 显然，他从一开始就是一个不值得信任的叙述者。

sentences.en: He got in the way so I had him offed.
sentences.zh: 他妨碍了我，所以我把他开除。

sentences.en: Can you off the light?
sentences.zh: 你能把灯关掉吗？

words.mnemonic_zh: “offer”音近“欧佛”，像欧洲佛爷给予帮助
words.example_en: The hotel offers free breakfast to guests.
words.example_zh: 酒店为客人提供免费早餐。
words.en_def: A proposal that has been made.

sentences.en: I decline your offer to contract.
sentences.zh: 我拒绝你的合同提议。

sentences.en: His offer was $3.50 per share.
sentences.zh: 他的报价为每股 3.50 美元。

sentences.en: His first letter was not a real offer, but an attempt to determine interest.
sentences.zh: 他的第一封信并不是真正的要约，而是试图确定兴趣。

words.suffix_cn: 名词或动词后缀，表动作或正在进行
words.mnemonic_zh: 由“offer”加“ing”，表示提供的东西
words.example_en: The temple received many offerings from believers.
words.example_zh: 寺庙收到了信徒们的许多供奉。
words.en_def: To propose or express one's willingness (to do something).

sentences.en: She offered to help with her homework.
sentences.zh: 她主动提出帮助她做作业。

sentences.en: Everybody offered an opinion.
sentences.zh: 大家纷纷发表意见。

sentences.en: He offered use of his car for the week.  He offered his good will for the Councilman's vote.
sentences.zh: 他愿意使用他的汽车一周。 他对议员的投票表达了良好的意愿。

words.mnemonic_zh: “office”音似“欧费斯”，欧洲费钱的办公场所
words.example_en: He works in an office downtown.
words.example_zh: 他在市中心的一间办公室工作。
words.en_def: A ceremonial duty or service, particularly:

sentences.en: When the office of Secretary of State is vacant, its duties fall upon an official within the department.
sentences.zh: 当国务卿职位空缺时，其职责由部门内的一名官员承担。

sentences.en: She held office as secretary of state until she left office to run for office.
sentences.zh: 她担任国务卿直至卸任竞选公职。

sentences.en: The office of the Secretary of State is cleaned when it is vacant.
sentences.zh: 国务卿办公室在空缺时进行清洁。

words.suffix_cn: 副词后缀，表示方式、程度等
words.mnemonic_zh: 从“office”衍生，办公室做事很正式
words.example_en: The event was officially announced last week.
words.example_zh: 该活动上周正式宣布。
words.en_def: In an official manner; according to official rules or regulations.

sentences.en: That’s it! I’m officially outraged.
sentences.zh: 就是这样！ 我正式感到愤怒。

words.mnemonic_zh: “off”离开母体，“spring”涌出，即后代
words.example_en: The lioness protects her offspring fiercely.
words.example_zh: 母狮猛烈地保护着它的幼崽。
words.en_def: A person's daughter(s) and/or son(s); a person's children.

sentences.en: Artists often treasure their works as their immortal offspring.
sentences.zh: 艺术家常常将他们的作品视为不朽的后代。

words.mnemonic_zh: “omit”音似“我没提”，没提就是省略
words.example_en: You can omit this part in your report.
words.example_zh: 你可以在报告中省略这部分。
words.en_def: To leave out or exclude.

words.suffix_cn: 名词或动词后缀，表动作或正在进行
words.mnemonic_zh: “open”加“ing”，表示打开后的开口
words.example_en: The opening of the concert was amazing.
words.example_zh: 音乐会的开场非常精彩。
words.en_def: To make something accessible or allow for passage by moving from a shut position.

sentences.en: Turn the doorknob to open the door.
sentences.zh: 转动门把手打开门。

sentences.en: He opened a path through the undergrowth.
sentences.zh: 他在灌木丛中开辟了一条路。

sentences.en: I don't want to open that subject.
sentences.zh: 我不想打开这个话题。

words.mnemonic_zh: “open”加“ly”，打开心扉，公开坦率
words.example_en: He talked openly about his problems.
words.example_zh: 他坦率地谈论了自己的问题。
words.en_def: In an open manner, visibly, not covertly.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、过程、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: oper（工作）+ ation，工作的过程即操作
words.example_en: The operation of this machine requires special skills.
words.example_zh: 这台机器的操作需要特殊技能。
words.en_def: The method by which a device performs its function.

sentences.en: The Katrina relief operation was considered botched.
sentences.zh: 卡特里娜飓风救援行动被认为是拙劣的。

sentences.en: They run a multinational produce-supply operation.
sentences.zh: 他们经营跨国生产供应业务。

sentences.en: She had an operation to remove her appendix.
sentences.zh: 她接受了阑尾切除手术。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与……有关的
words.mnemonic_zh: oper（操作）+ ational，和操作有关的
words.example_en: The new system will be operational next month.
words.example_zh: 新系统将于下个月投入使用。
words.en_def: Of or relating to operations, especially military operations.

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: oppos（相反）+ ition，处于相反状态即反对
words.example_en: There is strong opposition to the new policy.
words.example_zh: 对这项新政策有强烈的反对意见。
words.en_def: The action of opposing or of being in conflict.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“我选它”，表示选择
words.example_en: Many students opt to study abroad for better education.
words.example_zh: 许多学生选择出国留学以接受更好的教育。
words.en_def: To choose; select.

sentences.en: He opted not to go.
sentences.zh: 他选择不去。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示与……有关的
words.mnemonic_zh: opt（视觉）+ ical，和视觉有关的
words.example_en: This optical instrument can magnify small objects.
words.example_zh: 这种光学仪器可以放大微小物体。
words.en_def: Of, or relating to sight; visual.

sentences.en: Strabismus is an optical defect.
sentences.zh: 斜视是一种光学缺陷。

sentences.en: A microscope is an optical instrument.
sentences.zh: 显微镜是一种光学仪器。

sentences.en: Refraction is an optical effect.
sentences.zh: 折射是一种光学效应。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示主义、学说、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: optim（最好）+ ism，总往最好处想即乐观
words.example_en: His optimism helps him overcome many difficulties.
words.example_zh: 他的乐观主义帮助他克服了许多困难。
words.en_def: A tendency to expect the best, or at least, a favourable outcome

sentences.en: I love her youth, her beauty and above all her optimism that everything will turn out fine.
sentences.zh: 我爱她的青春、她的美丽，最重要的是她对一切都会好起来的乐观态度。

words.mnemonic_zh: optim（最好）+ ist，总往最好处想的人
words.example_en: An optimist always sees the bright side of things.
words.example_zh: 乐观主义者总是看到事情的光明面。
words.en_def: A person who expects a favourable outcome

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“哦，口”，和口有关，即口头的
words.example_en: They had an oral agreement but no written contract.
words.example_zh: 他们有一个口头协议，但没有书面合同。
words.en_def: A spoken test or examination, particularly in a language class.

sentences.en: We've got our Spanish oral tomorrow.
sentences.zh: 明天我们有西班牙语口语。

sentences.en: I gave my boyfriend oral for the first time on his birthday.
sentences.zh: 我在男朋友生日那天第一次给他口交。

sentences.en: oral hygiene
sentences.zh: 口腔卫生

words.mnemonic_zh: 可联想人体器官，便于记忆
words.example_en: The heart is an important organ in the body.
words.example_zh: 心脏是人体重要的器官。
words.en_def: A larger part of an organism, composed of tissues that perform similar functions.

sentences.en: bodily organs
sentences.zh: 身体器官

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、结果
words.mnemonic_zh: organ（组织）+ ization，组织起来的结果
words.example_en: This organization aims to protect the environment.
words.example_zh: 这个组织旨在保护环境。
words.en_def: The quality of being organized.

sentences.en: This painting shows little organization at first glance, but little by little the structure becomes clear.
sentences.zh: 这幅画乍一看没有什么组织，但渐渐地结构就清晰了。

sentences.en: The organization of the book is as follows.
sentences.zh: 本书的结构如下。

sentences.en: In response to the crisis, the nations in the region formed an organization.   If you want to be part of this organization, you have to follow its rules.
sentences.zh: 为了应对危机，该地区国家成立了一个组织。 如果你想成为这个组织的一部分，你就必须遵守它的规则。

words.mnemonic_zh: organ（组织）加后缀表与组织有关的
words.example_en: The company has made some organizational changes recently.
words.example_zh: 公司最近进行了一些组织上的变革。
words.en_def: Of, relating to, or produced by an organization.

sentences.en: He lacks organizational skills.
sentences.zh: 他缺乏组织能力。

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示行为、状态
words.mnemonic_zh: orient（定位）加后缀表定位等相关概念
words.example_en: New students need an orientation to the campus.
words.example_zh: 新生需要熟悉一下校园环境。
words.en_def: The determination of the relative position of something or someone.

sentences.en: The homing instinct in pigeons is an example of orientation.
sentences.zh: 鸽子的归巢本能就是定向的一个例子。

words.mnemonic_zh: 本身就表示起源，可联想事物最初的样子
words.example_en: The origin of this custom is unknown.
words.example_zh: 这个习俗的起源无人知晓。
words.en_def: The beginning of something.

words.mnemonic_zh: origin（起源）加后缀变成使起源，即发起等意思
words.example_en: The idea originated from a small meeting.
words.example_zh: 这个想法源自一次小型会议。
words.en_def: To cause to be, to bring into existence; to produce, initiate.

sentences.en: The scheme originated with the governor and council.
sentences.zh: 该计划最初由州长和议会发起。

words.mnemonic_zh: other（其他）加wise表以其他方式，即否则等义
words.example_zh: You should wear a coat, otherwise you'll catch a cold.
words.example_en: 你应该穿件外套，否则会感冒的。
words.en_def: Other than supposed; different.

sentences.en: He said he didn’t do it, but the evidence was otherwise.
sentences.zh: 他说他没有这么做，但证据却并非如此。

sentences.en: Could I do otherwise than smile?.
sentences.zh: 除了微笑我还能做什么吗？

sentences.en: I’m not well today, otherwise I would have helped.  You have to open your umbrella, otherwise you'll get wet.
sentences.zh: 我今天身体不太好，否则我会帮忙的。 你必须打开你的伞，否则你会被淋湿。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“奥特”，可联想奥特曼从里面出来，即向外
words.example_en: The kids ran out to play.
words.example_zh: 孩子们跑出去玩耍了。
words.en_def: A means of exit, escape, reprieve, etc.

sentences.en: They wrote the law to give those organizations an out.
sentences.zh: 他们制定了法律来给这些组织一个机会。

sentences.en: A Brazilian company outed the new mobile phone design.
sentences.zh: 一家巴西公司推出了新的手机设计。

sentences.en: I'm sorry, Mr Smith is out at the moment.
sentences.zh: 抱歉，史密斯先生现在不在。

words.mnemonic_zh: out（向外）+ break（打破），打破界限向外，即爆发
words.example_en: There was an outbreak of flu in the city.
words.example_zh: 这座城市爆发了流感。
words.en_def: An eruption; the sudden appearance of a rash, disease, etc.

sentences.en: Any epidemic outbreak causes understandable panic.
sentences.zh: 任何流行病的爆发都会引起可以理解的恐慌。

sentences.en: There has been an outbreak of broken windows in the street.
sentences.zh: 街上发生了窗户破损的事件。

sentences.en: There has been an outbreak of vandalism at the school.
sentences.zh: 学校内爆发了破坏公物事件。

words.mnemonic_zh: out（向外）+ come（来），出来的东西，即结果
words.example_en: We're waiting for the outcome of the experiment.
words.example_zh: 我们在等待实验的结果。
words.en_def: That which is produced or occurs as a result of an event or process.

sentences.en: A quality automobile is the outcome of the work of skilled engineers and thousands of workers.
sentences.zh: 高质量的汽车是熟练工程师和数千名工人工作的成果。

sentences.en: Three is a possible outcome of tossing a six-sided die.
sentences.zh: 三是掷六面骰子的可能结果。

sentences.en: The outcomes of this course are outlined in your syllabus.
sentences.zh: 本课程的成果已在您的教学大纲中概述。

words.mnemonic_zh: out（向外）+ go（走）+ ing，向外走的，引申为外向的
words.example_en: She has an outgoing personality and makes friends easily.
words.example_zh: 她性格外向，很容易交朋友。
words.en_def: To go out, to set forth.

sentences.en: Tom is very outgoing and enjoys meeting people; his brother, on the other hand, is painfully shy.
sentences.zh: 汤姆非常外向，喜欢结识朋友； 另一方面，他的兄弟却非常害羞。

sentences.en: Is there any outgoing post?
sentences.zh: 有没有出去的帖子？

sentences.en: The outgoing politician wasn't too disappointed he'd lost the election; he was tired of political infighting.
sentences.zh: 这位即将卸任的政客并没有对自己在选举中落败感到太失望。 他厌倦了政治内讧。

words.mnemonic_zh: out（向外）+ go（走）+ ing，向外走的活动，即旅行
words.example_en: They had a great outing in the countryside.
words.example_zh: 他们在乡下度过了一次很棒的短途旅行。
words.en_def: To eject; to expel.

sentences.en: A Brazilian company outed the new mobile phone design.
sentences.zh: 一家巴西公司推出了新的手机设计。

words.mnemonic_zh: 向外让东西出去的地方，就是出口
words.example_en: The water flows out through the outlet at the bottom of the tank.
words.example_zh: 水通过水箱底部的出口流出。
words.en_def: A vent or similar passage to allow the escape of something.

words.mnemonic_zh: 向外看，看到的就是对事物的观点和展望
words.example_en: His outlook on life is very positive and inspiring.
words.example_zh: 他对生活的态度非常积极且鼓舞人心。
words.en_def: A place from which something can be viewed.

sentences.en: Perched on the edge of the cliff was a hidden outlook.
sentences.zh: 悬崖边上有一个隐藏的景观。

sentences.en: He has a positive outlook on life.
sentences.zh: 他有着积极的人生观。

sentences.en: The outlook for temperature rises is worrying.
sentences.zh: 气温上升的前景令人担忧。

words.mnemonic_zh: 数量上超过对方
words.example_en: The supporters of the new policy outnumber those of the old one.
words.example_zh: 新政策的支持者在数量上超过了旧政策的支持者。
words.en_def: (stative) to be more in number than somebody or something.

sentences.en: Women outnumbered men by two to one.
sentences.zh: 女性人数与男性人数之比为二比一。

words.mnemonic_zh: 超出正常愤怒，就是极度愤怒
words.example_en: The public outrage over the injustice was widespread.
words.example_zh: 公众对这种不公正现象的愤怒情绪广泛蔓延。
words.en_def: An excessively violent or vicious attack; an atrocity.

words.mnemonic_zh: 向外的那一侧，就是外面
words.example_en: There is a beautiful garden outside the house.
words.example_zh: 房子外面有一个漂亮的花园。
words.en_def: The part of something that faces out; the outer surface.

sentences.en: He's repainting the outside of his house.
sentences.zh: 他正在重新粉刷房子的外部。

sentences.en: Her outside was stern, but inside was a heart of gold.
sentences.zh: 她外表严厉，内心却有一颗金子般的心。

sentences.en: Viewed from the outside, the building seemed unremarkable.
sentences.zh: 从外面看，这座建筑并没有什么特别之处。

words.mnemonic_zh: 处在外面一侧的人，就是局外人
words.example_en: As an outsider, he found it hard to understand the situation.
words.example_zh: 作为一个局外人，他发现很难理解这种情况。
words.en_def: One who is not part of a community or organization.

sentences.en: While the initiated easily understand the symbols, they are wholly inaccessible to outsiders.
sentences.zh: 虽然入门者很容易理解这些符号，但外人却完全无法理解它们。

sentences.en: Seeing the mess professional politicians have made of things is it any wonder the electorate is beginning to prefer outsiders.
sentences.zh: 看到职业政客把事情弄得一团糟，选民开始更喜欢局外人也就不足为奇了。

sentences.en: Johnny was an outsider at this years karate tournament, but he still managed to win second place out of sheer determination.
sentences.zh: 约翰尼在今年的空手道锦标赛上是个局外人，但他仍然凭借坚定的决心获得了第二名。

words.mnemonic_zh: 在重量或价值上超过对方
words.example_en: The benefits of the project outweigh the potential risks.
words.example_zh: 这个项目的好处超过了潜在的风险。
words.en_def: To exceed in weight or mass.

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表示被动或状态
words.mnemonic_zh: 过度挤满人的，就是过度拥挤的
words.example_en: The overcrowded subway during rush hour is really uncomfortable.
words.example_zh: 高峰时段过度拥挤的地铁真的很不舒服。
words.en_def: To fill beyond reasonable limits, with people, animals, objects or information.

words.mnemonic_zh: 做事情超过了限度
words.example_en: Don't overdo it, or you'll get exhausted.
words.example_zh: 别做得太过，否则你会筋疲力尽的。
words.en_def: To do too much; to exceed what is proper or true in doing; to carry too far.

sentences.en: I overdid the sweets during the holidays and put on some weight.
sentences.zh: 假期期间我吃太多甜食，体重也增加了一些。

sentences.en: to overdo the meat
sentences.zh: 吃太多肉

sentences.en: to overdo one’s strength
sentences.zh: 力气过大

words.mnemonic_zh: 超过账户额度支取，就是透支
words.example_en: He had an overdraft of $500 in his bank account.
words.example_zh: 他的银行账户透支了 500 美元。
words.en_def: The act of overdrawing a bank account.

sentences.en: I have an overdraft of £1234.
sentences.zh: 我透支了 1234 英镑。

sentences.en: The bank have given me an overdraft of $2000.
sentences.zh: 银行给我透支了2000美元。

words.suffix_cn: 过去分词后缀，表被动或完成
words.mnemonic_zh: over（过度）+ draw（支取），过度支取就是透支
words.example_en: His bank account is overdrawn because of excessive spending.
words.example_zh: 由于消费过度，他的银行账户透支了。
words.en_def: To withdraw more money from an account than there is credit; to make an overdraft

words.mnemonic_zh: over（过度）+ estimate（估计），过度估计就是高估
words.example_en: Don't overestimate your ability to finish the task in one day.
words.example_zh: 别高估自己一天完成这项任务的能力。
words.en_def: An estimate that is too high.

sentences.en: I overestimated the number of attendees, and bought far too much food for the party.
sentences.zh: 我高估了参加人数，为聚会买了太多食物。

words.mnemonic_zh: over（在上方）+ look（看），在上方看容易忽视细节
words.example_en: He always overlooks some important details in his work.
words.example_zh: 他在工作中总是忽略一些重要细节。
words.en_def: A vista or point that gives a beautiful view.

sentences.en: Our hotel room overlooks the lake.
sentences.zh: 我们的酒店房间可以俯瞰湖景。

sentences.en: These errors were overlooked by the proofreaders.
sentences.zh: 这些错误被校对人员忽视了。

sentences.en: I’m not willing to overlook such bad behaviour.
sentences.zh: 我不愿意忽视这种不良行为。

words.mnemonic_zh: over（过度）加后缀表过度地
words.example_en: She is overly sensitive to criticism.
words.example_zh: 她对批评过于敏感。
words.en_def: Superficial; not thorough; careless, negligent, inattentive.

sentences.en: Parents can be overly protective of their children.
sentences.zh: 父母可能会对孩子过度保护。

words.mnemonic_zh: over（在上方）+ see（看），在上方看就是监督
words.example_en: The manager oversees the daily operations of the company.
words.example_zh: 经理监督公司的日常运营。
words.en_def: To survey, look at something in a wide angle.

sentences.en: It is congress's duty to oversee the spending of federal funds.
sentences.zh: 监督联邦资金的支出是国会的职责。

sentences.en: Gamekeepers oversee a hunting ground to see to the wildlife's welfare and look for poachers.
sentences.zh: 猎场看守人负责监管狩猎场，关注野生动物的福利并寻找偷猎者。

words.mnemonic_zh: over（超过）+ take（向前），超过向前的就是赶上
words.example_en: The car in the back tried to overtake the leading one.
words.example_zh: 后面的车试图超过领先的那辆。
words.en_def: To pass a more slowly moving object or entity.

sentences.en: The car was so slow we were overtaken by a bus.
sentences.zh: 汽车开得很慢，我们被一辆公共汽车超越了。

sentences.en: Our plans were overtaken by events.
sentences.zh: 我们的计划被事件所取代。

words.mnemonic_zh: over（翻转）+ turn（转动），转动到翻转就是推翻
words.example_en: The strong wind can overturn small boats on the lake.
words.example_zh: 大风能掀翻湖上的小船。
words.en_def: A turning over or upside-down; inversion.

words.mnemonic_zh: over（全面）+ view（看），全面看就是概述
words.example_en: The report gives an overview of the current economic situation.
words.example_zh: 这份报告概述了当前的经济形势。
words.en_def: A brief summary, as of a book or a presentation.

words.mnemonic_zh: over（过度）+ whelm（淹没），过度淹没就是压倒
words.example_en: The workload can overwhelm him sometimes.
words.example_zh: 工作量有时会让他不堪重负。
words.en_def: The state or condition of being overwhelmed.

sentences.en: The dinghy was overwhelmed by the great wave.
sentences.zh: 小艇被巨浪淹没了。

sentences.en: In December 1939 the Soviet Union attacked Finland with overwhelming force.
sentences.zh: 1939年12月，苏联以压倒性的兵力进攻芬兰。

sentences.en: He was overwhelmed with guilt.
sentences.zh: 他心里充满了愧疚。

words.mnemonic_zh: overwhelm（压倒）加后缀表压倒性的
words.example_en: They faced an overwhelming challenge in the project.
words.example_zh: 他们在项目中面临着巨大的挑战。
words.en_def: To engulf, surge over and submerge.

sentences.en: The dinghy was overwhelmed by the great wave.
sentences.zh: 小艇被巨浪淹没了。

sentences.en: In December 1939 the Soviet Union attacked Finland with overwhelming force.
sentences.zh: 1939年12月，苏联以压倒性的兵力进攻芬兰。

sentences.en: He was overwhelmed with guilt.
sentences.zh: 他心里充满了愧疚。

words.suffix_cn: 形容词后缀，表被动或完成
words.cn_def: 工作过度的；劳累过度的
words.mnemonic_zh: over（过度）+ work（工作）+ ed，工作过度就是劳累的
words.example_en: The overworked employees need more rest to recover their energy.
words.example_zh: 工作过度的员工需要更多休息来恢复精力。
words.en_def: To make (someone) work too hard.

sentences.en: to overwork a horse
sentences.zh: 让马过度劳累

sentences.en: Overworked and underpaid? Then quit your job and become a pro darts player.
sentences.zh: 工作过度且工资过低？ 然后辞掉工作，成为一名职业飞镖运动员。

sentences.en: overworked, unaffecting cliches
sentences.zh: 过度劳累、不影响人的陈词滥调

words.suffix_cn: 名词后缀，表示状态、性质
words.mnemonic_zh: own（拥有）+ ership，拥有的状态就是所有权
words.example_en: The ownership of this house has been transferred to a new owner.
words.example_zh: 这所房子的所有权已转让给了新主人。
words.en_def: The state of having complete legal control of something; possession; proprietorship.

sentences.en: The successful candidate will take ownership of all internal design projects.
sentences.zh: 成功的候选人将拥有所有内部设计项目的所有权。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“哦，zone（区域）”，臭氧存在于特定区域
words.example_en: The ozone layer plays a crucial role in protecting the Earth from UV rays.
words.example_zh: 臭氧层在保护地球免受紫外线辐射方面起着至关重要的作用。
words.en_def: An allotrope of oxygen (symbol O₃) having three atoms in the molecule instead of the usual two; it is a blue gas, generated from oxygen by electrical discharge.

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“拍的”，像能拍打的垫子
words.example_en: Put a pad under the vase to protect the table.
words.example_zh: 在花瓶下面放个垫子来保护桌子。
words.en_def: A flattened mass of anything soft, to sit or lie on.

sentences.en: May 21, 2008, Austin American-Statesman
sentences.zh: 2008年5月21日，奥斯汀美国政治家

sentences.en: to pad cloth
sentences.zh: 垫布

sentences.en: I heard her soft footsteps, pad, pad along the corridor.
sentences.zh: 我听见她轻柔的脚步声，沿着走廊，垫、垫。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“爬姆”，像用手掌爬，也可联想棕榈树形状
words.example_en: He held the coin in the palm of his hand.
words.example_zh: 他把硬币握在手掌心里。
words.en_def: Any of various evergreen trees from the family Palmae or Arecaceae, which are mainly found in the tropics.

sentences.en: John palmed the ball.
sentences.zh: 约翰用手掌接住了球。

words.mnemonic_zh: 发音似“盼哦”，盼着小组出结果，也像面板样子
words.example_en: The expert panel will discuss the new policy tomorrow.
words.example_zh: 专家小组明天将讨论新政策。
words.en_def: A (usually) rectangular section of a surface, or of a covering or of a wall, fence etc.

sentences.en: Behind the picture was a panel on the wall.
sentences.zh: 照片后面是墙上的一块面板。

sentences.en: Today’s panel includes John Smith.
sentences.zh: 今天的小组成员包括约翰·史密斯。

sentences.en: The last panel of a comic strip usually contains a punchline.
sentences.zh: 漫画的最后一格通常包含一个妙语。

words.mnemonic_zh: para（超越）+ dise（花园），超越普通花园就是天堂
words.example_en: Hawaii is often regarded as a tropical paradise.
words.example_zh: 夏威夷常被视为热带天堂。
words.morph_note: dise 并非常见词根，此处按词源简化拆解
words.en_def: The place where sanctified souls are believed to live after death.

sentences.en: Living in paradise comes with a price.
sentences.zh: 生活在天堂是有代价的。

sentences.en: an island paradise in the Caribbean; a shoppers’ paradise
sentences.zh: 加勒比海的岛屿天堂； 购物者的天堂

words.mnemonic_zh: para（旁边）+ meter（测量），辅助测量的就是参数
